But it's not what we see in the restaurant.  Over all, would not recommend. :-(

DqUaoBPuNNa6YvwMhccrCQ.text: I'd pass on this place. The glasses didn't look very clean. The food selection and quality was pretty crappy. We came for dinner. Very few selections of meat items. Everything is seperated into regions. Italy had no pasta. Asia had no typical Asian dishes. Just some fried rice and egg rolls. Tadesse came by to clean up our table, he was very friendly. He got the 2nd star in the rating.

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The &#34;Asian&#34; selection. Pretty pitiful.

DD60JWzSnEHHDaL-q-RwCg.text: For dinner, the food was decent, but not too much variety. Dessert was great! Unfortunately, our cashier Majorie was very rude and unprofessional.

ej2MpLWfsNuqRK-5mhpw_A.text: No long wait time when we went. Some food were delicious like the pasta, desserts: my favorite is the creme brulee. The naan bread wasn't warm, tabouli was dry and chicken noodle was blant & not enough chicken. Service was good. There was variety of food options from middle eastern, mexican and asian. Their seafood section didn't have seafood though. There were only two options of soup, sald bar's available. Meat & pasta were my favorite.

OtuPeFhybKHJSaOCAUYkYw.text: This is the worst Buffet ever! Not worth paying $30 a person! They Don't even serve seafood! They didn't have Crab Legs ! They only had tiny shrimps that taste soo nasty. BBQ ribs sucks taste very nasty!  Save your money!  I don't recommend this buffet at all!  The food isn't that good I rather have McDonald's (:

QMXgd4vanUyc_XlL9_QHFQ.text: Major regression in so many ways. Used to be my favorite go to at a good price. Care and effort has gone out the door. No crab no decent meats and most all the food under flavored or over cooked and tough. Beer was warm and they cut the square footage by 40-50% legit you'll be better off at a country buffet or something. Sad this place was legit. I'm pretty sure this is the buffet in Vegas vacation don't eat the blue

-x9CLJQ0srp7DWnwy6MTyQ.text: So this isn't the best buffet in Vegas, but it's much cheaper and less busy than those so definitely a solid choice if you are staying at Elara or Planet Hollywood and just want a meal, not an experience.  Went back a second time during the trip for a quick brunch, I recommend.

cxbVewLtv0IAWQsTB-K9dQ.text: YIKES!! YIKES!!! YIKES!! What happened to you Spice Market Buffet?  smaller and cramped, no crab legs and some of the section seemed to be missing..NO ITALIAN ANYMORE!!! So sad!!! You had such potential!

jchCLvMRUWgQFqWz_ZA3Qw.text: This was by far the most disappointing buffet ever! The quality of this place has gone down significantly. It felt like I was at an even cheap version of Old Country Buffet minus any food options. So we had our 24hr Buffet pass and were looking forward to come here for the Mediterranean food they advertise which was barely anything. It was filled with grilled veggies, lamb and cold sides that tasted terrible but no chicken Tikka, rice or naans were to be found. They had some "Italian" food options which only included some turkey and meat with some 1 dry pasta with no sauce. The other options were very limited with a salad bar, some Mexican stuff, and unappetizing soup that looked like it had been there the entire day. The dessert was not bad. I tried the creme brulee and thought it was pretty good. The drinks were self serve here and they had your regular sodas, juices and coffee.   Overall, definitely not worth the time or money. You would be so much better going to a restaurant and ordering good food of your choice.

1srZhJlHI97RupvEddU47w.text: This plane has mediocre food at best.  The staff is not friendly and you have to chase someone down to get your free drink included with the buffet. The wait staff leaves the dirty dishes sitting on your table the whole time you're eating and the place is filled with cigarette smoke which is not coming from customers, so staff is smoking in the kitchen. My eyes were burning from the cigarettes...don't waste your time or money.

dkYqejZLJ9HEr37TsTD03g.text: My husband and are so disappointed with this buffet, considering it was our favorite! We visit vegas at least once a year and make sure to have one meal here.  So when we first arrived we decided to have brunch there.   As you walk in everything is normal and looks like nothing much has changed since of las visit BUT it has!!!!!! It's half the size now!! And most of our favorite dishes are gone!!! No seafood, no Italian and very small variety of everything else!!   I'm sorry to say that we will not be back, it's not worth the $50.00 we paid for both the of us!

UfbccHcdTs5HjCv2zOwKJA.text: The absolute worst buffet ive ever been to. Went for breakfast. Eggs were terrible, sausage was not good, french toast was flavorless. Server did not clear dirty plates off the table. Dingy is the best word to describe it.

QUZfEotDzOxwRACymOsCHg.text: Most recently, I ate at this restaurant on July 25, 2019. Given all of the resort buffet options, I do not recommend you spend your money at this one. The best and tastiest food choice was the Mexican station--almost everything on it was flavorful. Of the other four stations only one or two items on them were tasty. Very disappointing!! I ate here many years ago--it was much better then. Either lower the price or improve the quality and taste of the food.

aqZuRFMVBFs8NUm77G1r1Q.text: $28 for dinner tonight. It was ok - best options were the teriyaki chicken and the lamb. Tri-tip was underwhelming.  Desserts were probably the most disappointing part - pre frozen cakes and pastries from Costco.  I went to Bachannal last week and I would recommend to spend the extra money and go there to have a truly great buffet experience. Service was good and employees were courteous here at spice market. Veronica at the register was really nice. I will probably give this place a try for breakfast sometime

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Sa2R2FcLhzLJb_eAU3PoGA.text: Worst buffet to eat at in Vegas, took my mother here and must I say the food selection was horrendous. Online it looks good thought I'll give it a try with my mother who came from Northern California. And neither of us liked it , by far nothing impressed me eating at this buffet for the first time . Most definitely will I never in my right mind go back there to eat ever. So think about it before u eat here , and try somewhere different not only for you but your tastebuds also .

ZMt2RbWhlUSEcl3HvsjXrw.text: The buffet was one of the worst I have had. The food was not hot, the flavor was not there and service was non existent. Much of the food I sampled was uneatable. I have nothing else to say it was a terrible experience.

7o5838bM_Np2IPOQXhrQhw.text: This buffet is just ok.   Nothing here stood out from anything I've ever had. Nothing had me blown away or even impressed.   They've got plenty dishes to choose ranging from curry chicken, quesadillas, fish n chips, steamed mussels, peel and eat shrimp, Mexican corn, ribs, fried rice,  etc. Really everything you can think of and all mediocre!   The only thing that was exceptionally good was the smoothies! They were thick and creamy and tasted of ripe fruits.   The worst is they WILL NOT heat your crablegs unless you are a diamond/platinum member. OUCH! It made it even worse that the crablegs were cut open with ice cold water soaked into them.   Service was great for the 1st hr then after that they forget about you, hubbie had to flag down the waiter at least 4x!  I won't eat here again, thank goodness I had a groupon.

GouVqvqAdlfpqRed2zpGiw.text: Located on the lower level of Planet Hollywood. We found an online deal through travelzoo which was reasonable. Dinner included soda, you can purchase unlimited beer and wine packages but we were just looking for some good food at this point. It was 8-9pm and there was minimal wait. Staff was very friendly from the front desk to our waitress. Service was excellent.   Immediately it became obvious that most of the food was not fresh. I don't care much for crab legs (I know, gasp!) but I definitely wouldn't have wanted any after I saw the crab legs coming straight out of a large white utility bucket - uggh, so unappetizing. They had some peel and eat shrimp but I was too lazy for that and honestly didn't trust the seafood after I saw what the crab legs came out of.   The salad and Mexican taco/burrito bars were standard but had quite a bit of brown lettuce. The macaroni and cheese was flavorful and creamy and I did enjoy this. My husband enjoyed a piece of prime rib. The desert was basic and unimpressive for a Vegas buffet. The ice cream melted quick and was watery.   If we would've paid full price for this buffet, I would've been upset. This buffet is definitely not up to par for Vegas, needs a lot of work. I would avoid it with so many other options for dinner on the Strip. Would rate the food 2/5 but service was 4/5.

0WMQA3Wf-1hYTgS8GmVgzQ.text: This was our last buffet before our "Buffet of Buffets" pass expired.   We arrived around 4pm. After getting the green light from the cashiers we waited in a line to be seated. We waited for about 10 mins, which we thought was quite long because there were open tables available! We also did not get much service from our server. Nevertheless, we were eventually seated and ready to explore the buffet.  Spice Market Buffet had an excellent variety of food to choose from. They rival even Rio's! I really liked their lamb kabobs and pesto pasta. The asian selection was also great and they had jasmine rice in mini togo boxes which was "cute" remarked my cousin.   This buffet had delicious food but their slow service was disappointing. I would visit again, depending on the price.  My ranking of buffets 1. Le Village Buffet (Paris) 2. Carnival World Buffet (Rio) 3. Spice Market Buffet (Planet Hollywood) 4. Flavors the Buffet (Harrah's)  Didn't get to try the Paradise Garden Buffet at the Flamingo because we were too full!

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Finishing up with a dessert
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of my many plates
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood section

mVd_rhbARAGKgyc01TfIBA.text: $40 for person   $15 each all you can drink ... This place is a buffet with different types of food (Mexican ,Japanese,Italian and middle eastern section and more )..

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 persons $120

qJ5g4QHuV3DzCUxPAZfntA.text: We were staying at Planet Hollywood for our honeymoon February 2017. I had seen the infomercial about this buffet while staying there. I begged my husband to take me, which he did.  We ate there in Thursday night, around 10pm and noticed it was a bit empty. I thought perhaps it was because it's late?  We were seated and we're pleased to see a great variety of food, Chinese, Mexican, American, Mediterranean, Italian and seafood.   We decided to try a plate of each. The food was cold, no flavor, just lacked taste. We tried everything on the menu with the hopes of finding something tasty. We decided to leave 20 minutes in, and asked to speak with the manager.  My husband explained how bad our experience was and he said he could not give us a full refund, approximately $70. He said it had been more than 20 minutes. My husband continued to explain the experience we had and the manager decided to speak with the waitress. After he verified with her that we had served twice and 90% of the food was thrown he gave us two options: offered us a voucher to go the next day for breakfast or lunch, or half a refund.  We opted for half a refund.

7kp21coh7rBShnZxFW8iIA.text: Food: poor (including but not limited to: american, mexican, italian, seafood ... 1st ever miso soup i didnt enjoy ... The soups werent labeled ... There is more, i will curtail commentary there.) Drink: poor (first ever buffet that did not carry tomato juice) Serv: below average speed (ten minutes from arrival to seating) Music: below average Price: average Other: i rely on google maps to find places.  I spent fifteen minutes seemingly right on the dot with no success.  Made two phone calls to their management.  Was given incorrect directions.  45 minute jog to get to the building; 30 minutes and 2 phone calls to arrive.

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No labels on what the soups were either.  The first miso soup I ever didnt finish.

1Qy7oerNHdYpEYnIVW2Xdg.text: I've been coming here for many years when planet Hollywood was the Aladdin... it was amazing... sadly no more... its slowly been going downhill... I came here tonight with family who are visiting from overseas.. very disappointing... it'll be a long time before I return

J6LQccnxI96Gbe--fczOxg.text: One of the more affordable casino buffets on the strip.   Keep an eye out for deal on groupon for around $22 per person.  Try: Everything

KgGwzkCvqF_136_KFbDaDw.text: I'm giving this place one star because the service is awful. I've been here before and I have never had such awful service such as this time. The waitress who is supposed to clean our table off told us that she is "busy" and did not tend to our table. Her name is Janet. The manager who came over to speak with us by the name of "cookie" was very short with us and told us that we cannot be seated at a booth because we werent "platinum members".  Finally after being seated at a booth anyways, none of the waiters/waitresses came and got our drink orders. We wound up asking for a refund because of how were being treated and they said they had to call "cookie" back down and she didn't even have enough decency to come face us again so she just had them issue it. This took place memorial day weekend May 28th, 2017. I love PH but I will not be back to their buffet.

kGiBvIEh4TXxkzjd7-dtVw.text: Awful! This used to be our favorite buffet in Vegas but they have since taken out buffet stations, no more seafood station, no more crab legs and desserts leave much to be desired. Spoke with a waiter who agreed that the buffet has taken a turn for the worse in the last year or so. Replacing food stations with drink machines?! Are u kidding me?

B6TzVRpq19hNt_JcRWd4ug.text: This buffet is terrible. I didn't even have to pay for it and I was still disappointed. It's so bad.

00K4GR9vHJ909WnbteLOdA.text: It is my second time trying this buffet, once for dinner, and once for brunch.   Dinner: The food was alright, there was plenty of options to chose from, and the service was good.  Brunch: Disappointing honestly. I feel like for a buffet on the strip, and for $25 per person, the options should have been better than any regular hotel/inn breakfast options. Also, the food's taste wasn't as good as you would think.  I would go to the local spots instead next time.

oMvlVAfiv1yhgzGQkycBNw.text: Ate breakfast here. Service was good. However, the selection was limited. Freshly made omelets were delicious. However, there are NO GLUTEN FREE options and their food is not marked for allergens.

HknnwCaVX_Y-4jxmfElbYQ.text: Spice Market quality is way up, but the selection is way down.  I am a buffet snob. I have gone to Vegas buffets 3 to 12 times per year for the past 20 years. I believe in quality, not just quantity. If I am going to eat 5000 calories and gain a pound or two, it had better not be lousy food.  The Spice Market at Planet Hollywood has been marginal for many years. Very large selection, but low quality preparation. They made management changes after being acquired by Caesar's and produced a major upgrade in the quality of their food earlier this year. Then they had a big flood in July.  When they remodeled, they eliminated their seafood and Italian selections along with cutting other offerings, to hold prices down. Lunch is now $20 and dinner $26. Dinner used to be $35. Bellagio is $28 and $39 and Caesar's is $55 and $65. If you don't find something you like in the the limited selections offered, or you expect a $65 meal for a $20 price, you will likely be disappointed. Other recent Yelp reviews seem to reflect these unrealistic expectations.  There are fewer selections, and no crab or shrimp, but what they do serve is very well prepared and seasoned. I have been there twice in the past 6 months, both before the flood and after.  Five of us tried about 40 different dishes and desserts. Everything was cooked to perfection and had great taste. The only Item that was not excellent was the beef brisket, which always seems a little tough when you are expecting prime rib. Both the dessert selections and quality are very good, but there is no gelato or ice cream, only frozen custard.  The "M" buffet was pretty good for years, but they got a new chef and it has now become the best buffet in Vegas for the the past two years. Especially considering the price. $17 for lunch and $25 for dinner weekdays. The selection is huge, the quality is very good, and the desserts are to die for. They even have free beer and wine.  Bellagio has always set the benchmark for quality, but it seems to be slipping lately and their prices are rising rapidly. Wynn is good, but overpriced. Caesar's is very overpriced and has problems with crowd management at the carving stations, crowd noise due to background music, and the dessert selection is poor.  The Red Rock is still the best $10-$16 buffet, but it has been slipping a little lately. Mirage was OK several years ago when they remodeled, but I haven't been there lately, and I understand the Palms just opened a new buffet which I haven't tried. The last time I went there it was good food, but not many choices. Aria, Mandalay, Paris, Harrah's, Monte Carlo, Excaliber, TI, Circus Circus, South Point, Rio, and all the Station and Boyd Gaming Casinos are boring or just plain bad. The Orleans just remodeled and  the food looks great, but everything was extremely bland. I never went to the MGM, but others, whose judgement I trust, said it was only fair.  I highly recommend you try the Planet Hollywood for a reasonably priced high quality meal, especially when compared to weekend pricing at other casino's on the strip. I also highly recommend a trip down south to the "M" for a few dollars less on the weekdays if you want a huge selection with prime rib, salmon, clams, Thai, Chinese, sushi, etc. Save room for several desserts. It's worth the drive. If you have to have crab, go to the Bellagio. It's still one of the best regardless of price.  You can use the pay for lunch, stay for dinner at the Spice Market by arriving just before 3:00. You pay $20 for lunch and get dinner too. You can do this at the "M" and the Bellagio also, but dinner starts at 2:30 pm. Most of the dishes and desserts are the same for lunch and dinner. They just bring out the prime rib and crab or other seafood for dinner.

Kbe0mxzYPhoPug6iVXDLow.text: No..no and no..I will never come here again. The food come was very limited especially for the price and I got such off of it. The only bonus is that it came with a free mimosa and you were about to bring your drink in.

afNap76ud7_q5BGNURWg7A.text: This was my Family's favorite buffet when we would visit Las Vegas, but we were really disappointed to find out they made the buffet waaaaay smaller. Honestly, the food is okay, but they took off many sections that they had before. There used to be such great variety here, but that quickly changed within a year. I suggest you find a new buffet spot in Vegas.

P0MYYMluVzDjA93xC2ssAw.text: Overall 2.5 stars  Hummus is gross. Lamb bits GROSS! Chicken curry is edible. Naan was good. Shredded beef on the tostada - AMAZING!! Such great flavor. Chicken fajita mix - fairly tasty and luckily not dry. Sesame balls were VERY good! Drunken noodles were meh at best. Potstickers were also meh - not much flavor and what was there wasn't all that good. Homemade meatballs were delicious. Sauce was extremely tasty and meatball texture was soft and slightly chewy. Prime rib was a notch above Harrahs having better consistency, texture and overall flavor, but nowhere CLOSE to Paris.  Shrimp were good and the sauce had a spicy tang to it. Great.  Desserts: all cupcakes were completely inedible. ZERO flavor. Creme Brule was made with liquid smoke. Raspberry coulis had mild flavor but the main part tasted like bad cheesecake. Pannacotta was sadly just OK. Mild flavor but just wasn't rich enough. Raspberry Danish had wonderful flavor.   Overall, spectacular variety, very well laid out and well marked. Posh surroundings.

H-qwlWNbz6KyB1aC_ZzaUg.text: Went here for breakfast. Not bad if you're doing the buffet of buffets. There is a wide selection of food to choose from. The eggs benedict was alright. The ham was dry, and hollandaise sauce was caked on and dried like it was sitting for awhile. But I did enjoy the yogurt bar, the flat iron flank for beeakfast. I was a little disappointed that mimosas and bloody marys weren't included with the buffet of buffets. The hospitality was good. It was the quality of some of the food that made it lack a star.

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast at Spice market
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ham is a little dry. But flat iron was tender and made it worth it.

mNudbx-IWOgyk5AXr0_TMQ.text: You couldn't pay me to eat here again. Horrible selection of food. Meat was over cooked and chewy. I would never pay $30 for this garbage again.  FYI- I would suggest buying a bag of dog food and eating it before coming here.   Wish I could give 0 stars.

SuMC9sCGynXJhTI9BS7RIA.text: Very disappointing!  This used to be a great buffet but after having dinner here last night, I would not return. It's basically a large Old Country Buffet. The food quality is average at best and while they have a variety of international stations, the offerings are very basic.   I normally clean my plate and leave little waste, however I barely ate half of the foods that I selected. Additionally the service is poor - none of their workers from the cashiers, to the waitstaff, to the line cooks seem to care about the customers. They barely go thru the motions and are very slow.  An example is i grabbed a creme brulee (which wasn't very good) for dessert and I asked the attendant at the dessert area for a spoon as they only provide a fork and knife at the table. She told me they were by the soft serve ice cream machine., but there were none. I told the attendant and she told me to go to the soup area. The soup area also was out. Ended up tying to eat dessert with a fork.   This buffet brought me back to old Vegas where you'd get a somewhat crappy buffet for $9.99 - expect that now it's $30.   Skip this and go next door to the buffet at Paris or spend a few dollars more and go across the street to the buffets at Aria or Bellagio.

AdaTxd7VijhclFaQhBPwaQ.text: Terrible buffet. We went on a saturday afternoon about 2 pm and there was hardly anyone there. The food looked like it had been sitting out for a long time. The seafood selection was not very good. The salad greens looked wilted and hardly any topping choices.  Nothing special about anything else. Our server made a huge deal about my husband tipping his chair back a bit. She came yelling at him from across the restaurant and when he said ok, sorry, I won't do it again, she kept carrying on and creating a scene. It was very embarrassing.

ZGUhlqb3LTLpEuzS3MuVzw.text: We like this buffet and it is usually on Groupon these days.  Nice selection and quality, but a decent lunch price for strip location.   Of harrahs properties, this would be my recommendation if had comp points or a Groupon.

cXPiD8mHFJpXA4R0ygU2dA.text: The best breakfast you can ever get! Ask for Nina when you're there! She's the sweetest waitress you'll ever meet and make you feel at home. Good was so amazing as well! Plenty of variety! You won't regret it!

Kp5_qVdlmyIRO1chsF-J7A.text: I have no reason to give it any stars, except that it did have food, and I did get full, albeit sickeningly nasty unhealthy food full.  It wasn't good. It did have variety, but everything looked and tasted cheap, crappy, and only a little warm.  If you're paying, I wouldn't recommend for anything.  If you somehow got free tickets or comped for this buffet, head to the cheeses and meats (can't go wrong) and some good bread.  Other than that, ummm, I didn't like anything at all.  My boyfriend couldn't find a single thing to eat that was good.   All around thumbs down!

dmTAap2MG0rcbUbwCcCU6A.text: Can't believe I haven't reviewed this place! When I first began coming to Vegas (around 2006), this was my absolute favorite buffet! I mean, it was a must each time my boyfriend and I went to Vegas (2x year).  It USED TO have such fresh food and variety and such amazing dessert selections....  What a darn disappointment these last couple of times and this last time just threw me over the top.  The food has become merely edible but oh so tasteless and hardly any fresh food! I mean, we pay for dinner price yet we eat the same crap as you served lunch hours ago? Uh, I don't think so.   and CUPCAKES and COTTON CANDY? ARE YOU KIDDING ME? What a cop-out! Those aren't real desserts, give me a break. Omg let me mention their crepes.... are pre-made and the cook just heats it and stuffs it for you! If you can't make it fresh, don't offer it!  Will never ever come here again.  They ought to get rid of their "Voted Best Buffet in Vegas" from 2006 because it sure as heck does not apply anymore.

ZVk2Dps9iLp1fIyGDSxOZg.text: I went to the Spice Market inside Planet Hollywood for lunch with my family. Lunch was at 11 and was more than $30ea with a rewards discount. Soooooooooo not worth it. The food didn't look fresh and it didn't taste fresh . I wish I would have taken a picture of the Mexican food area, OMG it was gross! It just looked like the food had been sitting under lamps for hours, not appetizing at all. The desserts were stale, but the soft serve was ok. The only thing I enjoyed was the Mac and cheese, pesto pasta, and the fruit smoothie. In my opinion I would just pay a little more and go to Cesar's buffet. The only reason I gave 2 stars is our absolutely lovely server. The staff really was really nice

Yem9y1ppT9Se5fQjW8lTxw.text: It's definitely not one of the best buffets on the strip, but for the price and amount of food you squeeze down your throat, it certainly hits the spot. The middle eastern food was probably the best station with the chicken curry and tandoori chicken standing out the most. I haven't really found a buffet on the strip that impresses with the deserts, with this place not quite hitting it either. Overall was satisfying but I'm not going to be raving about it.

HHy8bdxwO3KTirMMZEF7Hw.text: I actually like this place. It's a buffet but it isn't rink a dink like a sister property a few resorts down.  I honestly was pleased with everything I ate. Lot's to choose from.  They had Mediterranean, mexican, italian, chinese and american.  (from what I remember).     I mean you can't expect the ribs to be smoked for 12 hours and made with an amazing rub...  it's not a rib place.  It's decent ribs prepared in a manner that's cost effective. As for the rest of the food.  It's good.  It's not the best stuff on earth but it's good.  The one area I wasn't too crazy about was their chinese food.   I really enjoyed their dessert section: too much to choose from.  I left uncomfortably stuffed!!  What made this extra sweet was the groupon deal I got. It saved me alot of money and included alcohol.  pretty awesome.  My big and only gripe was the way in which you are sat.  It's like...  torture almost.  You stand there in line...  pay for your buffet... then stand some more while the hostess seats you.  The place wasn't that packed either so it blew my mind at how long it took for us to be seated.    Thats the only reason I can't give a 4 star experience.

8lQ6SBrbG0Iho6VCON-jEw.text: This place lost brownie points w me during the  Thanksgiving holiday. Disgusting....ran out of food. Threw things together. Been here before and enjoyed it. But unimpressed this go around. And the service has always been lack luster. I give it a 3 star only because it's been better in the past. But they struggled with the holiday. And since Thanksgiving happens every year, why weren't they prepared??? I have concerns so we will keep you updated.

BaiemyYyP-SBY4nFvgBX5A.text: A-OK  No real complaints with this buffet.  Paid about half price with a groupon and didn't leave hungry.    Food was pretty standard Vegas Buffet fare.... crab legs, prime rib, Asian, Mexican, Italian.  Nothing really stood out but the unlimited drinks were never empty.    While I don't go to buffets for the ambiance this place was lacking.  Kind of a basement like funk with low lights and some random movie posters here and there.  If you are going to go for a theme at least go over the top like the Paris buffet.

9WNQpsegATWmWroX61S5Hw.text: This was a pretty good buffet.  We got there around 5 so just before dinner time rush.  It is a kind of weird set up where you wait in line to buy the buffet then get into another line to wait to be seated.  All in all took us 10-15 minutes to be seated.  The buffet is separated by region.  There is Italian, Mexican, soup, salad, Greek, seafood and dessert.  There was some good food and some not so good food but all in all it was tasty.  The service was pretty slow but they only had one server covering a large area. At one point a server and bus boy were having an argument and management had to come out and take care of it.  They handled everything right out on the floor which I thought was neither the time not place for that right next to our table.

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cupcake dessert section.  Also had cotton candy and assorted small pies.
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert section of the buffet.  So many tasty cupcakes

1kprdj52nfKDXu7w9lqXRQ.text: Good food & huge selection .. Around 30$ per person ! The best thing was the dessert! The least favorite part was the long wait to be seated... But it's a buffet so that comes with the style of dinning. Can't put a price on good food ! It was great

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great food ! Most important great dessert

RjHULOsTJculZavNuSvRtA.text: The employee taking the money was very rude to me and my family.  She was unclear with her instructions and where to wait in line for the server to sit you.  The another employee came over and was rude in telling us where the line was to wait for the server to seat us.  We asked are hostess that sat us if we can talk to a manager about the way we were treated and she pointed to the manager on duty.... it was the second employee that was towards us so we figured it was a lost cause to talk to him about the way he had talked to us. The food was pretty good tho.

tOSTLn8i5al9iWETDf3h-Q.text: We went here for a lunch buffet on Sunday. The place was pretty empty and we didn't have to stand in line. We also only paid $20 bucks and had some of the best food ever. They have everything here, split into the different kinds of food..   The brisket, bacon, chicken marsala, sushi, chinese food and the desseerts are the best. They even had cotton candy!! Can't beat this buffet, esp for its price.

4CYKI_GRGy5O8VhR7Y64-A.text: We had the lunch buffet with all you can drink mimosas.  The greeter offered to let us look at the food before purchasing and we should have listened to her.    Positive - our waitress was great  Negative - very expensive, food was dried out, cold when should have been warm, warm if supposed to be cold, pineapple was bruised all over.  I was surprised they put it out.  How do you screw up Mexican rice?  They figured it out.  How do you screw up bacon?  They mastered it.  Everything was gross - even the egg rolls.  I was shocked that my husband grabbed the eggs Benedict.  It was so NASTY!!  The place had few people so we should have known better.  The pico de gallo was old and obviously stored for awhile.    We should not have eaten here.  We were only here for one more day and we wasted it here.    I would never recommend this place!!

ajOiGSFiWD6uLstLjiDvUQ.text: Pathetic and stale food. The lamb skewers and chicken curry was hard, cold and tasteless respectively. Tried the crab cakes and was very disappointed. Maybe coz I have recently been spoiled living in Boston.  Update: Later that night my fried who was with me threw up and guess what the undigested contents were?   Also, this place is overpriced, with deceptive advertising. All through the casino they are advertising a $12 buffet and when you stand in a line for 5-7 minutes you get stiffed with an almost $60 charge for 2 which is prepaid - so you don't really have an option.  (FYI- this review is from April 2011. It was sitting in the 'drafts folder of my Yelp account)

GdTZzWsGvtQacO63UgXyAA.text: The food is subpar here. The Rio is way better. I came here because it's part of the Buffet of Buffets.  Go for the Cotton candy and pre-sliced crab legs. The chinese and indian stations looked very sad. I made myself fancy salads with chilled shrimp and snow crab legs.  The crepe station makes sweets only. It's really greasy compared to the Paris buffet.  It's a pretty small buffet.

0a7VQzTlqY5gfhgZHFwGWg.text: This place deserves a zero star. The food quality is terrible, horrible service.we had to wait a good 15 minutes to be seated on a very slow hour of the day. The employees are rude unhelpful and seems like they never learned how to smile.over priced terrible food. Do not waste your money.go elsewhere.

oYCt9zF-aW2ARsKwI07R_A.text: LOVED THIS PLACE! My bf and I came here for brunch in March and got their mimosas. OMG. Their champagne was SOOO GOOD! My bf and I just wanted to buy the bottle but they couldn't do that! They servers were so friendly and nice when they came around and filled our glasses with more champagne as it got empty.   Everything was so full of flavor. My bf loved the prime rib. It was tender and juicy.   They have a super cute display of desserts. I just wanted to eat everything but my bf and I had the 24 hour deal of AYCE so we never wanted to fully stuff ourselves. We had a taste of everything and liked nearly everything. We were too scared to eat the mid-eastern stuff because we don't normally eat that and the Mexican selection looked sad so we didn't eat that either.   Can't wait to go back for more of that champagne!

Ogaub4biy3lZmVnqTMZANQ.text: Let me prompt this by saying that I hate buffets and only go when I am dragged by others  (I mean literally dragged).  We paid $25 for their Sunday no alcohol option lunch buffet after getting a players card.  I was pleasantly surprised to find some things at The Spice Market that I actually liked.  The watermelon was fresh and delicious, I enjoyed their shrimp coctail, as well as the fresh grilled veggies and the ice cream.  I also ordered eggs at the egg station because I cannot stand the ones that are layed out at the stations.  I did not enjoy the hardened french toast and most desserts.  I am not a big eater and very picky and I don't eat anything fried or red meat so I struggle with these type of places but here I actually got full.  If I could, I would rate this 3.5 stars.

DDeCvzOanNoW-AQw3hclYA.text: Nothing to write home about at Spice Market Buffet.  We ate here out of sheer convenience since we were staying at PH and needed a quick breakfast.  There was a variety of foods, but meh.  No one went back up for seconds.  I wouldn've been even more disappointed if I wasn't able to expense that meal.  Take a cab down to Hash House... its worth the cab fare and getting up early!

nBkT6dAX8EhKiN9h_63SnQ.text: So I went here not really expecting the best. I am a big buffet guy, and I really know what is a good or bad buffet. Last time I went to Vegas for a buffet, I went to the Wynn Buffet. I honestly thought it was the best buffet in  Vegas, I still think it is, but for $15 cheaper, I rather do the Spice Market Buffet. Same quality, cheaper price.   My favorites at the Spice Market Buffet included the Alaskan Crab legs, the Prime Rib, the boned Short Rib, the Beef Kabob. As you can tell, I love meat. Any meat that was served at this buffet was well prepared because after a week, I can still taste the juiciness of the Prime Rib. I am also a big fan of the Desserts of this buffet. There was this raspberry cheesecake that made me go back for not once, twice...I honestly went back for fourths. THEY HAD A COTTON CANDY MACHINE! That was a first for all the buffets I have been to.   So all in all this buffet was perfect from the multiple arrangements and options. They had Mexican, Italian, Seafood, Middle Eastern, Asian, you name it, they have it. The only reason I am not giving it a perfect 5-Star rating is because it was not like I saw a Shark Tank or had 5-Star furniture. Nonetheless, I came there to eat, and eat I got.

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cotton Candy!!!

d_hYAXLzqvNxTzyul4N6TA.text: I can't give this place 5 stars, because they don't do anything really well, but everything was good, and we really liked the set up with the separate international food stations.  Maybe instead of trying to offer everything done good, they should offer fewer items, done awesome?  The cupcake bar was fun with exotic sounding cupcakes, but the cupcakes were very ordinary.  The sushi - mediocre (after 2 bites, I didn't want any more).  Too bad Yelp doesn't have 3 1/5 star option.

M9FmBlreQVXkicE9AtnEgA.text: We went last night last night celebrating a friend's birthday. Decided to go since it was one was one of the only buffets in town that stayed open after 9pm(to our surprise the buffet actually stayed open to 11pm).  They had about 9 different stations ranging from Seafood, Mexican and the usual stuff. Our group really enjoyed the seafood and middle eastern stations the most.  The Good:  Crab Legs Skewed Chicken and Steak Crepe Station  The Bad:  I wish the stations had a little bit more variety. No sugar free desserts(at least i didn't see any).  Overall:   I recommend the spice market buffet to anyone wanting to catch a somewhat late night open buffet with a craving for really delicious food.

n4YjH-6Q9ybPCZI58Jfr2Q.text: Very decent buffet with wide range of variety. You can find everything from crab legs to prime rib, flan and crepes. I must highlight the server lady for her excellent service despite the demand from dinner crowd. All in all, we like it, worth your money.

iqDIDdpIZcPd3WANfDj4Tw.text: Huge variety of food, better than le village buffet. My friend and I went to each section of the buffet and got a small portion on what looks good. The kung pao chicken in the Asian Section tasted like general tso chicken.. Two thumbs up for a huge variety of cupcakes. They have flavors such as s'mores, mint chocolate chip, red velvet etc.. They had so many different flavors that I can't even remember them all.  I will defiantly come back here for more next time I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cotton candy :)

cMOTR5gbXxim4ZXs4qj2rg.text: We purchased the 24 Hour Buffet of Buffets pass and ate here for breakfast. Overall, of the buffets we visited, the food was very tasty. The room is a little dark (it's downstairs) whereas other buffets are brighter and a little more lively. My biggest complaint was the temperature of the food- the cottage cheese and fruit was warm (yuck!) and the cereal was stale. Also, a lot of the food indicators (which tell you what each item is) were either missing or wrong. Otherwise, this was definitely a decent buffet!

jmXF_bwFKixKA7F6Zrod_g.text: Spice Market Buffet have definitely improve since Planet Hollywood bought Aladdin. If you tried Spice Market Buffet when it was remodeling, go back and i can assure your opinion will change.    Its voted one of the BEST buffet in Las Vegas 2007.  the waiting and paying portion was very efficient compare to many buffets i have eaten. Quick service. A wide variety of food choices.   Best Buffet.   thank you. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. all protein!
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. crab legs

7ejIjaMXl-Eypaptd-ibdg.text: Stop 2 on my Buffet Of Buffet's adventure.  This place was pretty good, very flavorful food, lots of different styles of foods.    Food wise there were lots of options but not a lot of options at each station.  There was a lot of seafood, though i'm not a seafood fan so I didn't have any but if that is your thing you are covered at this place.  Being half Lebanese I went straight to the Middle Eastern station and but fairly upset with what was available.  I picked up the "Dolmas" which I had a couple of issues with, 1. They were served cold. 2. They were sitting in some form of oil. 3. They were served with a side of Feta Cheese.  Which that is the Greek way of serving them, not the Middle Eastern way.   I also got some lamb, which I haven't eaten lamb since I was a child.  This lamb however was perfectly cooked.  It was very tender and seasoned perfectly.    I later picked up some roasted turkey, some chicken, some Naan bread, beans and rice, quesadilla.  I had some Mac & Cheese as well but wasn't happy with it at all, it didn't taste right or good.  After we did go to the cupcake station which at first glance it offers tons of different flavors of cupcakes, however most of them were hard, and some of the flavors were not good.  Though I did like the cream puff cupcake enough to have more than 1.  The food was pretty solid, however the service was not great.  Our waitress only gave 1 refill and was away from us most of the time we were in there.  I would return to this place again and suggest it to my friends.

54b3TSQlB2BndOfKCLBI3Q.text: Oh man, I really want to give it more stars but it was just OK. The food was hit or miss. The drinks took a long time to get. My boyfriend would be giving this a much worse review. I liked it for the most part, but it was not worth the full price. Go if you have the groupon deal, but if you want to pay full price, go to Cravings for much better food and drinks

FgZC3gTT4APBj5XYlWNh0g.text: Terrible. That sums up my experience here.   Food used to be so good here, back in the Aladdin days. The seafood was fresh and there was lots of it, all different types. Now you are left with crab legs and shrimp; my guess? both from the same distributor that does all the buffets. In other words, flash frozen, not much flavor, ordinary not extraordinary stuff.   There wasn't one item I ate today that I would consider tasting 'good'. Not excellent, just 'good'. That's how far my standards have fallen here. The prime rib piece that I got was well done. I would say it once had a chance at good flavor, but not when it reached that temperature. The sushi consisted of three types all stacked on top of it other in one tray. Other than that, everything I ate, I literally took one bite of and then stopped. Even my 5 year old son, who loves desserts, stopped after one bite of his creme brulee and fruit tart. He didn't like either. Doesn't that sum it up? And I haven't started with my two major complaints. First is the price. My son, who again is 5, costs a whopping $19.99. That is highway robbery. Our dinners costs $36.99. Again a huge gouge fest. This buffet, in terms of quality and taste, I wouldn't pay more than $9.99.  And since the line was so long, they had an upstairs line, then the escalator, then it continues to a downstairs line. My cousin was waiting in line for us, and she had gotten to the downstairs part. The idiot who was controlling the top of the escalator wouldn't let me pass, even though my cousin was downstairs. In fact he didn't let many people pass, who's families were already in the downstairs line. Do people really f you over so much that you are a dick to all the families? Do you think I'm trying to bs you, as I am pushing my aunt in her wheelchair? Did you think the wheelchair was fake too so I can get some sympathy from you and try to steal my place in the front of the line?   As I write a letter to corporate to complain about this establishment, I will now write the same here on yelp. I will never again visit this buffet, and I would advise any living soul, for as long as I live, never ever come here.

k-kP_xu3F2M5lZxFEEYQDA.text: Pretty good option for lunch buffet (with the buffet pass).

XbnwPufNMrooR9-nCzwc4w.text: I LOVE this buffet. This was my second time eating here (the first was about 2 1/2 years ago) , and both times I was blown away by their selection and quality of food. They have such a wide variety of food at each international station, and it's all really delicious!! I don't have a bad thing to say about Spice Market Buffet.

2fpT509Xd48PQnYIl_xERg.text: Skip it, Seriously, even if you have the buffet of buffets pass save that stomach space for elsewhere. While i was here i saw them refilling buffet items from cans. The food that wasn't being refilled looked like it had been sitting out for hours. I tried a few things crab legs, meats, pasta etc. None of it was any good. Meat was dry and the crab legs were still frozen. I eventually gave up on the regular selections and just high tailed it to the desserts, cause those should be good right? Wrong, didn't even finish a cupcake. I went on a weeknight around 8pm. The place was practically empty. In town with so much amazing food i can't think of any reason i would return to this buffet.

Qe82VCWNZUgjQqqpl2cojw.text: There is a short wait, and the price is OK for what you get. There is a HUGE selection of food for lunch $21.99. If you just want to get something to eat, and don't care about quality, then this is the place. For the same price you can get much better for elsewhere. Most of the food tasted old or dry. Disappointed in the tuff and dry ribs. The burgers and fish were plain and dry. Nothing great. Service was good.

gzpOhq5iusJzDrYslWQKDw.text: I've been to plenty of buffets in Vegas - they are great places for the indecisive and hungry.  This is by far the best and most unique one that I've been to on the  strip.  This is the first one I've seen that has a 'Mediterranean' station with kebab and all the fixings.  They also had cotton candy and an extensive dessert bar.  Everything was seasoned just right - not too bland, not too salty/sweet, and it didn't look like things had been sitting out all day. The endless mimosas during the weekend brunch poured freely by our server aren't hurting this review either.  Try it out!

9DCcdYfCH5coKfpN1EWxwA.text: After a bout of severe and heavy-handed drinking (thank you Harrah's), my  sister Katrina K., Dank K., Stephen H. and I were starving. We came to Planet Hollywood not only looking for food to ease our rolling stomachs, but for a buffet that will blow our minds (and taste buds).  Alas! Blow my mind, it did not. However it seemed to blow my wallet away. The line was extremely long - even being tipsy didn't help. Cheery though I was, this line didn't seem to want to budge. I even saw an old-lady try to bribe her way in with $100 but there is no mercy for the buffet -bystanders. She was promptly sent to the back of the line. Ouchhhh. After much waiting, hopping and frequent trips to the bathroom, we finally got into the buffet - SCORE! Although at this point, I was painfully sober and even hungrier.  The food was.... all right.  Typical Vegas AYCE fare with the exception of the King Crab legs. Nothing remarkable or special. I was even disappointed with the desserts. For me, desserts are key. If they put in a lot of work in their desserts then you know that their entrees are doubly good. The Flan tasted off and the Strawberry tart was spoiled by watching this old man pick off all the strawberries and leave the tart there. Really old man. As if the old lady bribing her way out of line was so much better.   However, unlike other Vegas AYCE buffets, the Spice Market Buffet is unique in that it offers a Middle Eastern section, which is a pleasant break from the usual Italian, Seafood and American sections. Their marinated feta cheese was de-LISH.   Other than that, okay-buffet. (hey it rhymed!)

40Wahwj5A7Cd0l1pZAKHPw.text: Okkk....now i see why this place won #1 buffet in Vegas!  Years ago, I was under the False notion that Carnival World Buffet was the best around town...but after my recent visit I know I was wrong.  Carnival has actually gone down in quality now and Spice Market is delicious!  The variety is truly astounding and all the dishes are perfectly seasoned and prepared.  Usually with buffets quality is sacrificed for quantity, Spice Market defies this rule.  Forget all the other BLAND buffets, this is the place to go for great seafood, beef, and ethnic themed dishes and gourmet desserts as well.  I was really impressed by the dessert selection, and the fruit tarts helped!  So did that creme brulee...mmMm !

-Rw2gzVZX3ot0qjPO5QaJg.text: BAD.  Went from bad to worse when management promised to make it up to my by emailing me a free meal.  Never received the email and this was weeks ago.  Terrible experience.  Utterly distasteful with extremely poor management lacking ANY follow thru...

2z3BQxRyFeLzHHJF4VFgGw.text: Best buffet in town. We visit at least once every time we go. Make sure to ask waiter for the hot crab legs.

g6y0X2U6RQl2DqwTmscrhQ.text: Nina! Nina! Nina! We absolutely loved our waitress Nina. She kept the mimosas and water flowing to the table and she was extra friendly. She made us feel like part of the family. She's been through the series of name changes for the hotel but still enjoys her job. Just don't interfere with her breaks lol. Nina gets 5 stars the food gets the 3 stars.   Food: Blah. The same lunch selection and the selection was just average. Nothing to remember or even review about. We only ate there twice because we were staying at Planet Hollywood.

3CJ_AzIMoag8eu2zf82-2A.text: I think I ate everything I needed to eat :0.    Nothing exciting to say about this buffet.. It was what I expected.  Staff is friendly.   quesadilla (Mexican area) was good. They have mid- eastern food! (Hummus).  $30 for two during lunch, no alcohol.

Na7Mb4ICq8Prhs9VKQSwXw.text: The buffet was a solid size, but for 90 dollars I expected much better. There was nothing on the menu that amazed me and none of my guest were happy with the food. Honestly, the only food item I actually enjoyed was the cheese pizza from the Italian station. I, along with my party, continued to try the different foods at each station because we were determined to get full since we didn't want to waste the 90 dollars, but the dishes were either overcooked and dry or flavorless. Eventually, I stopped trying the other foods and just ate a couple slices of the pizza to get full.    There are much better buffets in Vegas. If you really have heart set on a buffet, I'd recommend the buffets at Caesar's Palace, Aria, Paris Las Vegas, or the Bellagio. You'll pay about 10-20 dollars more, but it's well worth it. If you absolutely want to eat at Planet Hollywood, then I'd suggest going to Gordon Ramsay Burgr. You'll spend about the same amount of money and you'll actually enjoy your food.

tmxcK15xt8pCXpqhSK6JdA.text: The only positive about this place is the manager on late night shift handled a cockroach experience there extremely well...where the rest of his staff did not!   We wait in line for 30 minutes to pay and another 30 to be seated..which is crap there were tons seats open. The buffet itself...not a variety that i would consider great..they had different cultures of it( Mexican, American, Asian, ect) but the options within each type..was very limited...  But we haven't eaten all day so we find some food..sit down to eat..not even half way done with the first plate and the lady next to us starts screaming too watch out..there is a cockroach running towards us on that seat cushion...omg what? So Done!!  The manager was great he apologized and told the cashier to give refunds to all of us sitting there that witnessed it ( even the guy who it didn't seem to bother him and kept eating ..lol). Then he tried to train to us and be friendly but made the mistake of saying that they just sprayed for bugs the night before...ugh gross! The rest of us..got out refund and left. My friend paid twice ( one for herself and one for another friend) and there was a problem with finding one of the receipts and she got attitude f and was so rude..  I would NOT recommend going here....

pmlpSTzoVkiqspuKSQ9XGQ.text: I was expecting a 5 star experience...but got a 4 star instead.  Good variety of foods, but the kabobs were all so dry...hope it was a fluke.  The prime rib was tasty.  I think the best cuisine there was the "American" one, so be sure to check it out.  Cheers

j7cftgNE45HSjyV06Z9uvQ.text: This buffet is a very poor value for the high costs.  My wife & I were very disappointed with the quality of both their food and service.  There are many other options available for your buck.

ufycibWa4xkA9GxeisBRUQ.text: Food was just okay.   We went for breakfast and the pancakes were hard and the "crepes" were warmed up pre-made thin pancakes.  The fresh fruit was watery and not very fresh looking. We used a $5 off coupon so the price was right for a breakfast buffet if you are just looking for something to eat.

kUGfCGVaowUcaPDpagpsFw.text: The food is pretty decent here but the employees are what makes the place suck.  Mona was the cashier and was rude and arguementative. Marjorie was the seater and was nice and pleasant. Genet was our server. I only got her name because I read it off her nametag. She only said on thing to us and that was to ask which wine we wanted because Marjorie didn't mind if we had one. She coulda said it better and without attitude. The busser took our plates and we were never offered for our drinks to be refilled.  This is becoming a buffet that I may plan on skipping in future trips.

U0lVH46qSriWTRiyc5QGwg.text: I already don't like buffets so when I came here after having to wait in line for 40 mins I was seriously disappointed. Most of the food was just standard fare with some of the Middle Eastern stuff being interesting. Unlike the Bellagio where I ate until I felt like my stomach would pop I ate very sparingly here.  The only memorable thing that happened here was my friend telling me that he wanted me to go with him to the 24 hr marriage chapel to be the witness (and take pics) so he could get hitched with his girl that nite..  while I was trying to get some lamb chops..  it seemed kinda surreal at the moment.

QjSgy7Fg6LtC1Em2U2Q0aQ.text: Absolutely shocking. In a great way! I was here years ago when this casino was called Aladdin... and the food back in the day was mass produced and gross.  This time, our company was having a dinner here *side blurb: which was great because we got to bypass the immensely long lines, say our names and get whisked away downstairs. who says you can't get great escort service at a buffet?!*  We were seated and the assault was on.   Crab legs. CHECK. Omigod. They were cool enough to steam them for us so we had piping hot crab legs. That made these babies taste even better than the ones from Wynn. Chocolate covered strawberries. Half check. How do you run out of these!!?!?  Prime Rib: CHECK. Tender and juicy.  I was blown away by the quality of the food that they were serving here. The staff was really helpful and the food was of great caliber! This is definitely one of my "will recommend" buffets for those who don't want to blow 40 dollars at Bellagio or Wynn.

HWPqtGL40pN0-s13iiKcQA.text: Not a bad deal! We stayed at the planet Hollywood so we decided to stop by the buffet for breakfast. We got there around 10:30am so we got to enjoy breakfast and a bit of lunch as well! I loved the egg Benedict so much and the potatoes. My fav lunch section was the middle eastern. The curry chicken and white rice are to die for and tasted so authentic :) nothing beat the price! It was around $20 for breakfast as well as lunch per person.

onJUd6JcJxhfy1Iuch-9oA.text: OK, I am not a buffet person.  It generally is just too much food for me and I can never justify the price.  However, since we where staying at Planet Hollywood and wanted someplace easy to to eat dinner we thought we would try Spice Market.  Everyone seemed to rave about it, so I figured we would give it a go.    You take the escalator down to the buffet and you are faced with a huge array of stations from Seafood to Salad.  At $30/per person for dinner, it is a pricey buffet no matter how you cut it. There was a lot of variety and I got selections from the Asian, American, Mexican and Italian stations.  Not to mention the delicious dessert selections.  The big draws seem to be the seafood station and desert bar.    The place was packed and full of people half in the bag, stuffing their faces and yelling.  Maybe that was part of the reason it didn't wow me.  It was a just a buffet, with decent food, good selection and nothing that stood out.    I think this is my last Vegas buffet.  It just isn't my thing!

HxuVLYHSlIknA2OaRDAliQ.text: First time in Vegas and we totally had to hit a buffet because that's what you DO in Las Vegas!   Arrived at Planet Hollywood, wandered aimlessly through the mall, through the smokey casino and down the escalator where we were met with wonderful smells and a horrendous line that consumed a good hour and a half of our time.   Was it worth the wait? Was it worth the $106 charge for three people?   ... Eh.  The prime rib, while divine, was cut thin enough I could see through it. But the flavor notes of just about everything else made up for it... Aside from the cupcakes. The icing, on many of them, is straight up whipped butter and lacking any other flavor aside from "Heart attack".   The wait staff seemed disgruntled and when my friend asked for another glass of water, the waitress picked up my husband's yet to be sipped from glass and handed it to her. Talk about lazy and nasty!

5_nvj-glIRrTHf3OcJjvCQ.text: Dinner and lunch is very different. We only went during brunch. I liked that they had a variety. No crab but they did have cooked mussels, shrimp pasta, and baked cod. There mid-eastern was good and the only buffet that had this. Love their chicken curry.

luWQe3qSNtnR7wQSUwUs6w.text: We arrived a little after 3pm with a group of 20, including 16 with Special Needs.  No line, plenty of empty tables and we gave our Groupons and had to pay $2.49 per person extra ( tax?).  They wanted us to pay $100 for gratuity to sit together in the same EMPTY area; another union rule.   More later on that.  I said no problem, we aren't moving since we were already seated, but told them they just lost any additional tip we were planning on leaving above the $100.  This is union policy, I was told again.  Well, keep your union policies.   Those are the workers the union protects..  Good for the union.  The service was awful, the food was just as bad and I would never recommend this place to anybody who has any food taste/class.   As soon as we finished, I had two vomit ( un- sweetened tea must have been off temperature).   None of us ate more than a bit of anything.  Most items weren't labeled so the one with a seafood allergy, ended up with seafood in the pasta.   Not labeled.   Chicken Noodle Soup isn't a selection of soup.  It was the only choice.   Desserts were just awful.   The best was the Ice Cream and it can from a machine.   Don't go,  not recommended; rather stay hungry than eat this rubbish.  Service was terrible, but then again, unions only hire the best workers...wrong...least motivated.... yes!   Fool me once...Never again.

kjN6GCcWojccfMTizplRzA.text: Unfriendly staff,  food less than average, tables dirty despite just being bussed and the bussers seem lost as you watch them try and clear tables.  For a day that was not especially busy I expected better and the price they charge I really expected better quality food.  We won't be returning here.

Dgz2HXWqQh_WHmyR8bai5g.text: Another buffet? Why the heck not. Planet Hollywood's Spice Market Buffet isn't anything to rave about but if you're looking for a quick buffet and a lower price point, this is your bet.  Cost: Breakfast ~$15.99+* Lunch ~$18.99+* Dinner ~$27.99+* All you drink $11.99* *prices before tax, weekend prices increase by a couple dollars.  Service: Quality if service isn't the best, got in line, paid, with no one ahead of us and the waiter/host were busy talking to one another.  What's good to eat? The brisket and grilled asparagus are the most satisfying in my opinion. The roasted chicken was a little dry for my taste but was seasoned appropriately. Baked potato was very plain, nothing to rave about, does need a potato toppings bar though. The various styles of cuisines didn't seem to blend for me. This would be a place to eat if you're not too worried about the quality.

ptx1EFY4u566n9XutRs5Ag.text: The buffet offers a great variety from different places. That being said, the food isn't that great. It is bland and not at all what you expect from a Vegas buffet. The staff is friendly but the wait staff is slow and had to be asked three times for drinks because they forgot what we ordered. For the price, I expect better food. Skip this one ppl and try another one.

XFaYcOO4GB4QDMvhcZRjgw.text: We got a discounted rate through tix 4 tonight. We were seeing a show in the same hotel and didn't want to walk far so we decided on this buffet. It looked promising with all the different taste stations, but I was disappointed with all of them. Most of the food was just really low quality. A lot of it was not fresh and had been sitting out for a long time. Everything was just kind of dried out or overcooked. I felt like each station was missing basic components you'd expect to see there. The salad bar only had like 4 vegetables, the noodles in the soup had literally turned to mush, and at a taco bar, you'd expect to find stuff to make tacos not weird looking pork tostadas and burnt quesadillas. The pastas were cold so the cheese on top wouldn't melt. Even the deserts didn't look appetizing and I have a killer sweet tooth. They looked like bland, overly processed, chalky cakes. The staff were also kind of rude and really slow. There was no one in front of us and we probably waited 15 minutes for someone to come seat us. Buffets are really hit and miss, and this was definitely a miss. Our group would have been happier having gone to McDonald's or something for dinner. It wasn't even worth the discounted price we paid. I can't imagine paying full price for it.

DN_BiPPQK-g8BS2y9s7VFQ.text: There is a good variety of food, and it is tasty and fresh, nothing really outstanding. Best and worst: the beef at the carving station was tender and flavorful, but the crepes were pre-made so they were a little tough. We used a Groupon that included unlimited beer, wine and champagne, since we came at breakfast time we had mimosas, lots of mimosas! The service was great with the drinks but not as much with clearing the dirty plates from the table. Unlike some buffets, our server made us feel welcome to take our time. We would definitely return.

T3hJAv1ROUL5uVY92C2o4A.text: Buffet of Buffets Marathon - Stop #7 of 7 6:30 PM (actual time was 7 PM) After leaving Paris, I drove next door to Planet Hollywood to cap off the night with the final stop in the Buffet of Buffets Marathon, the Spice Market Buffet. There was a concert (George Clinton) in the theater, so parking was tough and we didn't get to the buffet until 7 PM. Even though I was completely stuffed from the 6 prior buffets, I somehow found the room to go for a final plate. This buffet is one of the largest of the 7 and offers Mediterranean fare, which is unique to the other buffets. yelp.com/biz_photos/Fi-2... I decided to have some Chinese food, Pizza, and Penne Pasta.....had to stick with my No Meat diet and these were the most appetizing items I found. There's plenty here for omnivores....I'll have to come back when I'm off the wagon. yelp.com/biz_photos/Fi-2... yelp.com/biz_photos/Fi-2... yelp.com/biz_photos/Fi-2... The food was pretty good. If I had more room, I'd go for some of the Mediterranean items.....the other Yelpers who tried it said it was pretty good. I'll take their word for it. Our server was friendly and kept our glasses full. We were seated in the middle of the buffet so we had easy access to the entire line of food. Good stuff. Return Factor - 90%

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MRt8ykkJy8r_JOIP21HWAA.text: The food was good with a decent selection, not amazing. The atmosphere isn't anything special. It's not lively, especially for Vegas. Went with a groupon, so it was a good price. Otherwise it is overpriced

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good selection of dessert

zmRXem8EeBfCURgErQEjmg.text: This is the second time i go , the food is fresh and the service is great they have , mexican food,italian,American,miso soup and much more I recommend this buffet.

TsIjshT9SApY_hJJnsKn8Q.text: This used to be one of my favorite Strip buffets but the quality and variety of food has really gone down hill.  When I walked into the restaurant at 1.00pm there was absolutely no one in line (red flag).  After I was seated the restaurant was only 30% occupied.  Needless to say, the food just sat under the heat lamps forming crusts.  I tried several pasta dishes and they all tasted the same despite the varied descriptions.  The desert bar was overrun with cupcakes.  Cheap, cheap, cheap.  I tried the Flank Steak and it was chewy despite been cooked medium and the Tandoori Chicken was overcooked.  Had they shredded the chicken they could have re-purposed it as shoe laces.   I will not be returning to the Spice Market.  I'd rather pay a little extra money and dine at the Wynn or the Bellagio for a gourmet dining experience.

pf5BaPu1UyrdC8vO49m32w.text: We use the Spice Market Buffet sometimes for breakfast as we stay right across the street. On this occasion we were using the Buffet of Buffets pass and I didn't look to see how much Monday morning breakfast was, but what we like about Planet Hollywood's buffet is they have a nice breakfast selection.  I was on some crazy fresh fruit tear that morning, so I got lots of yummy fruit from berries to pineapple to cantaloupe.  I also dug into the oatmeal and there were all kinds of great toppings: craisins, almonds, granola, etc.  My husband had an Egg McMuffin on cheddar cheese steroids and said it was awesome.  And of course, we munched through the usual eggs and sausage and bacon items.  They have a nice bread bar with french toast, pancakes, and waffles with a selection of syrup and toppings as well as donuts.  I passed on my usual biscuits and gravy, but it was there and so were bagels with toppings like lox, tomatoes, cream cheese, etc. and a toast selection.  IN other words, Great breakfast selections.    Good food and good service.  I like that the bathroom is at the same location so you don't have to go traipsing all over the casino to find it.  We like it.  We'll probably be back.  I did have one previous experience there at dinner and on that occasion the food was okay, but it didn't give me an urge to return for dinner.

wjqIR3ppCZlAfLrj9RWPhA.text: This review is mostly about the staff. My group ate here Sunday and the staff was great. Our waiter was very attentive and my champagne flute of mimosa was not once empty. But we left behind important documents and the manager went above and beyond to help us out. If it weren't for the employees our documents could have been trashed. So THANK YOU, awesome staff and Josh (manager) we are so appreciative.  Also, the bacon was fabulous.

AvsyAOOaknTSrEltwGIikQ.text: This is an ok buffet. The price was fine and the fact that this was in our hotel made it worth going to. Now most of the food was good, however there were some things that I would not have agian, The asian sections had won Ton's that were very tuff to eat, the turkey was tender the stuffed sole was not bad, the whole buff is ok, just be choosie in what u pick and try everything u can so u get your moneys worth.

Em4MGEnTA-4d_xiy0czQNg.text: For those who is planning on eating at the Spice Market, I have recorded a Full HD Steady tour of the buffet at Planet Hollywood. or type "Full Steady Tour of Planet Hollywood Buffet" youtube.com/watch?v=-YQI... This Spice Market buffet is located on the lower floor of the Casino. The buffet itself is pretty big with buffet stations going from one end of the buffet to the other end. It's comparable to Rio Buffet, but I would still consider Rio buffet the biggest and the longest. They have a lot of food to choose from, but I do have to say that most of the food didn't taste spectacular. It was alright. Nothing to rave about. The dessert station wasn't that great! Majority are cupcake items. They also have made to order crepe, but the crepe was already cooked. They just have to warm it up. Overall, the service was good, but I would have to say that this buffet has more quantity over quality. TIP: Dine between 2:45 and 3:30 and pay lunch price, so that way you can enjoy dinner food items starting at 3:30. For example, snow crab legs. By the way, the crab legs doesn't taste good. Just alright. As I said in the beginning, if you guys want to see what kind of food they serve at the Spice Market buffet, I have recorded a full Steady walking tour of Planet Hollywood Buffet: youtube.com/watch?v=-YQI...

IFjrGZOIkoDR44EbccMqlw.text: Don't go here. Ever.  This was my first dinner outing during my trip to Vegas this May.  I was so highly disappointed.  I had only heard buffets in Vegas are amazing.  This was NOT amazing.  This was disgusting.  Of all the food I could not even find one thing to get, I decided making a salad would be my safest bet. Yeah right! The salad bar was a joke, gross lettuce, croutons and dressing. Like no veggies!! I made a pathetic excuse for a salad, and ending up filling up on cupcakes.  Which were nothing to write home about either.  The few I had were super dry.  Not only was this buffet gross, it was robbery!!! $70 for the two of us for garbage! Never again, never again. They even try to take your photo upon arrival... can you imagine purchasing one?! No thank you!!!! Don't need a memory of the awfulness that cost us $70

XJF6KHiIiwG1gxm_xKCfUg.text: Ok I waited until 4pm, because that's when they have snow crab legs only to find they are served cold !  The only reason I wanted to eat at the market was for the crabs but not cocktail crab legs. The price is a bit high go to groupon n get a deal. I must say its a large selection of multiple culture foods, so u will be fine if your not looking for hot crabs.

mF9Fg6GEcEIRIlJ49gnCCw.text: This IS the best breakfast buffet in Vegas!! Every time I come to Vegas I stop here for breakfast and every time I'm amazed at the variety and the food. The grilled flank steak is superb.......!!!! The Eggs Benedict is creamy. The other delight is the service. Everyone nice and willing to help with smiles. What a way to start off a day of fun ....yummies!!! Love this place !!!!

pImChz9rs5If--x7Rteokg.text: Anything you want. Everything you can think of! I love it here! It's easy to go overboard because it's all so good. Check out the crab, creme brulee and prime rib. I'd also like to give a shout out to our waiter that we had multiple times, Tad. He's kind and great at what he does. We loved having him as our waiter and we were happy to be in his section multiple times. Thanks Tad!

iCNpptY2Z_c0v0LQxDZsnQ.text: Cotton Candy......... Prime Rib....... Put them together..... well.. i don't recommend you putting them together.. (It does sound good tho) i just wanted to emphasize two things that stuck out when i was there ;)   Yet another place to check out while on your gluttony/ sinful vacation in Vegas...   Located downstairs of the Planet Hollywood Hotel is a buffet with a lot of spice appeal with Different sections of countries like: American, Middle eastern, Mexican, Asian, etc etc.. Its not as big compared to other buffets i saw but its not bad at all. Lots of flavor, lots to choose from.  U gotta try the steaks and prime rib.. Hella tender and lots of fat content.. ;) The desserts with their cupcakes, ice cream, cakes, cookies and The Cotton Candy was a pretty nice touch as well.. My daughters favorite.

eQpkXHob9THeAnvDN0v2Ww.text: I don't understand how this buffet has such a good reputation.  The food was mediocre to good.  For the price, I'd HAPPILY pay $10 more and go to the Aria and have lobster or prime rib that isn't dry.    This place feels like they are just cramming mass amounts of food down your throat sacrificing quality.  You may as well go to the Excalibur and save $20 if that is what you are looking for.

o6f6kcfMMCvZkzG2IPzzsg.text: Well, I can't imagine the Spice Market Buffet has an overall rating of three stars.  I have three words:  It is great.  Great selection, very fresh, very good taste on all dishes (and I eat all of the dishes), high quality ingredients, the staff and chefs are very helpful and friendly.  The atmosphere is nice and relaxing.  This is my favorite buffet and beats all others that I have tried, hands down.

mmMeXoSeeOcf-95dxFHJHw.text: With the groupon for 2/$45 with unlimited drinks (alcohol included), it was a fantastic way to say adios to Las Vegas.   The food was fresh and hot and didn't look like it was sitting around for too long. Everything was pretty good quality, but I guess this might be because I made it to dinner just as it started. It's not comparable to the higher class buffets in Vegas, but for it's price range, I wouldn't expect it to be.   The one complaint I had was the dessert station was all cupcakes. I wish there was more variety in the types of dessert offered (I can only eat so much cream cheese frosting, guys.).   Overall, for less than $25 a person (with groupon), this expanded and better tasting Hometown Buffet is a great way to fill up one last time before passing out on the airplane.

79DZALrCC3N2TsZJ0MJ-Eg.text: I enjoyed the buffet maybe because I didn't have much of a dinner the night before - but I liked the chicken jalepeno sausage, biscuits and gravy, the crepes and brisket were meh.

Fu77VxCceBCQD4b0JsTOjQ.text: Sorry, Just not good at all.  Bought the Current Groupon and didn't have high expectations but this was far below average food. While there were many selections to choose from, the quality just isn't there and for the price it was a complete ripoff. With the Groupon and adding in 2 kids it was $90!!  So many better options out there.

75duIuy9-kjzi4RT0oR0jw.text: The buffet at Ceasear's set the bar for me, this place is not on that level. You have to be a top tier TR member to get hot crabs!!! Unheard of!! The food was just warm, the assortment was just ok. No 100% beef offerings (meatballs, ribs), no seafood raw bar; we did pay $30.99. We frequent Vegas every 2 - 3 months and wont be returning, gonna try the Aria next. The asian egg noodles and oatmeal cookies we're the highlights for me

XzoUv1JlRTfZY5-E4tcQPQ.text: The buffet spread = 0 Desserts = 4 Service = 1  Please stay awat from this buffet unless you just want to eat delicious desserts such as the flan and the eclairs.  Foods were wrong and cold and.. ugh! I can't explain it. I would rather eat Subway sandwiches the whole day. The people working here look sad as well. You say hi and they glare back at you.  I only gave the points really for the dessers because I enjoyed it.

SUmQ7l6M-s7aZtuYRB2Jcw.text: Sigh... this was not the first time I've eaten here, however, it was the worst visit out of my two visits. Fortunately, both meals were free. The silver lining...  I'd like to give more than 2 stars but I can't. It was really more like a 2.5 experience, but I can't round up because the food was just that lousy.  The only thing that was half way decent was the prime rib, fruit tart, lemon meringue tart, and the stuffed sole. All of the warm items were cold...selections were dim...meats were all tough except for the ones that I just mentioned. Not sure what happened at the Mediterranean station. Why was everything doused in heavy curry spice?? Isn't curry more of an Asian spice?? The curried cauliflower and chicken were both awful. All that I could taste was heavy curry and no other seasonings..really dreadful dishes...the lamb and chicken kabobs were both dry and cold. The grilled squash was cold, slimy and tastless... I could go on and on about the other items that I tried, but I won't bore you with details, but I will tell you that the other offerings were similar. I didn't get around to the salad bar but I think I should have started there first...  I think that SMB is right around $40 per person sans discounts...it's definitely not worth the money. Quality nor selection are there. There are too many other buffets in Vegas that offer much better food at a better price. The Orleans is one.  In all fairness, I'm not a buffet buff, but this is about as bad as it gets...service was at least decent.

3WB7Jxt4zO1fgZzvf-CLAw.text: We went here for lunch, as we received a voucher for a timeshare presentation. We actually would have paid the 10.99 if we did not have a voucher, as it was very good.   The food was mostly warm or hot. The grilled carrots were the only thing that should have been warm and was not. The greenbeans were oily. We were filled up and it was very good! The mashed potatoes were something I could have ate more of because they were tasty.   My husband is not a sweets guy, and most buffets offer pies/soft serve, so when we didnt find either, it was disappointing for him. I am a sweets person and found the creme brulee to be the best thing I ate. They could have limited the cupcakes and added pie or softserve,   Overall, a very good deal and we were happy to have ate here.

4pEaD8PTrhTsfC30OHY0ng.text: Very disappointing.  Hardly any main dishes. They spread the filler  ingredients to make it look like they have a lot of choices.  This buffet is so so far away compared to the Bellagio. Food doesn't taste that great either.

M1DZogk1KOGvVVqUMlKJVQ.text: We got there around 5:30.  Food looked as it was sitting there a while beef was craved for me but was so tough I couldn't chew it. Mexican food station was small not too many choices and meat for tacos was greasy.  I was there years ago and used to be wonderful. Never again and I would not recommend this buffets

yTdY3fRtMpxUDO36Azw2Bg.text: Arrived early on a Sunday night.  There was hardly anyone in front of us in line, yet it took FOREVER.  Still don't get it, as it took us very little time to pay when we got up there.  (yes, added a tip).  Then it took somewhat forever again before someone seated us.
