I came here on an empty stomach (skipped breakfast and had a small dinner the night before) and there were so many yummies there that I couldn't eat everything!! Halfway eating, I realized I was starting to get full so I started getting teeny tiny portions of the food so I can try everything. I didn't even have space for dessert unfortunately b/c they all looked scrumptious. I loved how everything was grouped by cusines.  Heard the Bellagio buffet was better b/c they have more gourmet food so you get more bang for your buck but this is MY kind of place!

blppQgTVwIPv_lilQU-Jtg.text: The last time I was at this buffet (while it was still "The Aladdin"), I seriously wanted to choke someone out for making me pay for the filth they served me that they decided to call "food". Seriously, when I pay, I at the very least expect somewhat decent food.  Well, low and behold, after finally arriving in Las Vegas around 7:30 in the morning, I was famished and wanted to eat something! Anything! Being that my friend and I stayed at Planet Hollywood (what it is now), he did some gambling and actually got himself a voucher for a free buffet. So, why the heck not? Even though in the back of my mind, I did cringe a little when it was mentioned because of the horrible time I had last time. We were off!  The buffet was around $14 and change. I was surprised that they had a make-your-own-waffle station (you actually ask one of the cooks to put the batter into the waffle maker and wait), make-your-own-omelette station  (same premise, but you get a small array of veggies - onions, mushrooms, green peppers, ham, and cheese). I don't know what's happened to me, but after taking a nicely, freshly made waffle (with the "PH" Planet Hollywood logo on it), my omelette, roast beef with horseradish sauce, bacon, and sausage, I was done. No more! The thing I did notice, I actually enjoyed the food! If you're staying here and want a decent breakfast buffet, this is were I'd probably go to.

slnoBgPln3ePOHdrHvYzHQ.text: Dried out meat (from sitting out too long)+ Only one seafood station when there are 2 Mexican food stations+ disgusting sushi+ HORRIBLE asian food+ expensive price= extreme ripoff.   The buffet in PARIS is a lot better than the supposed "#1 buffet for 2007"  I want to take the people who voted this place #1 and ask them seriously wtf they were thinking.   I guess if you come here for free it might be only sub-par.

UwJqdezCvtihT8EExvqhwQ.text: I wish I can put this with no stars, most of the food was disgusting, not only this, the lady on the cashier was so rude, the only good thing was the server she was smiling all the time and came to our table several time to check if we need anything, I paid $82 for two persons but honestly, i shouldn't paid $5 for this

gVYDNSS8nE4xfcZ5HEyxBQ.text: This buffet was good. There was great food, and there was meh food. The service was all right, nothing special. The negative was that getting through the line to pay and to a table took forever, and we were the first ones in line! It seems like they were short of staff that day or something. Anyway, I would eat here again, especially if I were staying in the hotel.

t2GUbOeJLHz-YM2QAX8aGg.text: This is the Reece Witherspoon of buffets. It's bland, cold, and lacks character, but tolerable for 90 minutes because you're girlfriend wants to go. It really had all of the standard buffet fare, but didn't do anything for me. I picked at each station, but couldn't find anything really to write home about. I will say, like most of the buffets that it was only half full, but had a twenty minute wait to get in. Can we please learn to staff these buffets with more waiters??? Anyway, I really recommend you skip this one and head to the buffet at Paris. AMAZING!

sqZSFvB6T09SQnlB5Gd0Cg.text: Honestly the worst buffet I've ever been to and its Wayyy over priced 31 dollars for terrible food terrible staff and service had to wait 10 minutes to get a fork  save your money and go to home town buffet all the food was old and when I asked for a crepe the man made it in about 30 seconds and threw it on my plate it was very sloppy and honestly looked like a 6 year old made it I also asked for meat well done and she threw me a very red and bloody piece I was like can you please cook it more and she gave me a rude look and told me that's as well don't as its getting I couldn't believe it there was only one staff member who was very polite he would be fast and smile at us

Mbjg3C_jVPEgUxtSzlPM4Q.text: This was an average buffet offering. One of our party became ill after eating some seafood here. Not really anything sticks out in my mind as being great.

3QTCHKw918h5mzzyGnHEfw.text: Tip...go for a really late lunch, (3:30pm or so) and hang around for the dinner selections that come out about 4:30pm.   Really nice buffet! Great variety of selections!   The crab legs were a bit salty.   Very friendly/helpful staff!

cH9E8cRDFGFLGlHB023UKA.text: Very poor food. Food looks like all frozen not fresh made. Way better buffets for the same money in vegas.

M2JnxLtxWrT1-ugwOOF0cg.text: First time here as a tourist.  The selection was plenty, and the food was delicious.  Our waiter was quick to take empty plates and refill drinks. Definitely worth the price.

yvxIg63KI1iSbyNc-MT2rw.text: Buy the 24 hr unlimited citywide buffet pass! It's a great deal since it cost the same as a single meal pass. This is a large buffet with a variety of choices. They offer Mexican, Asian, Italian, and Seafood. They also have a nice dessert station with cotton candy! The line does get really long during lunch and dinner. One time I had to wait in the casino area before getting to wait in the actual line downstairs in the buffet area. I recommend coming early to avoid the long wait.   Sign up for the Total Rewards card to get a discount on the 24 hr buffet pass. It's free to sign up and it will save you about $5 per pass. The Total Rewards desk is near the buffet so you can quickly signup and head straight to Spice Market.   My top two buffet in Vegas is this place and the Carnival World buffet at the Rio. The Carnival World buffet is also part of the 24 hr deal. So if you get the 24 hr pass from Spice Market you can also go to the Carnival World buffet and eat as much you want for as long as you want within 24 hours!

4-7OkUkP_ZMTgxBTNjGxEA.text: Went here at 830ish for breakfast midweek with a Groupon.  Omelet station was good, as expected but everything else was subpar. Service was slow although there was no line and not that many people there.  Dishware dirty.  Would definitely NOT recommend without a discount.  With the groupon, it was $10 / person for the buffet with unlimited alcohol.  Unlikely to return but worked out this time since a cup of coffee might work out close to $10 at some places....

-cKN_FazG689zEyEaenYRA.text: This WAS the best buffet in Vegas many years back. The spacing is quite congested and not modern. Dinner price was $27.99 with a 10% discount if you're staying at Planet Hollywood. There were stations representing different ethnic areas, American, Asian, Middle Eastern, Mexican, Italian as well as a dessert and salad station. The good;  chicken curry, tandoori chicken, crab legs and fried chicken the mediocre; prime rib, desserts and the salads, the bad; minestrone soup, spring rolls and the fried shrimp. Pay a little more and go to Aria, Wynn, Bellaggio or Cosmopolitan.  WOULD I GO BACK? If I were staying at Planet Hollywood and too lazy to venture out.....yes.

HhioIBm4BNCGo_KWg_LuBA.text: SLow service, paid for all you can drink beer , but good luck finding waitress to get a 2nd drink. Seafood selection was surprisingly good and fresh compared to the rest of the buffet. Dessert section was a major let down

HfSXR-BleM0LdTVoYxaaIg.text: This place wasn't gross, but it wasn't good. I honestly just got a ton of salad and ice cream. I'd be pissed if I spent the full price on it but my friend checked in on Foursquare so we got a buy-one-get-one voucher so it was like $30 for the two of us for dinner. I guess it was fun to try a buffet in Vegas but maybe my expectations were a little too high? I'd rather have spent twice that and had a real meal at a good restaurant.  The desserts were the best part.

BoqRl0-xtGYQI6yrwo8lAA.text: My wife and I went to Vegas or error 15 year anniversary. we decided to eat at Planet Hollywood buffet on 2-19-15. While we were in the restaurant I was going around a buffet and at the Mexican food counter. I seen three baby roaches crawling around on the countertop right next to the food. needless to say I didn't eat no more at the buffet. from my diet coke and wanted to leave. So if you like roaches in interior food go to Planet Hollywood buffet

SYn7Il7BKHEDNKRvn5dyBw.text: Overall, I'll say I'm a fan. I went here for brunch with a friend on my trip to Vegas a few weeks ago because it was highly recommended. The brunch was "ok", but what we really needed to stay for was the lunch .... and we did.  GREAT variety - there are over 6 different cultural food stations (Middle Eastern, American, Mexican, Asian Fusion, etc) and a cupcake bar! I'd agree... Not the 5 star experience I was hoping for, but still worth a trip if you like to eat like we do!

jve1jEKfuauksvAMlNAG5g.text: When visiting Las Vegas this year we were told our very favorite buffet had changed!  Sadly they have taken the all you can eat crab legs off of the menu. Last night September 17, 2018, we decided to go anyway. BAD decision. Only a very limited selection of meat. The desserts were not at all tasty, in fact some seemed to be dried out. The staff was friendly and kept our table clean - that is only the upside of the buffet. They need to ramp it up or close it down. We went to the M resort in Henderson (Sept. 15, 2018) and ate at their buffet. Not only did they have cold and steamed crab legs, they were all you can eat crab legs on that Saturday night. They have a good selection of other meats, good desserts and salads! 5 star good!

1ga8HbOt9ivi0g50dA3Mrw.text: Overall this is just an A-OK buffet on the strip; I truly believe that there is almost always an equal sign (=) in between the quality of food and the price tag. The only one thing I have remembered from this place is the cotton candy while everything else is just average.  I don't think I will come back unless I get to eat here free of charge and do not have to wait in line at all, which is too good to be True, isn't it? teeheee :P  in brief, I would pay a little bit more for some better buffets nearby.

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

M8C0z_l5ZOlSyNtOyPOqEw.text: Located in Planet Hollywood downstairs. Best thing about this buffet is that they are open late 11pm which is about a hour later than others and that they have cotton candy!  But the day I was here last time the cotton candy machine was broken :(   This buffet has a pretty good selection of food and every time I have been here there has not been a line.  So if you are hungry and don't want to wait in line come check them out.  The food isn't top notch but certainly good.  If you buy the 24 hour buffet pass come here late one night buy the pass and get the next 24 hours to try the other buffets or come back here.  You should have time to get 3 more meals the next day if you buy it at 10pm.

dG47OJtShznYRZVYaB_Log.text: I always liked this place!!! I don't see why they have so many negative reviews. The steak on a stick they have often is pretty dam tasty. I think this is one of my favorite buffets in the vegas area. It's not always so crowded and the food is great.

PavDGrofOTON2Gdeq_u5ag.text: Food is good. It would get 5 stars but crab legs are cold, unless u are a diamond and above..... how sad. There is a quater mile of food and they cannot make the hot crab legs. The waitress was nice enough to bring one plate, but im a crab freak. So....just be warned.  Groupon can usuually save u money too.

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Make ur own soda
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab legs....cold

235X9Og2JPQFxq5zF4NnBQ.text: What can I say. Worse buffet ever. All food were old and had been sitting for a while. All tasteless. it used to be nice here about 6 years a go or so.  Home town buffet is better than here. Not recommend at all zero rating!!!

vm1TtgqJVr1XZGQN1t8hMQ.text: Went there for dinner with my wife, OMG the buffet was excellent, loved the prime rib, the shrimp, the italian food. We had the all you can drink, mind you it was bottled beer and not draft beer which I thought was a plus.  We will definitely be going back to this place next time were in Vegas. A lot of people make bad reviews about many places, but never judge by others judge by your own experiences.  Recommend this place 100%

NgHAwjWlXGgBz6ZVTVuAiw.text: We have eaten here many times over the past years and always enjoy the food.  Prime Rib is really good.  Desserts used to be amazing and while still tasty, they've basically turned everything into a cupcake, which I find really strange.  Creme Brulee is still good.  If you like pie you are out of luck because they had none.   We had a groupon and I was glad as I'm not sure I'd be happy paying full price for this buffet.  A good deal with the groupon. Biggest complaint was because we had a large party (12) they charged us 18% gratuity ($40!!!!!) which is waaaaaaaaay to high for the service at any buffet, let alone that our server was not good at all.  She forgot drinks (never brought them) and was very unfriendly.  She did not deserve $40 and I feel this was very unnecessary.  Next time we'll request 2 separate tables so we can leave the appropriate tip for service rendered.

TB-bMcnApIZPWMRHqlgklQ.text: Worst buffet I have ever experienced in Vegas!  There was absolutely nothing good I can say about this experience.  Bad....really bad...and a major disappointment!

JVjTxzmF0xoEV5FlA1a6gw.text: This was a good Las Vegas Buffet - Was as in the Past tense.  Avoid this buffet at all cost, the bean counter in charge of this buffet have killed this once decent place to eat.   Food turnover is not happening, there is no chief in charge.  No one is making certain the food is eatable or maintained at temperature.

7SJyst8oBKAOaq6y7YCjhw.text: This review is for the lunch experience at Spice Market Buffet.  Pros: Cheap. Good variety. Good desserts. Flavorful steak.   Cons: Most of the food choices were bland. Sushi was horrible. This is possibly the worse sushi I've ever eaten. They really need to take this off the menu. I'd rather buy and eat sushi from walgreens than from Spice Market Buffet.  I probably would have went for breakfast, but never got the chance. We stayed at Planet Hollywood for a week and never went back to this buffet. Too many other good choices.

a4WHQVha_tETFGu4ALZ-Qg.text: This review is for the BREAKFAST buffet ONLY.    We were comped a free buffet and it was our last day so we thought we would checked it out. At 7:45 am the food on the hot line was barely warm, scrambled eggs had the watery separation issues you often see.  Although there was an omelet station - it was not manned.  I waited 2 minutes and then toasted a bagel (at the station) and no one attempted to assist me. Therefore unable to review.  The Eggs Benedict was again lukewarm (current theme again) the eggs cooked well down, but the hollandaise was very good - but as I don't enjoy hard cooked eggs I only had 2 bites.  I did enjoyed my bagel and lox, as I assembled it myself I controlled what was on it.   The Orange juice was very good.  If we had actually paid for the meal... we would've demanded a refund.  The 2 stars are for the bagel/lox  O.J. And the service.  Bacon was ok (a tad greasy, but it is BACON, what do you expect?).

pRbREQghBrtADKLuiuKhkw.text: We had the Buffet of Buffet passes and made it to every buffet (with the exception of the Flamingo) and Spice Market was our least favorite. It's pretty small and the food is nothing to write home about. We wouldn't have been very happy to pay the entrance fee if this had been our only buffet stop. We probably won't go back ever again.

1QcL6C8Ik11As2dojg5xXw.text: It's been years since I've been to the Spice Market. I have fond memories when the casino was Alladin, before it changed to Planet Hollywood. Over the years, the quality of their food and level of service has declined.   Recently, we decided to take a spontaneous, gluttony trip to Vegas, hitting a few buffets. Coincidentally, we found a Groupon for a couple of places: Spice Market & Paris' Le Village (which I'll review separately) The deal for the Spice Market includes a bucket of beer (4 bottles of Miller, which normally sell for $7.)   We arrived around 4pm and were immediately seated. I asked the server if we can substitute the bucket of beer for a couple of cappucinos. She responded the "caps" were reserved for VIP's only, but she'll try and speak to management.   Wow, sounds serious! After 10 minutes, she returns w/ 2 mugs of half filled liquid with foam and proudly says, " Management has agreed to let you have these cappuccinos."  Oh really??? I felt so honored we were allowed to have this coffee drink even though we weren't VIP's. The way I see it, the 2 cappuccinos probably cost them 50 cents to make, thus saving them money over the beer, so management should have come out to thank us.   Even worse, the caps were the absolute worst I've ever had. After 2 sips, I was done. I've even had cappuccinos made by machines at the Mercedes dealership that were a million times better. If they serve these to VIP's expect them to jump ship to another casino. It would be rather insulting after dropping some cash at this casino and be served this mug of crap.   On to the food. Surprisingly, the prime rib was very tender and perfectly cooked to a medium rare. A bit of au jus and black pepper made this the highlight of the dining experience. Unfortunately, this is where the compliments stop. Everything else had the quality of something you might find at Hometown Buffet. It wasn't disgusting, but nothing at all was memorable.   They used to offer many types of desserts and freshly baked, soft cookies. Now, cupcakes. That's it. Cupcakes and a lot of it. It's a 5 year old fad consisting of regular cake batter & heavy, colorful frosting on top to dress it up. I passed.   Service was less than impressive. They weren't busy, yet our server would walk to her "area", point at her designated  tables and shout, " You OK there?" Perhaps that was her way of asking if we needed anything. Hmmm.... how about our money back?   This is 2.5 star tops. I clicked on 3 stars to be generous (and for the prime rib). I'm thinking... there's no need to go back for the next several years and will probably read Yelp reviews to check if there are any improvements.

pJTpoPuKM3s7rx3yd5h2jw.text: Tried few other buffet along the strip and lot of people said this one's better.  If this is the better one, wonder what the rest is like.  Not a lot of choice, but food wasn't bad. Try the steak if you're not a vegetarian. Service was horrible, seem there's very few servers.  Price was good for a vegas strip buffet.

oDjIGbUFgO36gHOgEOn07g.text: Lord knows I don't need to be visiting buffets! The splurge for this visit was fueled by my awful use of groupon and I bought the deal.   We showed up Sunday morning @ 10:00. The wait was brief, friendly service and clean dining area. The waitress was hysterical! She sounded fresh of the boat from Texas and was a great server--keeping us topped off on drinks and keeping the table cleared of stacked dishes.   Buffet food is always suspect for quality meat and items. This place uses a god quality distributor and had toast prime rib to be sliced along with the typical ham and turkey breast. I was excited to try a bite of this and a bite of that. The East Indian cuisine was delightful. The curry wasn't too hot but rich & spicy. Lots of tasty treats, fresh hummus as well.   We ordered the groupon with unlimited beer & wine which was a waste as we weren't saving room for booze during this trip. The dishes were clean and the seating area is well maintained. I would return anytime :)

VM8z5jKR7IV0dg1Wmk7omg.text: Had Sunday brunch. It was so good and also a good price. Served a little bit of everything, as most of them do. But my friend and I were very satisfied and completely stuffed, ha.

WyFBKboGH-E0YzV7f683Zw.text: With my groupon, it was well worth it! They have a wide variety of food like Italian, Asian, American, Mexican and Indian food. It wasn't too bad, but it wasn't the best buffet along the strip.   They have crab legs, shrimp, pastas, prime rib, BBQ rib, and lots of yummy desserts like flan, cupcakes, tarts and more. It was good enough for me!

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab legs, pastas, prime rib, BBQ rib, and Asian noodles

asun3lkVovraB7mMFlHjjg.text: Not a great buffet.  But not too expensive for Vegas.  It's typical cheap food you would find at a cheap chain restaurant.  We had breakfast and not much healthy to choose from. So we stayed for lunch and same thing.

cDf88EUsrTXyWwTtSFQIdA.text: I purchased a really good groupon basically for under $80, I was able to snag dinner for 4 people with unlimited beer and wine. This was pretty good for a Vegas buffet.  The food here is good for not being one of the popular ones. The lighting is a little dark inside but for the price, the food is decent.  We loved that there was cotton candy at the dessert station! I have never seen that before!  I'd definitely come back!

iK3g8vpk5blKiHiKpyGjlQ.text: I can't believe some of the ratings.  Did we go to a different buffet?  The one at Planet Hollywood?  We were on line for 45mins even when we could see there were empty tables because the staff couldn't get them cleaned fast enough and the front of the house couldn't coordinate with the waitstaff.    When we were finally seated, our waiter was nowhere to be seen.  I saw a waitress, for another table of course, who was carrying a platter of hot towels with lemons on top of them, but I guess those were for patrons who were paying more for their food than we were.  They had a great many different stations, but really, someone thought they were serving Chinese food?  Did anyone even consult a Chinese?  And the seafood, what a laugh.  Do people know that almost all the buffets in Vegas have shrimp and  snow crab legs.  I know it's fashionable to be skinny but I don't want crabs that were on a diet.  My husband says that for all the stink of the seafood, there weren't enough meat on them to compensate.    We didn't stay around too long.  When we thought about the $70 (including tip) that we paid, we left with a slight tummy ache (and not from a full stomach) but it was better than trying to eat the mush.  There was food spilled all around the stations that no one cleaned up and pasta that came up as one lump when I tried to grab some with the tongs.  It was better to leave than to sit there and get upset.  Never going back there again.

ebQfOiPX4ihsM3npnENhhw.text: Went here for dinner on the last Vegas trip. Buy the 24 hour buffet for 48 bucks and you can hit 3 buffets in 24 hours. You will feel like a fat person cause you're going to be eating a lot. Arrived here for dinner and it wasn't too crowded. Our server (the person who gets you your drinks) kept ignoring our table, which was quite annoying. We saw people who were seated after us get their drinks before we got ours. Some food was just plain awful, like the chicken. It tasted like I was chewing rubber.   The line wasn't too bad but when it gets busy, good luck. The good thing is the crab is already cut for you, unlike other buffets that make you work for it. Other than that, this buffet is like all of the other buffets in Vegas.

assN0hFdQjqjEQPZr1lu_A.text: Of the plethora of choices for Harrah's properties, PH has the best buffet of all of them. I rate Paris next in line. One way to know is how they make some of their food. For instance, the creamed chipped beef and corned beef hash are all made fresh. While at Harrahs, and the others, it is from a can. The Flamingo has gone up in standards a bit, but Harrah's and Paris have gone down hill some. If you are going to do the 24 hour buffet I would do PH as your main choice to eat.   For dinner, they have the best choices of all the other buffets and really do the crab legs well with both warm and cold legs. They also have peel and eat shrimp already peeled for you. That little step saves a ton of mess and time. It is worth the crab legs just to eat there.   Service is friendly and the staff were attentive to us. If you are Diamond or Platinum they make sure you are taken care of right away.    Make no mistake PH doesn't get five stars because it is not on the caliber of MGM or Bellagio. But for Harrah's properties, it is the best.

wrMJn8ATSv65Vv-AcCaQ9g.text: I'd give this place a 3.5 actually. The selection of different types of food is great! Food quality wise, it is ok. But what can you expect from a bufffet, ya know?   Sundays they offer unlimited Mimosas as well with your meal! But beware! Our waiter, had some kick out of opening the Champagne bottle before serving....meaning, the guy would pop the cork randomly at the ceiling letting the cork pop off like it was a missile on 4th of July?!?! The cork bounced off the wall an hit my friend sitting next to me AND then allow the Champagne to spritz everywhere on us?!? no apologies...as he just laughed and thought it was funny?!?! WTF?  He also did the SAME THING with another large group table next to us...laughing after launched his cork popped missile off the ceiling and hitting another guest?   Either this waiter needs review of customer service 101...or is having Counter Strike withdrawals!!!  Either way, not bad of place...if you are staying at PH

ZoNjBn5IwgBPgBEGKJKHHA.text: Visited here on a Tuesday morning for their breakfast buffet using a 25% off ACG coupon.  There was a fairly long, slow moving line at the cashier stand in order to be seated.  Service was AWFUL.  I had already practically finished my first plate before a server came around to bring drinks, and then only after I had asked another server is anyone was assigned to my section.  No excuse for that.  Also had to ask for the one refill I managed to get on my coffee.  The food was decent, except for a piece of beef of some kind that could not be cut with a knife or chewed.    My experience at Flavors buffet at Harrah's the next morning was much better.

VMRPf2kznoY2Yluq6uAZqw.text: Very large assortment of food!!!  TBH, I ate at ~ 5 different buffets including the ones at Bellagio, Casear's Palace, Aria, Treasure Island, Paris etc, and this one was one of my preferred.  I especially LOVED their dessert fruit tarts!

hHvLQBZOawgMfUfKfGTXYA.text: It's a buffet, and no one should expect gourmet food!  There's nothing special.  The dessert bar was filled with unmarked cupcakes.   So it was difficult to tell the flavors.  At over $35/pp, I'd rather pay for one good dish than a roomful of average everyday food.

pEFUMKPWvJyXaNFakZhkhw.text: I love the international selection. Lots of great choices. Actually one of the best buffets I've attend in Las Vegas. Staff was great. I would definitely come back.

UWpKvKick4-meUL7FBOHVg.text: 2.5 stars, but I'll round down.  Reading review online, this was suppose to be one of the best buffets in Vegas.  It was decent, but not something to ride home about.  The theme is a world buffet, with different stations including Chinese, American, Mexican, Mediterranean and I think Japanese.  Though creative, each station only had a few dishes for each theme, which limitis the buffet.    My husband complained that the crab legs were undercooked.  He was not impressed by their selection of seafood, however this is not a seafood buffet.  I had a roast pork that was very juicy, but nothing spectacular.  I'd say, skip this and go out to a restaurant instead.

1XvrUTnFnCzO5xFC2PEtDA.text: Probably one of the best buffets I've been to in Vegas. They cut the crab legs for you down the middle so the meat is easier to get to and the shrimp is cleaned for you (no giblets or whatever).  Get the $39.99 24 hour pass and you get unlimited buffet usage for here and all Harrah sister hotels. That means dinner, breakfast, dinner. We did it, saved a ton and ate like hoes.

Jl4mSRKJQFnUjIHyO5lL9g.text: Average buffet with lots of food options. Because my mother is a platinum member through Total Rewards, we had the steamed crab, which was good. Main issue is that the service was slow. A lot of tables were not cleaned off in a timely manner. Ok buffet, but much better options available.

mmGv9iLrOQXewfTkdl8LtQ.text: Dry, bland, overcooked, soggy with weird service. For the same price, just go eat dinner somewhere close by. P-Ho has a lot to offer: Cheeseburger in Paradise, PBR, Planet Dailies, Bugr to name a few.

JQpBT3zy6GUy4bJsJD_HkQ.text: Average quality buffet. Extensive selection. No expensive of exotic stuff so this is econo class nut witb business class pricing. Service is bad. Hard to get server just to get us ketchup. Does not refill drinks unless asked but hard to get a hold of the waitress. The Mediterranean and american food was not bad. The seafood is just cheap shrimp and other cheap items. Salad smelled like raw dish so we acoised that. Asian food was like a two out of five. Very sweet and Americanized. Low quality chicken used.

MIrpjQsuSBllFR-S22Ph8A.text: I was too impressed with this buffet. Came here the other night with my girls and the buffet platters seemed unkept and the food was often overcooked.   The only thing I really liked from here was the turkey, which was fresh and cooked perfectly. Otherwise, I wouldn't come back....

zdvFT4u7dmVOeBgkstI5Yw.text: This definitely isn't the best buffet in Vegas, but it will do in a pinch. I paid extra for unlimited alcohol (champagne), and was a little surprised when it arrived at my table served in a plastic water cup. Oh, well...it's all going down the same way, anyway! I don't know that I'd necessarily visit this buffet again (as Rachel S. noted, the interior is pretty drab and is reminiscent of a hospital cafeteria).  The food wasn't much better than what you would get at a Hometown Buffet or Golden Corral.  BUT...bonus points to our waitress; she was super sweet and before she got off her shift, she snuck over and left me with an entire BOTTLE of my own champagne. What a doll!

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Unlimited champagne (costs extra) served in water glasses?

kzUiJ_4Y-pKZRUB4USaChg.text: Everything here is tasty, fresh and well prepared.  The variety is huge.  The deserts are excellent.  I have been coming here since before the Aladdin became PH.  If it weren't for the new generation of buffets, this would be the best in Vegas.  They have a little bit of everything in a cuisine type segregated format.(mexican food is all together, asian is all together).  You can't go wrong here.

Q30j1O9LFioZJSNGVWpJ8Q.text: The food quality is god awful I would compare this place to the Golden Corral don't make the same mistake I did and waste your $37 for garbage.

pbXmNupQxHgJUvkrb_eZfQ.text: Part of the buffet of buffets promotion, this buffet is a slightly upgraded hometown buffet but if you go during peak hours, you will wait ~2hrs as we did for a party of 2. I would recommend passing on this location as all the meats were dry, they did not have enough people cleaning tables so that was the main reason there was a huge backup in the line, and overall the variety was above average but the quality was sub par. At least I didn't get food poisoning?

TU2f9mm5c62ZCwwMkeGE3Q.text: I pretty much tried everything there was for dinner.  I didn't like anything and I'm not a super picky person.  This place is good to go to if you have a deal, which makes it cheap for a buffet where you can grub on everything for 1 price.  FYI Dinner starts at 3pm, not 330pm as it states on their answering machine service.  We made it known to the cashier and he already knew that the machine is wrong, but yet no one cares to do anything about it.  As for my friend, she only liked the mashed potatoes, the crab legs and steak.

MtYAcTklHS_kvmNZ3TGZlg.text: Vegas is a place for silliness, and classiness. The Spice Market delivers on both counts. You wait in line for about an hour, go through a shimmering archway, down an escalator to. .  HOLY #$@$ is that another line?!?!? Fortunately for you it's only an extra 20 minutes. Plenty of time to release the inner child by playing patty cake, reliving sports punishment exercises, and ad libing the music videos running on the tvs which for some reason do NOT match the songs in the restaurant. But enough about the wait. . .  The Food- LIKE- the Spice Market has HOT crab legs. They even offered Snow crab and Alaskan King Crab when I went. (most other buffets only offer one type, and it's served cold)  LIKE- their dessert includes a crepe bar, and COTTON CANDY!!! perfect for cotton candy moustaches, followed by cotton candy paper cone unicorn pictures LIKE- unlike most other buffets, they keep things simple, but in doing so, they manage to season the food more perfectly than most other buffets.  DISLIKE- the lack of selection is a little off putting. If you have a group of picky eaters, and you are looking at paying more than $20 for this experience, there is a good bet that unless you are planning to eat $20 worth of salad and desserts, you might not get your monies worth.   The Service- WOW!!!! The only Las Vegas buffet that I have been to where the service was stellar and the servers actually, at a buffet deserved a 20% tip. We didn't have to ask for anything twice, and quite often, we wouldn't have to ask at all for anything! The most off putting thing about buffets is that used plates pile up on tables, but not here.   Great place to go to with delicious simple food. However, I think Mandalay Bay is till my fav. . they have Macaroons. . .

Gv00eh-2vp_u2F7APZQpRg.text: A pretty dead buffet with below average food. Ironically, service was good with our tables being frequently cleared and the gal watching our section was very attentive. My mistake was not checking it out before I paid. Learned my lesson. Go across the strip to Bellagio and pay a bit more for a lot better food. This place is not worth your time or money.

GtAghFpUIZz7UHGMuzfRgA.text: Gone very downhill. No crab. MAJOR disappointment. They downsized, limiting options and ruining the quality. Only good for no lines but that should be a red flag anyway. Shrimp was not firm, drinks were self serve which I personally did not favor. Very limited options with marginal at best flavor. Lamb kabobs were cold, cupcakes were dry, no flavor or taste. The decorations at the dessert bar made me not want to eat anymore. Service was meh. They weren't the best at clearing the plates but I guess that's expected when they're most likely understaffed. If you want to burn $25, come here. If you don't, find another place.

qlZ7nmFgeFPFNqvUfDkFjQ.text: Food was great and price was great. For $23 (weekday lunch) you get a bunch of different types of food and endless at that. The soda/juice/coffee all self serve. Food was well cooked and seasoned well.

Fwkf4Qq-2HbO2XWSxEAEZA.text: This place used to have a delicious buffet that people would have about. Ate here today since 2013. Blech! Super sub-par. I could have used my $17.99 for breakfast somewhere else. Definitely not coming back. The fool was stale /old, even the new platters they brought out didn't taste new. If you're thinking about coming here, just say hard pass!

RjYIhf7ztAxKYTWxKu0Ipg.text: 2.5 I'd say. Not going to wow you, and really if you're going for quality then buffets always seem like the worst way to go when it comes down to it lol.   We actually got in pretty quick, waited maybe 5 minutes. Space is a little cramped, none of the food items ran out while I was there. I tried a little of everything and the general consensus was bland.   The miso soup tasted off, not exactly what you expect from it. Sauteed veggies needed flavor, mac n cheese was decent but needed bread crumbs or something to kick it up. The pastas were bland, curry cauliflower needed more spice, the premade salads were overdressed and not in a good way. The lasagna was mostly just ground meat without enough cheese to actually balance it.  I'd say the things I actually liked were the stuffed sole, the mashed potatoes, and the mac n cheese since the sole was actually tasty and the other two had easily fixable issues. Black pepper seemed to be the easiest way to go about it really.   Necessary for recovery from the night, but I think I'll venture elsewhere the next time I'm in town.

2qurve1cm7mvBD6w4TxH_A.text: This buffet was a huge dissapointment. Part of our Buffet of Buffets. Golden Corral buffet for 14.00 has 10 times more selection and better quality food than this place. Don't water your time, money or calories on this place.

U66KuJRJd6oGDjT6NdrTMA.text: In Planet Hollywood Hotel. This used to be my favorite Buffett. Made sure it was on the dining list every time we came to Vegas. Unfortunately  it's gone downhill.  The breakfast buffet has minimal choices, at best. Ham is pre cut and dry as a bone. Not much of a selection.  Small Omelettes. Fresh fruit limited to melon only, and canned fruits. Nobody brings your drinks anymore, so you have to walk clear across the dining area for a drink or refill. $18.00 is overpriced for wha t is offerred. highly disappointed.  Will not eat here again. Save your money and maybe eat at Texas Station. Half the cost, same entrees plus more.

UuO9pjs-CXu4q92ySKbOoQ.text: Bad service, overpriced and overrated.  Went to the lunch buffet and although the food we had was good, the selection was underwhelming considering the $28 price tag.

9RpwcvuUMYOWmY6-0APSdw.text: This was the best buffet in Vegas over 10 years ago, then got a little worse, and now it's just so-so, and smaller.  Their traffic also decreased over the years and now the place is half empty. This could be due to competition from Bacchanal buffet at Caesar's and Wicked Spoon at Cosmo, but I also feel it's due to the lowering of the quality. They're now in a loop of having to decrease selection due to less customers, which in turn brings even less customers and causes further decreases of food selection and quality. Now you can't find here as much as a baked or sweet potato.  Forget about crab legs, sushi, fried shrimp, mushrooms and other dishes they had in the past. Years ago they also had the best and most impressive selection of desserts that later they kept decreasing and switching for silly cupcakes. Later they added better desserts back and now they have a few desserts that are still very good. Though we found a small bug in one of the desserts, and a hair in a yellow melon. The only thing that got better is the price, which dropped by a few dollars to $25.99 for dinner, mainly due to lack of crab legs. We (family of 4) still like this place, maybe for nostalgic reasons, and will be back to see if it will still improve. Though right now the new Medley buffet at Orleans seems like our top choice for lower-priced buffets near the Vegas strip, while Cosmo also looks good for medium-priced ones. Too bad the Spice Market Buffet no longer carries much status. (we visited Saturday January 6 2018 for dinner)

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desserts, January 2018

dwt8XrPk7vsdKhmIpyYrcw.text: 1st Time visiting Excellent omelet.. I was so pleased with the price, quality .. the customer service was great.. 10 10 10 10 10

h_q_phmRwQPN_pM9vXE2Mg.text: Was decent for breakfast last time I was here. Not this time! T selection was vastly reduced (see other reviews below about the flood and reduced seating/serving area. We should have checked yelp first.) Everything was extremely bland and low quality. My wife's omelette was completely inedible - she said it tasted like the oil they used to cook it in was rancid. The only thing we were able to eat was the bacon, which was actually decent for a buffet, hash towns, and French toast (which was in the Mexican section next to the Fajita/taco meat, which had no shells, tortillas or chops to it it with.) The staff was friendly and our server kept our drinks topped off and plates (of mostly uneaten nasty good) cleared. Definitely not worth $25 a person. Also, don't expect to do anything for the next few hours or so, and certainly don't eat this before getting on a plane. You'll end up in the lavatory most of the flight.   On a more positive note, we had breakfast at Pampas Churrascaria Brazilian Grille in the shops attached to Planet Hollywood yesterday and it was one hundred times better, AND it was only $10 per person. Should have gone back there.

1YKRlP5SfIH_fIuyOBv2kA.text: I went here for dinner. Quality of the food are very bad. The seafood section, there is only fish and very salty. There is no crab, no curry, no pizza. Super disappointed. As a buffet, they don't offer much choices. Just don't waste your money to eat in this place. Just go cross the street to have a buffet in Bellagio, a lot more better.

Z0z0uQXy3rhq8cthgoW8Kg.text: We purchased the buffet passes. This buffet is the worst one of the Caesar's buffets. Small, limited options, and dumpy decor.

IH-S4kH2kiiYx9SMNHaR5g.text: This review is only for weekday breakfast, I did not try any other meal there and I didn't visit on a weekend. The food is good, variety could be improved. Your standard breakfast foods are offered: bacon, sausage, scrambled eggs, hash browns, cheesy grits, etc. A nice selection of smoothies, grill items (waffles), and desserts are offered. Juice, coffee, soda, milk are all self serve. Plates are picked up promptly when finished. I did not see any ethnic foods available, despite some sections being labeled Mexican, Middle Eastern, etc. The price was a little on the high side for what was offered, but if you're staying at Planet Hollywood, it's convenient and quick. The employees were friendly.

Bsh0Cda4YVJoXhHhn59eOw.text: Glasses are still FILTHY!!!!! They remodeled the buffet area. The buffet is now smaller. Servers have always been very attentive, but during our first visit this trip we were without a server almost the whole time (and we are diamond status). I'm hoping by the next trip they will have it together.  Terri (cashier) is always a friendly smiling face.  *Vegas trip 1/30/18 - 2/7/18

DLwsZOmj8m_nZOZxa2na-g.text: Great food and quality for the price. A little bit of wait but worth it. Good selection too with a little bit of everything. From savory to healthy options. And they serve tasty  bone marrow

mfGQEXBFAmJ6_hrtUJ0hgg.text: Disappointed Wife and I tried this buffet because it was close to the venue we were going to see, we both were very disappointed . And quite surprised at the mimimune selection, poor quality and poor customer service. Though the waiters were nice. Not the servers. For the price I expected a lot better, The tritip was practically cold. When I returned to get a fresh piece , it also was just slightly warm. And when I asked the server to heat it or cut me a piece from the new cut on the board. She argued with me. That she had to use up the older piece first.Unbelievable . The lamb was also just warm and very chewy. While we were seated I observed the meat rack had about 6 skewers cooked just sitting on the warmer . And was never touched for at least a half hour. Meaning it was getting dried out. The Mexican section was a joke, looked like fast food. Save your money. I don't understand how this buffet stays in business , except for tourist like us that don't know any better. though the deserts weren't too bad. Ive been to a lot of buffets and for less money. This was the worst one I've ever been too. And won't be back. We were celebrating our 29 anniversary . Im very sorry I didn't make a better choice for dinner. This was last week on a Monday night.

kjMOMclg1c-4jlfhMqigAQ.text: I went there with my friends and sister on March 17th and we got the groupon deal. It was well worth it. Groupon deal for 4 ppl either lunch or dinner including drinks for $95 and comes with unlimited beer, champagne or wine. That's a good deal because the buffets in strip are expensive. They have a variety of cultured food from American, Asian, Indian, Middle eastern, mexican, Italian and their dessert station was wonderful. There are seafood like shrimp, mussel and crab legs. I wish they had hot steamed crab, not cold crab LOL. It was good to try it out. The food were delicious and flavorful.  The service was ok. On the side note, there is no cell phone reception there.

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BZOmsixYbswYUITekhk6-w.text: Poor selection, especially if you are a vegetarian. Food quality is marginal and the variety is poor. It's also located in the basement and is starting to look dingy.

4BUrzs4n9XBlYCtgHYq7tw.text: I've had better at a university dining hall.  Service is good.  I'd read some good reviews elsewhere about this buffet, but they must've been really old.  This buffet is literally in a basement and the food quality is as well.  Selection was limited by it's small size, but limited in some odd ways.  For instance, the half a station dedicated to asian food had fried rice, egg rolls, hot honey chicken wings and pork buns...um...where's the entree?  Fish and chips and no tartar sauce.  just odd.  The food was dry and just barely warm.  The turkey breast and chicken skewer were inedible.  The steamed pork bun was crispy on the outside (no it wasn't supposed to be) and the paper on the bottom had literally fused into the bun.  I ate half the paper before realizing what had happened.  The best item on the menu has the plain cheese quesadilla...if you take one from the middle, because the ones piled high in the pan are cold.  You get the picture.  Drinks were self-serve, which I have not seen at a buffet.  For a $25 dinner, I'd expect some service.  Speaking of service, the attendants were very friendly and helpful and spent time getting to know the guests.   Dessert was adequate and would be great if you love cupcakes...almost everything was cupcakes.  If you find yourself in Vegas and want a buffet, don't come here.  For an affordable alternative, try Station Casinos.  Far better food and half the price.  There are plenty of other good options on the strip as well.

8uWZopFQhPqB1dCXPn9n7g.text: Overall very good although I would skip the seafood section which does not taste fresh or wild. The American section was the best, with very good prime rib, ribs, Mac and cheese, everything else pretty good with some not-so-great mixed in. Atmosphere not the best but the staff was very pleasant. It could use a remodel.

zYY3oDuce0SddtfTJnWXOQ.text: Meh... Not my favorite place to go. I've been to a few buffets in Vegas. If you're willing to splurge hit Caesars but by far my favorite is at the Paris . Planet Hollywood is quick and cheep. No line (for a reason, it sucks). We had a great server, there is no lack of that but for food it's all cold, not good, lacking flavor, and boring. Don't waste your time, go to the Paris next door

1mbfcDVUHWiu38eb4_6zmg.text: I'm not sure what everyone is talking about when they refer to the quality of the food. We went at lunch for the Groupon deal which included 37.98 for all you can drink for two with your two buffet entries. Even before we got there the price alone sold us.   When we arrived we had a short wait in line, nothing too crazy. Were seated quickly and immediately hopped on the food line. Oh boy was I impressed with the selection.   The middle eastern section was by far my favorite, and this is mainly because I've found it extremely hard to find a buffet that can pull it off correctly. But this is the one! As far as the American food... Two must haves - Mac and Cheese, and their Au Gratin Garlic Potatoes...Wow, was I drooling right after our meal...  One thing that does annoy me about the Soup bars here in Vegas, its almost always Chicken noodle and Minestrone wherever we go. How about some Tomato Bisque or Broccoli Cheddar soup! Variety!  The only negative things I would say is that there service was decent. Nothing spectacular from our server but nothing terrible so it was slightly above average.  He could have been a bit better but was personal and didn't get behind even though they started getting busy. Even though gratuity was included with our deal, we still tipped....even though he was Patriots fan haha.  All in all,  you can't beat the price and compared to the other buffets on the strip, this one didn't fall short on food category for myself! TRY IT!

QAkIpAM1QyOWEIBQ8HTSVg.text: I had never tried this buffet. It seemed to have fairly good reviews and it posted a menu. It did not have all of the menu items on the list. Assorted sushi was not an assortment at all. California Roll was the only thing available and I could get better sushi at a grocery store. The rice was thick and chewy. The Prime Rib was overcooked. If you like your meat medium, with barely any pink, even at the thickest part of the roast, then you might like this. The Mediterranean Station was unappealing. The meat from the kabob was tough. The Mexican Station was deserted. Not much assortment, and all dried out. Will definitely not be going back.

_3rzYq9MYFuZC0Jh5jUg0w.text: Right in Planet Hollywood, good variety and if you like seafood it is fresh and plentiful. Price was $21.50 with tix4tonight, normal dinner pricing for a Friday night is $33. International cuisine.

ShTPkqFWLKAvFRcvRWSnvA.text: The reason I'm not giving this place one star is because of our awesome waitress (I wish I remembered her name!). But anyway, our experience was horrible from the moment we walked in and wanted to purchase a buffet dinner for two. The horrible cashier that attended us (her name was Veronica) gave us such a bad attitude when we were simply asking about the Buffet of Buffets pass. Literally talking down to us the whole time. After leaving, my boyfriend and I looked at each other and were like was that real life? She was so so rude. It ruined what could have been a nice lunch. Right after leaving the cashier we were asked if we wanted our picture taken by a lady with a camera. We politely declined and she rudely just left. The staff here needs a serious attitude check. The food was not great and not bad, just ok. Absolutely not eating here next time we're in Vegas.

QN_npk97nBLGLiU5pnDfng.text: Purchased a Groupon for the spice market buffet, hoping to be able to enjoy a Vegas buffet without having to pay $60+ for two. After getting our receipt, we waiting in line to be seated for about 40 minutes (Tuesday night) and after watching the two hostess arguing, what looked like the manager steps in to start seating everyone. We finally get seated and grab our food and by the time a waitress came to our table with our drink order and utensils, our food was cold. Food was no good. I would venture to say it was below average. Best part was the dessert station, other than that... I wouldn't come back here, nor would I recommend it.

PavbQDwB5Go0ubzCAjDg0g.text: Not bad. The mid eastern section wins the credit, esp. Quite authentic. Other things match the price.

vMOvHWjUq7tJ_xeZV3UaLA.text: Got a groupon to try this place out, we went here for dinner on April 29th and it was great. I liked it better than Caesars Palace Bacchanal buffet.

gjR_3G_RQyPsJVb-D26gHw.text: Went for breakfast and had terrible service and all the bread and egg items were stale (pancakes, waffles, dumplings, scrambled eggs, etc). Laurie was very brief and dismissive at the front counter and all the employees were just talking in a corner. Maybe have a friendly person at the front counter if you want your tip up front? My boyfriend and I left to get a second round and our plates were still there when we came back. Go to a different buffet if you want a good experience.

JKLf0iWRModM-AJRi_YddA.text: Ate here today for lunch.  Terrible.  Not only was the buffet half of the size it used to be, the food was very bad.  It was dried out and either too salty or flavorless.  Poor selection.  It was a sad shell of the great buffet it used to be.  If you want a good Vegas buffet don't come here.  You'll be disappointed.  There are several other much better buffets here for comparable prices.

l1r2vVIB7k2GckLmhhyZag.text: We went here for the breakfast buffet. It was a bit pricey. The first thing I noticed was the lack of clean beverage glasses. They were heavily spotted and a couple had food smears. The food was typical of most Vegas buffets. The prime rib was the best item. They also had mismatched food labels, probably from the night before. Yes, I know bacon when when I see it. But a couple of dishes I wasn't sure of, but the labels would say "bbq ribs" or "fried chicken" when the dish obviously wasn't either. I've had better and worse Vegas buffets. This was in the middle, and I wouldn't make a point of returning.

xfZf6Ongto0H94xbgpNFNQ.text: I looked at the menu posted on their site and decided to give it a try. They were missing may of the good items listed online. It was like a watered down version of hometown buffet. It's all Pepsi stuff (first hit). My husband had half a plate and couldn't bring himself to finish. We are a eat your clean plate family but today was the exception. Bugs were flying around and landing on a lot of the food. Food was flavorless and horrible texture. They had lamb kabobs. My plan was to eat that to make up for all the other bad food. It was so hard to cut through. I kept making that screeching noise when the knife hits the plate because it was so tough (kabob was sliding everywhere). Pass. Will never go again. Save your money, go somewhere else.

7uQGjXPil4eWEwj8maWGpg.text: I have to start off by saying that the staff, particularly my server Christina, was amazing and the deserts were really good. Other than that unfortunately this buffet did not stand out whatsoever and the food didn't seem very fresh. I'd say the biggest disappointment was the mexican bar and limited variety overall. With all the great buffets the strip has to offer i would not put this buffet anywhere near the top or middle of the list. It's food. If you eat enough of it you will end up full. That's about it.

aGp2WJTZbrfC92qpFE8sEQ.text: Excellent buffet! The best of the three I went to during my stay (here, the buffet at the Paris, and the Bucchanel). There was no line at 11, we got there in time for brunch which came with unlimited Mimosas (and our waitress was very attentive filling our drinks). The prime rib was to die for, tender and juicy and just plain fantastic. The fish and chips were also really good, crispy and not oily at all (plus the plating was very cute!) The selection was great, I only ate tiny portions and still didn't have enough room to try everything I wanted!   I will 100% come back here next time I go to Vegas and will recommend it to any of my friends that go to Vegas.

xDBJ9woHBOMZVdCTgdxQ9A.text: I went there a couple of years ago and went last night--- it was horrible! I spent $100 for 2 people and it was terrible---run down and mediocre food

GFnRnCjgdC6vFHIhFyHxHA.text: We went to the buffet last August for dinner. I'm not sure if my expectations have gotten higher or the food has become worst, but I wasn't too happy with our experience.  The wait, on a Friday night at around 7 PM, wasn't too bad, about 15 minutes. The service was fine.  The food, however, was tired, dry and lacking flavor.  Nothing was worth a second bite.  Stuff we've liked before was either not-available or had just declined in quality.  I won't be returning.

2bsBOa7Xf2k7PzpcPtKfgQ.text: Pros: line moves faster than the other Buffet of Buffets lines we've been in  Cons: the food is nothing special. We came for lunch and dinner since we stayed at PH and were disappointed both times. The food was very ordinary and doesn't live up to the Vegas Buffets expectations.

mOut1Ef0kwkqNe7apNCBng.text: OH HELLS YES! The food here is AMAZING!!!   Try the seafood station and the lobster pasta!   We didn't stay at PH, so it was $33 per person, but I never complain when it comes to delicious food.

rHWDFbuaoZ5u2NqGbTd93A.text: We have been fortunate enough to receive VIP treatment here due to our Total Rewards status... So they treat you especially well .. No wait line, special seating, crab leg platters, warm towels etc... We really appreciate this here! But regardless... The food is great! Wide variety of international choices, all stations well serviced. Good desserts. Great service. We'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. VIP table gets crab leg platter .... Nice!

kut2yccfFYY-ud6iNqjdCQ.text: One of my top choices for buffets in Las Vegas - and I have tried almost all of them. Spice Market Buffet offers a great variety of great tasting food for Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner. If you want to save some money print out the $5 coupon from destinationcoupons.com/n... - I've used it on several occasions and it's always worked. Make sure to show your Total Rewards Card if you joined the casino to save even more. At breakfast they have traditional favorites like pancakes, waffles, french toast, scrambled eggs, salmon and lox with bagels, oatmeal and fruit, etc. Some nice additions are eggs benedict - you won't find this at every buffet breakfast, and an omelet station. For lunch/dinner they have prime rib, turkey, salads, mexican food, Mediterranean food, seafood including crab legs, paella and cocktail shrimp, asian cuisine, and italian including pastas and fresh from the oven pizzas. And of course they have desserts - notably, made to order crepes, cotton candy and soft serve custard. I think this buffet is a good buy for your money - there aren't a lot of "exotic" foods that you would find at buffets like the Wynn or Caesars - however, the selection is delicious and you can't go wrong.

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert Selection!
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh Crepe with Chocolate Sauce and Powdered Sugar + Chocolate Strawberry

5cTF0hS5uTYZha5iDaa8Bw.text: I particularly enjoyed my time here at the Spice Market Buffet. Opted in for the Dinner and Drink Package and I thoroughly enjoyed myself. Atmosphere was great but could have been better if adequate lighting persisted. Selection in both drinks and food was great. Favorite area of food was definitely the Mediterranean food and certainly the desserts! Seafood is served here but the crab legs are served cold rather than hot. Bonus points for attempting Sushi!   If you do have the option to purchase a Groupon for this Buffet, dollar for dollar, this Buffet will exceed your expectations of a grandiose Buffet. Happy eating!

b2t3Y45tXlHh2SeVXqowRg.text: We had purchased a Travelzoo special for two with beer and champagne included. In retrospect, we should have used it for a weekend brunch where it might have been better value than a mid week lunch. The place was pretty quiet by Las Vegas standards and this is perhaps why some of the food offerings looked a little tired. Rice in the Asian section had dried up and the rather lame sushi in the seafood area was actually changing color. Desserts were mainly pastries and were the bright spot in this experience. Staff were very pleasant.

tYgL_8QG0kYbTeuXKfHkoA.text: Spice market has got to be one of my top 3 buffets so far. Everything was really good! I went for the champagne brunch - Saturday and Sunday from 10am-3pm. I love the prime rib with au jus and the pesto pasta. There are lots of room to move around each station; they separate stations by type/country of food. On both ends are the salad and soup bars; desserts in the middle. Along the stretch of yumminess, there is Mexican food, Italian food, Chinese food, middle eastern food, Mediterranean food, and American food, which includes the carving station and omelet station, along with other breakfast foods since it was brunch. The drinks are self serve. There wasn't a lot of seafood, but I don't really eat much seafood, so this buffet was great for me. It was also reasonably priced; I got it on Groupon for 45$ for 2 people, good for brunch or dinner. Definitely adding this to the go more often list. The end.

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fruit tart, chocolate croissant, cherry danish

vZwBEYwsfEpXLW1GETxL1A.text: Food was ok service was great! We were able to get right in on Thanksgiving! If your in Vegas it's a decent family friendly place. It was 1000 times better than our experience last night at Pampas.

bvwsHGPx-EpiaSwguFQjlA.text: Food is food, not great.  Service is excellent.   Food selection could be better.  Overall, it was enjoyable, but way too expensive for the selection and quality IMO

srU9WS9rq02phepZN-_jgQ.text: Horrible service! Employees are brain dead! They yell at you saying you are in the wrong line but no one is there keeping it organized. First the line to be seated ended up being at the exit for some reason. Then after seating several parties before us in that line our turn comes up and they then say we are in the wrong line and put us at the end of the correct line. I complained and they were still rude. Please if you get roped into buying the 24 hour buffet pass don't bother using it here. Rude staff and subpar food at best.

raiToQIzRC-jmk5yuabGAQ.text: Ate here after watching a show just for convenience. This wasn't my first choice so expectations were already low.  It really is a below average Vegas buffet. Looked at all th food sections and they all looked mediocre at best. It's edible but for the money, almost anywhere else is better.  The seafood section looked "old". Was afraid to eat anything there in fear of getting sick. It just didn't look good at all. Prime rib was chewy. Food trays were either near empty or full. Meaning anything decent was almost gone or the full trays were bad tasting.  Either way, I'm definitely not eating hear again. Sorry PH, not trying to bad-mouth you but I had a really bad experience eating here.

Fl-L_ZYaHHZLSbMkfv_3mw.text: We had the buffet of buffets pass and came back twice for this buffet. That's how good it was. I mean, it's no Bacchanal, but I'll trade the price of this place over that any day.  My favorite items were the mac and cheese, crab claws, meatloaf, and gyoza. Everything else that I tried was just okay.  In the mornings they make omelettes for you and have other breakfast items. However most of them don't look better than average. I stuck with an omelette and some potatoes with bacon which were very good. Their far right side isn't open in the mornings.

UL6pa38o6P3yP1VSKIiWpw.text: So I went here once before on a buffet of buffets  a couple years ago I believe for dinner but apparently never wrote a review for it. However this time I went for breakfast because I was already going to the Walgreens right next to here to get some drinks so I figured I might as well hit another buffet. I came right at 7am when they opened. Apparently they were doing some half off thing so it was only $10 for breakfast instead of the full $20. Which is probably a good thing because I'm not sure that this buffet would be worth $20. It's a very straight forward simple buffet. There was waffles, french toast, pancakes, smoked salmon station, scrambled eggs, and  oatmeal as well as hash browns. The pancakes were blah but the waffles and french toast were passable. I was surprised at how good the scrambled eggs actually were as most places they're dry and flavorless. There was a dessert station that had a variety of breakfast pastries but none of them really looked that spectacular. The winner at this buffet was the banana smoothie that they had at the fruit station.

ThhTiSL-_hvPqosus33_mQ.text: After weeks and weeks of eating healthy and getting my body in tip top shape for Vegas, it all went down the drain once I ended up at The Spice Market BUFFET!!!!!!!  The Spice Market Buffet is located inside Planet Hollywood Hotel and runs anywhere from $30-35 depending on Lunch/Dinner, we went here on a Sunday and the dinner price was the same lunch $32....You can also pay a little extra and do the 24 hour buffet for like $45-50 and you can come back to this buffet or go to any of the participating 24/7 Buffet locations listed when you buy this offer.  So why do they call this the Spice Market Buffet? - they try to make it an International food affair by having separate buffet areas from Mexican, Italian, Chinese, Middle Eastern, American, etc...  Best Entrees - Crab Legs (really good Alaskan legs) - Beef Burger (it was surprisingly good) - Middle Eastern (dolmas, dips, and naan) - Tandoori Kabobs (fresh out of the oven every 15mins) - Prime Rib (served by Chef includes dipping sauces) - Lamb Cuts (really juicy)  Stay Away From Me - All the American Food (expect for the burger) - Mexican Food (so bland made taco bell look like Maggiano's) - Asian Ribs (the smell from the sauce made me want to vomit) - Crepe (no effort, was eating raw dough)  Best Desserts (awesome selection of cakes) - Banana Cream Pie - White Chip Macadamia Cookie - Pecan Pie  My favorite buffet in Vegas is the Wynn but this is a close 2nd and 3rd and the price is right at low $30's so you can't really complain as the food isn't great but it is good....so if your close by you can't go wrong with the Spice Market Buffet Yo!

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Food Coma!
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fudge Pie

g8osGttEqGyBNDLAdDAyHg.text: We went here because we bought a groupon. It was worth the groupon price perhaps but most definitely not worth normal price. None of the food was fresh except the desserts. Everything was visibly past when it should have been swapped out for fresh food.   The rest of my party enjoyed the middle eastern food quite a bit. Everything else was sub par and not very enjoyable. The desserts were okay however. The salad bar only had four types of toppings. This was odd.   The service was not good. Although I will admit this was mostly because they were understaffed. When we ordered our first round of drinks (we paid for unlimited alcohol) she told us "it's going to be a while. I have three new tables." She didn't lie. It was a while. Dirty dishes did not get picked up, drinks didn't get refilled and the unlimited alcohol was cheap and awful. I don't expect top shelf. But at least better than $5 bottles of champagne when you are paying as much as you are typically for a meal here.   I would not return here.

qZZiT6_au01sKMb08JcMow.text: Several delicious  types of dishes from Mexican, Asian, seafood, Middle  Eastern  , Italian and American. Lots of yummy desserts. Waitress is super friendly. You will be walking away stuffed.

itrM1KEm7tFs7KXsOxxjOg.text: Horrible experience.  It was not busy at all and it's clear why. The food was not the quality or variety that neither my friend or I remember from our previous vacations. Many items were crusted over and I was applaud to see the staff members refill the hummus by pouring  "fresher" ( from container under refrigerated table) On to the top of the crusted over hummus.   Lettuce was due for a refill among the other cold items such as the lamb.   When asked to speak to a manger, the server returned to seek out the why. As the manager needed to know why she had to come over to speak to us.  The manager could not be bothered to find out why.  Instead when our sever returned to her the 3rd time to explain the situation that I was burned by the improperly set up carving station she called paramedics.  A bit dramatic when all I wanted to do was bring her attention to the problem to avoid others getting a more serious injury.  Talk about one extreme to the other.   I can't believe I paid for this both physically and financially.   Her delay and unprofessional response was shocking.  How can she not be empathetic. Instead she successfully ruined my friends birthday by making us late to the concert.  $200 a piece for front row tickets and had to go buy another dinner after words.  Been a better waste of money putting the cost of this trash buffet down on a table at least  it would of been fun. Stay away from PH all together.

c47w_36fhWazGFs4psOGQA.text: We had a 24 hour buffet pass so why not step into this one and give it a shot. This is a good overall safe bet buffet. There were some things that stood out that made this buffet very nice. So lets dig into this review.  I honestly can not think of any negatives other then the food being maybe average or a little under. However you will easily be able to find something you do like, I did. You walk in and you are literally surrounded by all the different sections of food. All sections are as follows, salad, Mexican, soup, middle eastern, American, Asian, Italian, seafood, and dessert, told you there are a lot. On top of all the different types of food they do have some unique foods that my girlfriend noticed right away artichoke hearts, grape leaves and tabbouleh.   When entering this buffet you will notice the dim ambiance. It has sort of an intimate feeling. The seating is nice, feels more like a restaurant then a buffet honestly. I do enjoy how spread out the food was. If I remember correctly the buffet bar took up three walls.  Lots of food, nice seating, many different varieties of food, and comfortable environment make this buffet a safe bet. There are so many buffets in Vegas that are actually bad, however this one is worth the price. Another interesting thing is that they actually have an alcohol section with beers and wines, which you can also buy an all you can drink pass...it is Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tabbouleh and grape leaves,  something different.
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice desserts
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Attention grabbing buffet entrance!

pRH7gNbacAyiIUPgg7I4MA.text: Eating at Plant Hollywood doesn't have to be boring especially if you're heading downstairs to the buffet. It's not super duper fancy, but this place comes with a few perks. For the price, I enjoyed myself! Overall- Try these things: -Crab legs:  Diamond and 7 star members can ask for a plate of steamed crab for their table. When I say plate... It's more like a tray filled with crab goodness. Nice if you have a big group! -Meatballs: CRAP (not in a bad way), they were good! I'm not normally an Italian eater, but I couldn't resist and was also tempted by the Fresh pepperoni pizza- another yummy choice btw. -Berry salad with lemon cream. Might sound strange, but the lemon flavor is very faint. It was more sweet than sour! -Meat: O glorious meat. I ate a lot of prime rib. And ribs. And... everything at the carving station for that matter. The prime rib was the best of the bunch. -Salad and desserts: Not as memorable as other buffets.   Don't judge. Just try.

M3mHvUVcPzpk2R-a02qzjA.text: Not too bad nice variety of cultures. Not my favorite though. Lot of the food was lacking but wasn't downright disappointing. Foods need more flavor for sure.

jLeuhXSUlbGbWHuNLgwtAA.text: Out of the 3 buffets we ate at from our Buffet of Buffets tour while in Vegas, this was the best one out of the three.  The variety they has wasn't bad and I especially liked the prime rib the most since it was served medium rare and wasn't tough or chewy like the one at Paris buffet. The crab legs were also good and I was only able to eat a few since I was so tired of eating the same foods after three buffets.  The interesting new items I tried were the country fried chicken in little small baskets which was tasteless and very bland. It was moist and juicy, but lacked any flavor. I also was able to try the fish and chips also served in small baskets and it also lacked any real flavor. It seriously needed some tarter sauce to help give it some taste.  The dessert area looked great with the many different kinds of cupcakes they had with multiple flavors to choose from. Too bad I wasn't able to sample any, but I did have the vanilla ice cream and it was just terrific. I'm not sure how they make it from custard cream, but it makes a big difference from your standard ice cream. It was very smooth and creamy like. My gf had the cotton candy from here and it was a nice big size plus I was surprised she was able to finish it after her meal.   Good buffet option for me to come here again the next time in Vegas and to come here first on my next tour of buffet of buffets.

45rL1bKlqSpIMOdiUs3daQ.text: I wanted to give this place more stars, but it felt like a very uneven experience. The buffet is a solid size. Everyone working was very friendly and attentive. Buffet is set up in sections. Mexican, Asian, Italian, Seafood, Mediterranean, salad and desserts. Hopefully I'm not leaving any out. The Italian and Mediterranean were fantastic! Especially the Mediterranean: lamb, mango chutney, best feta I've ever had. However, Mexican, and Asian were not up to par for me.  Desserts were also awesome. Another minor minor complaint, was the utensils to grab food at the buffet are metal and they are in very hot dishes. So sometimes the metal utensils are too hot to grab. Maybe I'm the only one!   I would go again, but stick with Italian, Mediterranean and desserts.

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

G6w42uEpKxon87OQ84dggw.text: If you're thinking about trying this buffet, DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME!! My husband and I bought a Groupon for this buffet for $46. It was buy one get one free and all you can drink. The cashiers here are super slow, now I understand that people with high level players cards get to go first BUT come on. It's not hard to take money!! When we finally got up to pay I found out my daughter was $19.99, she's 4!!! I guess if your kid eats pure crab, I'm talking pounds it MIGHT be worth it but I don't know of any 4y/o's that will eat $20 in food!! The groupon was already purchased or else we would have left.   As soon as we were shown to our table I made a a b - line for the crab. I had to go to the soup area for a dish for butter. When I got back to the table I picked out all the meat from the split crab legs. I went to dip some crab in butter and it tasted awful. The butter was cold and gross. Here I am with some tasty crab but now I have to walk across the whole buffet to get butter. Now to this point I thought it was my fault, that I let it get cold. NOPE the next portion I got was room temp. at best. I said screw it and gave my crab to hubby who doesn't use butter.   So now I went to search for food. The only things that really stood put was the prime rib, lamb kabob, potatoes au gratin, and  mac n cheese. All the food on the chinese, italian, greek, and seafood area looked old, dried up, or just plain gross.   So the dessert area looked promising. Although having 14 different varieties of cupcakes seems down right stupid. They had flan, creme brulee, fruit tarts, soft serve, pre made crepes, and cotton candy to name a few. The 2 cupcakes I tried were inedible. They pre make the crepe pancakes put them in a dish and when you order one they heat it up and put mushy bananas or runny store bought macerated strawberries inside.  It was not good. The flan was okay and my kids loved the cotton candy.   I left this place feeling like a dog with its tail between it's legs.  And I had a BOGO!  I feel bad for anyone paying the same per person here as Bellagio, Wynn, cosmo, or even Bacchanal. Again DO NOT EAT HERE go to any of the other casinos I listed that do have GREAT buffets. Oh man I'm pissed I wasted $80 after tip. And if you read my reviews I am NOT a penny pincher at all. I'm praying they refund my groupon lol

GyYqX6L2S-SB2Lzcc6XELg.text: I have no idea what the other reviewers are smoking, because this food was completely inedible. I am by no means a snob about food.  I like everything from In N' Out to organic free range beef.  I just like food that tastes good, the end.   And when I am hungover and starving, I am incredible easy to please when it comes to food. So, Sunday morning in Vegas I could have eaten just about anything and have been happy. However, I took one bite of each thing on my plate- which was a sampling from each different cuisine "area," and couldn't stomach a second bite of anything. It was so incredibly gross, there is no other word for it. I was in a group of five people and we all could not believe how disgusting the food was.  We all left hungry- from a buffet!!  I really can't understand how anyone could give this buffet a positive review on Yelp.  I can only hope that I can save someone their $25 by stopping them from eating here. We almost warned the people in line as we were leaving.  The only good part about our meal was our server, Nina, who was so friendly and sweet and amazing, we didn't have the heart to tell her how bad the food was. Plus it's not like she cooked it, anyway. So, this one star is for you, Nina!

7uHE5_pt-Lh4tKQOWHutpQ.text: Was expecting so much more based on other reviews. The buffet offers different ethnic foods at stations spaced around the room. I always start with salad to try to "green" up heavy buffet fare. I was disappointed by the slim pickings at the salad bar; basics only, lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers. Next round, my weakness, boiled shrimp. Unlike many buffet boiled shrimp offerings, these were perfectly cooked, not soggy. I tried the spicy chicken from the Asian section & it was decent. Husband's favorite was the lamb kabobs from the Mediterranean area. Desserts were so-so. All in all, this was neither a great, nor a horrible buffet.

jjd1HAZKVv3iMmpDhwYlQg.text: I've eaten here twice, and I think brunch was much better than lunch. The high light for me was the made to order waffles and omelets during brunch, everything else was mediocre at best, the Chinese food section needed much improvements especially.   You can get 20% off if you sign up for their a-list club card. But for the prices, I would suggest you going to somewhere else~ like the Bellagio, or South Point for around $10.

6phd-2442qUx0p2pDb2H7w.text: Lost its Pizazz. Long lines not worth the wait. Save yr time. Go somewhere else. Food overcooked in the warmers.

LQ9u1vcZfR4-zjEWPDiDdQ.text: We chose this buffet for a couple of reasons. One, we were staying in the hotel and two, we had a buy one get one coupon from Total Rewards. If it were not for those two reasons, I would not recommend going.   The high point--- Free champagne...and lots of it! The server was awesome!  The low point---When you finally get through the line upstairs you just get downstairs to realize you have another winding line to wait it! That sucked, and then to top it off the food was just ok.
