I am guessing there are better brunches in Vegas then this one!

StBt7OkmqkNDe6brfe2MGQ.text: This is a breakfast review.  The line is quite long, so don't go there hungry, the coffee(sic) is crap, plenty of choices, stale pastries.

xxT6ntNEI1PXHM9Y4dPVhA.text: We paid $27.99 per person for the brunch buffet. All though there was a ton of selection the food did not taste good at all and was a real disappointment. We did get free coffee and mimosas with our food which was nice, it worked well to wash down the food. Waste of money.

r16pp2QvD7R7Uro7f9Z7jA.text: My friend and I came here for lunch ($14.99) and loved it. The line was not long and the food was good. I was impressed by the Middle Eastern section, because that is rare at most buffets. The seafood had different things as far as fried seafood, pasta other creations I had never tasted.   The Mexican and Asian foods were limited, but what they had tasted pretty good. There were so many desserts it was hard to decide. If you come to Vegas with a group, this would be a good place to satisfy everyones personal request for different foods.

gi58Dpvh_2g8hrhOvQHVAQ.text: Four stars becaues it was an overall great experience.  Pretty fast service, 2 for 1 coupon, and good food.  Their crab legs have been much improved over the past years and their other seafood dishes were decent to say the least.  I really liked their beef shank dish that was cooked in some kind of wine/soy sauce.  It was really tender and GREAT.  I didnt enjoy their prime rib, like most other buffets but they had some good middle eastern style food.  I would suggest this place to anyone seeking a real vegas style buffet.  However, I really don't understand "best in LV" signs because i felt the Wynn or bellagio was probably better in terms of quality and ambiance for a few bucks more.

ieOzsWQlhH3qKrTvjqMKSw.text: Being of the ethnic persuasion, I love spice.  I mean, the spicer the better I always say!  But for some reason, this particular spice buffet was somewhat watered down on the spices and not as ethnic as I had hoped.  Next time I'll have to take my Tapatio sauce and a couple chili peppers to top it off.  Nevertheless, I appreciated the effort of a sprinked paprika or jalapeno sauce every here and there.  Proved to make it a thematic and worthwhile experience.    Their around the world "spice" set-up they had going was very "it's a small world after all" theme.  I particularly enjoyed their Middle Eastern section and the kabobs -- it's actually very hard to find a good kabob these days and I was pleasantly surprised.  They even had lamb ... I was stolked!   Their dessert section lacked some "umpf" but hopefully you'll have already stuffed so much shrimp and tacos down, that you don't feel like you missed out on much.    If you stay at Planet Hollywood, you get a discount (I forget how much) but overall, it runs about $25-$30/person, so remember to pull your room card out.  Not too bad as far as prices go on buffets in Vegas and the wait isn't that bad either.  Enjoy those spicey tuna rolls!

pvgChU488Z9zffDZPFEGTQ.text: Atmosphere was a little "old Las Vegas" despite being located in Planet Hollywood.  Rather bland tables and booths.  I was eating alone and was offered a tiny table right by the hostess desk.  I asked for another table and was offered one in the back next to several families with small children.  Not the best welcome!  Thank goodness the food was very good and the waiter was attentive and  friendly which more than made up for the hostess.  All of the food was very good and almost seemed over ambitious for a buffet.  Most could have been outstanding if they didn't have to sit on the buffet.   The place is large and the array of food is extensive.  I really enjoyed my meal.

sB9rMe8J6ebMEmsMo5zvNA.text: So not impressed. If I wanted to spend this much on brunch, I would've gone somewhere better, but no, the people in the group wanted this place. I think we should've questioned her taste buds since she was slightly sick/congested.   The place had different stations. There was American, Mexican, Italian, Asian, a Salad station, Seafood, Desserts, and MIddle Eastern, which included Indian food because apparently India is not Asia according to Planet Hollywood.   The line was quite long, but it was around brunch/lunch so my party and I waited in line, which didn't seem that long of a wait. Or maybe it didn't seem that long since they had TVs playing a Nets game and people were all about Lin, but I digress. Once we paid, the total came to $31, we had to wait to be seated, which again didn't seem so long a wait. We marked out drink orders on a paper and went off in search of belly fulfilling food. I got the usual breakfast food: eggs benedict, bacon (a lot of it since I don't really eat bacon lol), as well as some fruit and harsh browns. Another plate contained stuff from the Middle Eastern station, like some chicken curry, basmati rice, their lamb stuffed tomato thing, and pita and hummus. Well have to say, I enjoyed the breakfast stuff, aside from the non-runny eggs benedict and was kinda disappointed in the Middle Eastern station. I found the food at that station a bit bland and asking "Where is the spice that makes this whatever it is suppose to be?!"   Luckily there were drinks, although the OJ was a bit warm for my liking. And the mimosas were more like an Orangina than a mimosa. We asked for water, but that didn't come till later. I almost thought the poor server forgot. Anyways, I went back to the buffet to see what else I could eat. I didn't find much too appealing cause I was a bit full, but I soldiered on. I went back for a crepe which was at the dessert station. They didn't have any strawberries (big boo to that!!!) so I settled with cherries topped with chocolate sauce, whipped cream, and powdered sugar. I found it a bit blah; too chocolatey and the cherry filling was a bit off putting for me.   I got another fruit of plate and found I was more satisfied with fruit than I was with anything else. I could've gotten it and a decent mimosa somewhere else or found better food at other buffets on and off the strip. Aside from the fruit, I liked the cotton candy :)  I like buffets in Vegas, but not this one.

M_mpSrL7eIdxbT6sUixvgg.text: A great selection of food. I especially liked the sushi, king crab legs, and Mediterranean section. The dessert table looked delicious.  They even have cotton candy! Great service!

jwnm_842rMOYN-Raw9xzbw.text: We came here on a Sunday for lunch. More than $50 for the two of us because of the "holiday" weekend  (Memorial Day).   It was about 3pm, so there were a lot of empty tables. We paid and were told to stand behind two other parties and wait to be seated. A few minutes passed before those people were seated by a woman who never returned, and then we proceeded to wait...and wait....and wait some more. After ten more minutes, a large queue had formed behind us and we were all asking the cashiers where the host was. She said the host was "on her way" but no one ever appeared. A handful of employees and waiters passed the long line of angry customers, and NO ONE seated us. All the employees were looking at each other in confusion, but no one took charge.  We were finally seated in a nearly empty dining room by Luis. My husband and I informed him we had been waiting for over 15 minutes to be seated and asked for an explanation. He just kept saying the large open area of seating was "closed" (for no apparent reason) and that they couldn't find Joy, the lady who usually seats people. He nodded along to our complaints and said he would "tell Joy." How about you tell management that Joy is not doing her job?  The buffet itself is average. The sushi was bad and so was the "Italian" food. Their only strong suit is the dessert bar--it's full of tons of cupcake flavors, ice cream and cotton candy.   I'd never been to Planet Hollywood before, and this is absolutely my last time at their buffet and casino. Don't waste your money on mediocre food and TERRIBLE service.

fIdl6soKf2WbFUHk8GSVmA.text: I kind of feel stupid for reviewing a buffet because, well, it's a buffet. But anyway this one sucked, a lot of the food was cold and they didn't replace items that ran out.

Tc-Fu9PS4N2EInEsFJCFFg.text: My family loves this buffet and have frequently eaten here since this buffet opened. The servers are always wonderful and thoughtful. However, on our recent trip to Las Vegas, we were shocked to see the entire dessert buffet changed. We always enjoyed the upscale desserts offered at this buffet. Now  they have replaced Cream Brulee with cheap cupcakes! My 9 year old was even complaining. I spoke to a manager and he was not responsive the way our server was. My family will not return to The Spice Market Buffet until the upscale desserts have returned. What used to make this buffet worth the trip is now gone.

MK5XBmlTEspdAauA5AvG1A.text: It's a buffet... with fat people.    Yes, they offer American, Mexican, Italian, Mediterranean, desserts, etc.  Food is average, though the prime rib was decent for a buffet.  I am underwhelmed by the food in this city so far.

pG5Pofk7lchueltyFiIIrQ.text: So while we were staying at PH we saw a sign on our door in our rooms that the Spice Buffet was voted #1 hmmm 2007? or something like that (shameless advertising) So the girls and I woke up and went downstairs to taste the #1 buffet...  I guess everyone else read the memo on their doors cuz the line was long.  The buffet wasnt even pretty.  We sit and hmmm what should we eat first?  It was typical brunch selections. However nothing at all was extraordinary.  I didnt find anything that I wanted to get twice.  Booooo what a waste we should have hit up wynn again =(

NvN2gXM6X8bVIOAhhpIyJw.text: Go elsewhere- the quality, service, price, and variety are nothing special (with exception to the Middle Eastern Food).  The buffet at the Rio is much better!!!

4TvPOn1qdAIwF4UnyroPgA.text: Very nice breakfast buffet. We got a nice deal since we stayed here. They gave us $25 off the price coupons. You know something is going to be expensive when they are willing to give $25 off, right?   Not so for the breakfast.We got two meals for $7.30! Score! No, not each, total! Yes, I still think it would've been worth it had we each paid the $17. Some different fare here than what I generally see in my Reno forays. Lots of fresh goodies like lox and smoothies. They had two kinds of pancakes and all of the made to order stuff.  We had plenty to eat here and the food was pretty tasty too! I'd try this buffet again. It looks like the lunch and dinner offerings are nice too.

6vWxnUr-qkAURES3TSfb_Q.text: This place was good but not as good as the Rio. It has different food like Indian. It was good overall but I was just too tired.

38YKRg6-JVSpmf6PWfwomA.text: UGH.  Don't ever, ever, ever go here.   EVER.  My husband got the worst case of food poisoning from this place. It totally ruined our trip to Vegas. Wanna know how bad it was?  It started out with him having diarrhea. For hours. He was finally able to get a couple of hours of sleep. We headed home. There was no traffic, but it took us 6 hours to get home. It shouldn't have taken no more than 4. It took so long because every few minutes we had to pull over so he could throw up. He couldn't even keep water down. He'd take a sip, we'd pull over, he'd puke up water.  HE COULDN'T EVEN KEEP ICE CHIPS DOWN.  Also, the food wasn't that great. Nothing to write home about. And it was fairly expensive. I can't remember exactly how much it was, but I do recall the distinct feeling that I was getting RIPPED THE EFFE OFF.  If you want a good buffet, go to the one at the Rio. That's the best one. Best food and best bang for your buck. Most of the other ones are overrated.

97BdAJAvL274nrolK1UARw.text: The ONLY word to describe this buffet - EeeeEEEWWWWwwwwWWW!!  Avoid at all costs.  Any place that can ruin crab legs, amongst many other things, does not deserve $35/person.  Save your money!

YQKTG7htwYzLXFxuB0wMrw.text: For 35 $ per person you would think that it comes with great service for a buffet which it did not, I just don't understand why people starve to serve good food but employ those who put their hard working reputation on the line. And In this case is the manager once again who left my family waiting in front after a long standing in line. How hard is it to put 2 tables together ? But it is easier for him to seat 20 other people down. Once again People tend to ignore seniors and kids. Anyway I will not visit this place again.

A3Tjt_Wk8jZONFVIxfA3sw.text: Long Line... 2 lines one upstairs and another down in the dungeon basement... felt like it... Thank goodness I was able to bypass with  my platinum rewards card... Or we would probably be in line for at least 3 hours!!! No joke!  The seafood was ok... not too much variety but it was decent... They didn't have alot of choices but the food wasn't half bad then going to other places of Harrahs food chain in which my whole memorial weekend have been having really bad experience with customer service or worst selection with Paris and Caesars Palace.   Although with the Rio I have never complained every experience has been at it's best... Planet Hollywood is ok but a little bit overrated I think!  The service kinda sucked and waitress kept forgetting to bring me stuff... I did the 24 hour pass... this would be one that I would check out...

4NJhUtMLLK_NQ7v8RC2AQw.text: WOW....we sat through a painfully long West Gate timeshare sales gig last month, just to get tickets to "Vegas, the Show" and vouchers to eat at this buffet.  No, we did not buy and they weren't rude at the end.  Both the show AND the buffet were well worth it!!!  Yes, the best prime rib ever!  My husband is the meat-eater, and he was over joyed that he could ask for quite a thick slice without any attitude from the server.  You could cut it with a fork!  I usually try a little bit of everything, and it was all tasty, but went especially for the wide variety of sea food.  Couldn't wait to get to the desserts, mostly the cotton candy, the first time I'd seen this at a buffet.  Tried the bananas foster, yummy, but the choco covered strawberries.....I must've eaten about a dozen!  Would want to eat here again, but would have to really think about $27.99 a pop.  Will have to look for some kind of discount on our next visit to Vegas.

7_lrjkIreOrgBHzXWzT62Q.text: This buffet was not too bad at all. There usually is a wait, but this is Las Vegas, and there will always be a wait for a buffet.  There seems to be a lot of good selection.  No big complaints here.  Since this is a Harrah's property, we bought the 24 Buffet Pass.  Definately worth the money.

EN-N6NqN3SMFbizIhsa1uA.text: The market spice buffet was one of my favorite buffets in Vegas but this last time wasn't so good.  Maybe it was because it was 2PM and the food was sitting there for awhile but everything I grabbed was dry.  I grabbed one plate and that was enough for me.  Luckily, i had the 24 hr pass so I saved my stomach for Caesars that night....

XxFe1dhzhegxKHwCbqEorQ.text: Part of our 24 hours buffet bonanza ($49.99 for Total Rewards Members), loved the lunch selection.  There were options from all over the world and the desert spread was awesome.

DZ9gTxLkUdlRadh4xh4KOg.text: Great Sunday bruch buffet.  Great selection.  About average priced.

OtcOGdWpe50prdqx5zJZwA.text: This place is not like the Wynn or Bellagio buffets but it's still pretty good. Ridiculous line at dinner so make sure to go a little early if you're not a diamond/platinum player. The prime rib was amazing and they had a brick oven for pizza. They also had a ice cream machine. (yay!)

IcJB0CdLBOwEk5wYPgsx8w.text: Feel like i am being way generous for the 2 star, definitely very disappointing, how is it only half a star away compare to wynn? Omg!! Yes, lots of different food. Yes. It was moderately expensive. No. The food, did not taste good... =(

LOVlxvmmRkCNJKkK97Hk5Q.text: Another good Buffet in Vegas. Many selections and stations including Mediteranean/Mid-eastern section w/ Kabobs along w/ American / Asian / Mexican / Seafood / salads  etc. This buffet has many items to choose from similar to Rio (not quite that big and Mirage). Place is nice and clean with lots of room....Desserts are good too....

wNuFRb-sa0alv5T7dqd0sA.text: Is this the place where they had green cotton candy in the buffet? To me, how could a place like that not get the highest rating?? Haha, more later.

ZExdYB61I0FYdlCJFzGfFA.text: This buffet was reallllllllly good the first couple of times we've been to Vegas, but the last time I went here it wasn't so great.  The quality seems to be going down.  The best time for their buffet is sunday brunch!  Free champagne and mimosas!

_l-_A6WXxybcg3Uokp93ew.text: 1.  The lunch line was an hour long, but when we got inside half the tables were empty.  A lot of the empty tables were still dirty and hadn't been cleaned yet.   2.  Hostess was very rude to us.  We refused to pay the mandatory gratuity for large groups so she split us up and sat us on opposite sides of the buffet, even though there were empty tables available near each other.

33ztMcjeT36A0w6kZe57pQ.text: Another Las Vegas buffet which means another expensive. The Spice Market Buffet is my favorite one, They have the foods that I know of. It's cheaper than The Buffet at the Bellagio and Wynn. I came here twice. Once before the make over and one after the make over. Both times weren't busy. I would come here again to see the other items I haven't gotten to try.

oBfpTN6AuV0samfPtJPjyg.text: Line wasn't too bad for breakfast/brunch buffet, the Spice Market Buffet was a good deal in my opinion. I like the options from American, Italian, Mexican, Middle Eastern, and Asian cuisine.

ZReEq9r906P7Th3F65-CWQ.text: Basically crappy food. The crab legs were good, but Rio's seafood buffet has better ones. They had different types of food, Italian, Mexican, etc. But it was no where near authentic or tasty.

B7dc8iLef2thXagF_7WvDg.text: So I was in Vegas this past weekend and my friends and I decided we would hit up the promotion of "Buffet of Buffets". Which basically is 24 hours of unlimited buffets at any of the Harrahs Hotel group buffets. We opted to go here cause the line for Paris' was way to long.  Wow I can just say me and my friends were very disappointed. While they have a lot of different types of food (Salads, Mexican, Middle Eastern, Asian, Seafood, American, Italian, and Desserts) the quality was just abysmal. As I was walking around and checking out what i wanted to try, I had a very difficult time actually putting stuff on my plate, because the food just did not look appetizing at all. In the end, I tried to get a couple of different items and each was just taste disgusting and just I just couldn't finish. I thought the desserts might redeem the buffet but even though the desserts looked decent, they tasted just horrible. I can say the only thing I liked from the buffet was the watermelon. Some of my friends who I came with are not at all picky eaters and even they thought the place was just gross.  Please save your money and try another buffet, you'll thank me later.

P82jWN3XUaFkZbLrz9pAhQ.text: Thoroughly underwhelming for the price, even given the Vegas strip markup.  We came for breakfast, which had a reasonable selection, but low quality.  The fruit was fresh, the breads we tried we're not (although there is a large selection, so some might have been fine).  The Service was minimal, and despite the price we had to get our own drinks.  There were some dishes out that, upon trying, were clearly left out to harden from the previous night.  Overall, there are better options to try for less within a 5 minute walk.

7uMSMlZC99JVx6jI8ohWCw.text: I gave it a "vegas buffet rating" of 4 'cause the food was pretty good, our server was a sweet lady who was very hospitable, and NO LONG LINES! Rating was for dinner.

NgUa3kJU4Z-ealwdNEzJIw.text: This is one sad buffet. We paid regular price and it was NOT worth it at all.  Came here on a Saturday Night in hopes for some good food. There were several food stations there and the only thing I liked was the prime rib.   Majority of the things there were incredibly DRY. Mexican and Mediterranean section were barely touched and looked like it was sitting there for awhile.   Dessert section was sad. Cupcakes were rock hard, crepes weren't fresh, they take premade crepes and cook them in butter add some banana mixture and Nutella in it.   My friend said the cooks there looked like they didn't care for the food quality, which I could agree on because the look and taste of the food says it all.   I would not recommend this buffet to anyone.

fQh4VNMxXVi6u1xzlfbVtg.text: Mediocre at best. The food is edible but with little flavor. For instance the crab legs taste as if they had been boiled for two hours. We tried almost all the stations trying to find something to bag about. The end result,  the all you can drink mimosas wins out.  If you join total rewards and apply for the 5x points credit card you will get two free buffet passes.  This will save you the sixty dollars for you and your significant other.

ZnJMIGKyABpsQ2-C3MIotA.text: First time visiting and loved it!! Great variety of food and have tried just about every buffet in Vegas. Top of the line still ceasars palace, bottom Excalibur now they changed it. Favorite Paris Paris. This would be a close second with the MGM or Bellagio. Give it a try won't be disappointed..

r161dCQD5qSXVH0FHOEqmA.text: The food was great! The server was a bit slow but we asked for two drinks at a time so we wouldn't have to wait

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The food was great! The server was a bit slow but we asked for two drinks at a time so we wouldn&#39;t have to wait

W6Ou-HLffsct-WwMRWVBEw.text: As usual, we arrive somewhere late at night and hit them at near closing. We got here at 10:57 pm and had three minutes to pay and 30 more minutes to get our plates before they packed it up. The couple behind us got turned away and she told them most buffets on the strip were now closed. I think there are a few open 24.  My husband and son had been to Vegas last year for a car show and bought the wrist band that gives you access to more food than you need and putting that wrist band on is almost like accepting a challenge to make it pay big, so at least if you lose all your money in the casino, by God you will make it up on that wristband of 'all you can eat'. Challenge accepted.   We did learn we could have shown our Harrah's card and gotten the wristbands for $44. We paid $55. Not sure why, but the next morning the woman told us they charge different prices at different times with no explanation, but with the Harrah's club card, its the cheapest.   Now we REALLY wanted to make it pay. It is True you get sick of buffet food by the next day. My husband took us here because last time they were here, everyone said this IS the best buffet. Honestly, they really do all taste the same.   We had one of the casino workers tell us she loved Harrah's hated Bally's. I was like really why? She said she didn't like walking so far between the stations. We ate at the Paris Buffet for lunch and Harrah's for dinner and a breakfast.   Nothing off the charts, but still pretty good selection for the most part.

sBM_JcGiXd2idXu6xpcQXw.text: It only gets 3 stars because we had a groupon. If I paid full price it would probably be two stars. The aria's buffet is far superior.   However, I do want to say that desserts were delicious, contrary to some of these reviews talking about only the cotton candy and the cupcakes. They have expanded to other items that rank right up with the wynn's dessert concoctions.

b-yeCY8Xahdl3tNr7bgMmQ.text: First and last time. I have never been to a buffet that does not have a server to handle drinks and clean up. Service is available for VIP only? Since when is there a VIP service at a buffet?! It made me laugh lol. We had to get our own drinks and when the plates started piling up, we started setting them on the table next to us. I didn't like that we had to do that but the table was getting crammed, It was horrible! The food is below average. Nothing special whatsoever. If I had to compare the food, it's probably the same quality as a station casino buffet. Not what I was expecting from this buffet having to pay 3 times more!

rQ8-hzRWqd8NRyOLJnfcKA.text: Spicy indeed. I didn't know that Spice Market hosted amateur MMA fights between Arabs and Indians. Whilst waiting in this ridiculous line to enter Spice Market. Two men started arguing. One man was with his girlfriend/wife significant other and the other with his entire family. For some reason Indian man gets mad at Arab dude for being an Arab dude, cause he's loud and letting family members family members cut in, which started the whole thing. So they go to almost throwing blows cause Arab man can't let it go. Says "I would buy you" bitch, you're eating at a cheap ass buffer, picking up receipts off the ground trying to get freebies. I saw your sandy ass. Anyway, Security comes calms everyone down, then they seat the Indian man and his significant other first. Fifteen minutes later Indian man comes walking by with a plate of food while Arab man and family are still waiting and angry. Arab man talks some ish to the guy as he walks by, Indian guy ignores it and smiles. Good for him. So now they go to sit the Arab family down and they put them at a table right next to his opponent. Lmfao what the hell are you thinking Spice Market employee. So now Arab guy knows where Indian guy is sitting, and starts harassing him there. He said some words as he walked passed, again, calm as a Hindu cow, Indian man did nothing but smile. That's called winning folks. Security asks him about it, I see three guards run over to Arab guy, they're all arguing, but i can tell the situation, they're getting removed. So I finish my terrible meal, I'm not even going to go into details cause at this point, all that matters in this restaurant is not getting blown up at this point.  My wife and I decide it better to finish out plates and leave before it gets even more escalated and then, KABOOM.  This was all over a course of 2 hours, 60 minutes of waiting in line, front row fight seats, than another 45 of deciding what to eat and wait for our drinks, 15 minutes to discuss and ultimately decide, never get a Spice Market Groupon again. Good day.

4eyqgTUqCVA5bgC3cRCbNA.text: It used to be one of the best buffet years ago!  I came back to the place last Saturday with high expectation, but left with disappointed.  It is ok with the price with high price Vegas standard, but it is not on the high quality list anymore!

9rFVBuuGKd-2Dod0rWNHtQ.text: You get what you pay for, but I was hoping that for $30/pp with a Groupon the quality would have been better. We wanted a buffet for our last night in Vegas during the 4th of July weekend, but didn't want to pay an arm and a leg. Everywhere else was charging $50+/pp, so when I saw the Groupon for this buffet I thought I scored ($95 for 4 buffet dinners w/ unlimited beer/wine). Get there, and there's a short line- no biggie. Get a table and immediately start walking around the food options. Nothing really looked appetizing, but I'd grab small portions of stuff that I thought I'd like. Most of the food was luke warm and bland. The quality of the food wasn't much better than a Hometown Buffet. Lesson learned, if I want a decent buffet I'm going to have to pay at least $45.

1UR451vqxHjFelSzOr0zjg.text: The buffet at planet Hollywood is over priced for what it is. It's sad to see that the quality of our buffets in this town keeps going down. I remember when they were so much better and whenever I had family or friends in town we would always visit one. Things have changed a lot and I am very sad to see them all get worse. The prices keep going up and that quality keeps going down. It makes no sense.  They had a wide variety but it was hard to find good items that I wanted to go back for. With the prices it just doesn't make sense.

CVQJ_3Ls9AOBGrya_CqhPw.text: My partner and I went here a few weeks ago because we wanted to experience a Vegas buffet and we had a coupon from the hotel we were staying in. It was clean and had good food and a good variety. However my chief complaint was having to pay an extra $13 for a mimosa. With how expensive the buffet is there should at least one complimentary drink. I spent 50 bucks to get into the buffet I would get at least one drink on the house. Our table was also completely cleared off while we were getting food and we had to be reseated. Super inconvenient but not too big of a deal in the end. The price of the mimosa was more of a sore spot than that was.

ZU0Y0ihQbQ4gmvmYrOsqeQ.text: Definitely your best bet for the "buffet of buffets". Excellent variety of food and it all looked fresh and hot. Loved the crab legs and peel n eat shrimp. Tomato bisque soup was excellent. The dessert section was fun too. Not to mention you get your own drinks, so no waiting around for a waitress!!

dDpBuQrPUNhExS5f9_Id0g.text: My family and I have been coming here for 10+ years and this was our favorite buffet to come to. We came to this buffet today and this will be the last time we ever come back. We are so angry and disappointed at what this buffet has become. It is not worth paying for anymore... I would not recommend this buffet at all

2hI7QfoANmD5Pz2QCIZiIA.text: I was pleasantly surprised. The line was short when I went and we got seated right away. I loved that everything was organized, there were visible signs "seafood" "Mexican" "Italian" "Asian" "American"  "desserts". It really helped me to prepare my game plan. I was able to quickly get a little from each section. The desserts were amazing. In addition, for an extra $11.99 it's all you can drink alcohol.  Overall, a decent buffet.

66ssNCqJpfobiUy37zRBgA.text: Just grim. There are so many nicer places in Vegas to eat. This place felt like some kind of food purgatory. Sad. We were in a rush cuz we had to go to a show. Eeks. Would have been better off at PF Changs. Don't do it!

s-zOk0oC4iKWsI0rp8n7Rg.text: Had heard wonderful things about the Spice Market Buffet so wanted to give it a try. I am Indian so was excited when I saw tandoori chicken, chicken curry and naan at the buffet but I was extremely disappointed. The tandoori chicken was absolutely not marinated, they just added a crap ton of red coloring to make it look appetizing. The naan is not really naan but just pita bread...False advertising?  Out of all the sections, I probably liked the seafood section the most but was a little careful because I didn't want to eat too much seafood and get a stomach ache later. The Asian section was horrible! The lo mein was so dry and the chicken looked rubbery and fake, again...I was extremely disappointed.  I could keep going on and on about all the crap food but I think you get the idea. The best part of the entire buffet was our server. She was very sweet and the only reason I'm giving Spice Market a star is because of her.  Weekend lunch price is $30.99+tax/person and that is definitely a rip off. For the quality of the food, it should be more like $9.99/person.  Kinda bummed that we shelled out so much $$$ for horrible food but it happens and at least we gave these so called amazing buffets a shot...never again.

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake was pretty good
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cupcakes
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The veggies &amp; hummus were good. But tandoori chicken tasted fake

YyFZVWjOhevrLQplQ20Pow.text: Terrible! Waited an hour in line and paid over 30 bucks per person to finally get in and "enjoy" the cold, stale, nasty food. Service is slow. Servers are rude (i guess they're overwhelmed) I tried hard to think of something positive to write about this place but I couldn't find anything! Awful experience all in all ... do yourself a favor and go  somewhere else. This is Vegas for God's sake, there are literally hundreds of other options!

NadUh4aHihY0SLx9NKsviw.text: I got a coupon for this buffet but was cautious going there after reading some of the reviews here. I was pleasantly surprised. The food (dinner) was very good. I enjoyed several pastas, stir fry, a couple Asian chicken dishes, and one of the best peanutbutter chocolate cupcakes I've ever had. If I hadn't gotten so full, I would have had another! I left full and satisfied. All the food was fresh, hot, and well prepared. Not sure it would be worth full price, but at coupon price it was on par with most of the neighboring buffets.

2zvTU-vag5s6uz-QoU9Bfw.text: If you manage to get through the endless line to get into the place, then the other endless line to pay for the buffet, then you are good to go.   They have about 8 different stations of food, each one with a different nationality. Their middle eastern station was delicious. Their tandoori chicken and lamb sliders were mouthwatering! Cooked just right, not too spicy and with the right sides it makes for a great plate.   I tried some Italian dishes like the spaghetti and meatballs but those weren't anything out of this world. The American section really was my least favorite. I tried a slice of the oven baked turkey and it was like chewing on sandpaper. No taste whatsoever and don't even get me started on the fried chicken. I've had better at Publix!   All in all, it's a good buffet. I recommend the dinner time buffet over the breakfast one but get ready to stand for a good hour before you actually put anything into your mouth.

sYMhDmd82twr25QATBk4Aw.text: I'm sad because I've eaten at Spice Market before, about a year ago, and remember liking it just fine.  This time around either the quality was lower or my taste has gotten better. Either way, the champagne brunch was really not worth the price. Crab legs? None. Oysters? Nada. Champagne? Creme brulee? Nowhere to be found.  Still, the food was worthy of 3 stars. I knocked one star off for service. When we were being seated, the host was a little condescending toward my Uncle for no apparent reason. Once we were seated, our waitress never once checked to see if our glasses needed to be refilled. We literally had to hunt her down for refills the entire meal, and when we did get her attention it was easily a 10-15 minute wait for refills. Often instead of helping her tables she was chatting with her co-workers.   Our plates were also not cleared very often.  FINAL VERDICT: edible, inattentive service, but really not worth the money

y6XPud53OjmsGgQXQk5RFA.text: As of today, this is my favorite Vegas buffet.  We got the deal from Groupon; it was 50% off and since we were staying at Planet Hollywood it was worth the purchase.    I had the shrimp tempura, sliders, chorizo beans, carne asada, glazed chicken wings. All of these were delicious.  I know steamed rice is a simple item, but this is the best steamed rice I have ever had.  They are individually packed in a small Chinese to go box. Smells great and tastes great too.  Their chicken & biscuit in a basket looked cute, but the biscuit was hard and dry. The chicken was juicy, tender and fresh.   For dessert I had the apple crepe, which is made to order.  The crepe itself is pre-made, but the chef put butter in the pan and warmed up the crepe and put apples in it.  The whipped cream was delicious too.  I also had the Baklava, which was excellent.

60DSb0zTbDgAWe1zkNjF3Q.text: I would call myself a buffet buff as I've probably been to 85% of the big buffets in Las Vegas. I find that this buffet has a nice vegan selection. I love their Mid-Eastern  dishes as they resemble authentic cuisine. The service is so-so as I don't see a big difference compared to other buffets. Overall, I would consider in my top 5 list.

OEmXvYHxTZg09G-ihtqEbg.text: Beyond disappointed with this buffet. As previous reviewers mentioned at 11am most of the food it dry and flavorless. In addition to getting terrible service, their food also made me sick for a few days. I'm really not sure what people are thinking when they give this place anything more than 2 stars. Do yourself a favor and consider other buffets in the area.

OVQrQFKuQBvHOOV4ElemjA.text: This place used to be much better.  This is my third time.  Many of the items did not impress me.  Sushi selection is dismal, one item?  Come on!  They need to take down the sign claiming to be the #1 buffet in Vegas!  They are not even close!  I did enjoy the prime rib and potatoes.  The crab legs were average.  The Middle eastern food was good as well.  I enjoyed the Humus, tabouleh, lamb.  The chicken was a bit dry so get some sauce for it.  Soup selection was poor.  We tried a number of desserts and most were OK.  I liked the souffle.  I doubt I will return.    Too many better places in Vegas for a buffet!  I'd be willing to pay more for a better experience.

jKOOTr3hHpKDW0gps6_cDA.text: Likes: I like the way the buffet is organized into different types and ethnicities of food.  Alaska king crab legs are a plus.  Dislikes:

AtJmLv-oocN8HOGjtihmug.text: This buffet is really good.  Usually has a crazy long line that goes almost to the miracle mile shops.  I went here during the week at weird times so there wasnt really anyone else there.  Parking for this buffet is kind far.  You have to park all the way at one end of the miracle mile of shops. So its a bit of a walk.  Food is really good.  I ate more hummas there then i had ever eaten before in my life.   Overall a good buffet but i think there are better on the strip.  Like the paris.

FncfTkjpqyWaBd5G22sRpg.text: We're there on Sunday.  The food and service were horrible. Especially the hostesses were so rude.  To me they should not be in service at all. Flatware, dishes, and utensils are all dirty. They served wine in dirty glasses with lipstick  On them. And when they were asked to bring a replacement glasses, they really gave us the attitude. I'd not come back to this place anymore, and  Would not recommend anyone to come unless You want to get the same service that I got!

AhCqMqqb4voW5RsSWz2r3w.text: For the price, I thought this buffet was just okay. Price for dinner was about $30. Yes, they have crab legs. Pardon me if I don't get all a-twitter over that. Lots of buffets have crab legs. I actually think the best dish I had was the salmon with a soy glaze. That was actually quite delicious.   Despite the fact that it's a buffet, I still like to get some salad with my meats, and I thought the salad fixings here were minimal. (Most were prepared salads, not raw salad fixings.) Kind of disappointing.   Chinese food selection was shady looking, so I didn't go there. Mediterranean section was very nice, although I think the baba ganoush was a bit off.   Prime rib was ok (much better at the Golden Nugget, if you can believe that) and the dessert section was also just okay. The yams were fabulous!  If you're going to do buffets while in Vegas, maybe get the "buffet of buffets" pass (around $45, I think) which gives you 24 hours of buffet eating at any of the Harrah's properties. If you hit 2 buffets in 24hours, it takes the sting out of the prices. If you aren't going to hit 2 buffets in that 24 hours, don't do it. (Also, now that there's no buffet at Bally's you may see more traffic at Spice Market and Paris .. so be prepared for lines at peak dining times.)

g_nzshRLUkQtt00DqX2kRA.text: Stop six of seven on our buffet of buffets journey. So far this is my fave. Great selection. Highlights were the lamb and baklava.   I wasn't really looking forward to another buffet after grazing all day, but this made me want to actually eat again

H7KwbMrBxINPbR7C-cKTkw.text: Terrible sevice waited 10 minutes for a place setting and mgr and had to ask mgr to get coffee and clear table food didnt taste fresh. From now on i will stay w Mirage and Caesars but the Casino has some nice views

SYH1o-eCn2dnXc6FTdyOTA.text: The BEST buffet I have ever been to!!!! The choice of food is great anytime you come- breakfast, lunch or dinner, the food was just amazing! Its a must-to-go place if you in Vegas!!! strongly recommend!

juHWKUgt9D2cxxZOlp5fAQ.text: My hubby and I tried the 24 hour buffet pass last time we were in Vegas. It made sense for the prices on the strip. The selection was great. I'm a seafood lover so I pretty much pass everything else up. I loved the cocktail shrimp, the steamed crab legs, and the prime rib. My husband seemed to enjoy it too. The 24 hour AYCE pass was a great value. Probably not the best thing for our diet but that's what the gym is for!

0uePc35n1tl9C0tDf47gVw.text: $119 for three of us to eat. Food not fresh. Quality has realy dropped over recent years

agawD3H4o9ijHPer-jl5bQ.text: Good options for vegetarians and meat-eaters alike. Champagne is great too-- just wish they had more fresh fruit. Make sure you get the %50 off Groupon though, regular fare can get very pricey

dciXHi0GjBiYKKK_HIAUhQ.text: The buffet has a beautiful selection.  It is visually impressive.  The food was just OK.  We ate about half of what we put on our plate and then went back to try other things.  There were a few nice meat selections, side dishes, and shrimp that the whole family liked.  The desserts were great.  The endless alcohol option had nasty watery wine.  If you choose that option go with bottled beer, then it is a good deal.  $33.99 for age 11 and up and $19.99 for age 10 and under seemed a bit steep especially with all of the trial and error we went through to find tasty food.  The service with clearing plates and replenishing beverages was just OK.  Don't tip when you check in, wait to see if your server is attentive and tip at the end.  The kids enjoyed experience.  I think my husband and I would have rather been at a steakhouse spending $33.99 on a steak and getting a nice bottle of wine.

e2gA1vFuGMC9gOJFNtanzQ.text: NO wait to get in.  Seated at a table as requested.  Wandered to check the food, a lot to look at.  Tried a variety of foods from a variety of cultures all made in a kitchen in a Las Vegas Hotel. Nothing transported me to the culture represented and the best I could say is, very uninspired.  I do not remember any contact with a waitperson so who knows. But our plated were cleared when we came back to the table so they must be there doing their jobs.

9tDjf-PjYMKAQ6jtSR5e6g.text: I love this buffet. It's one of my favorites on the strip. They really do have a little bit of everything there. Their crab legs come pre-cracked too!   They got me a chair & a glass of water while my BF stood in line since I'm 34 weeks pregnant. They kept making sure I was okay which I thought was incredibly sweet.   Would've gotten 5 stars if they didn't ask us to leave, stating we were the last people there.

bMpq4iaOBvPVvxRnefRkmA.text: Grab a seat, order your drink, and go straight for a plate of crab and a plate of peeled shrimp, cocktail sauce, lemon and butter. Sit, eat. Order a refill for your drink. Next, go to the chinese section fill up half a plate and go to the Middle Eastern section hook yourself up with the tandoori chicken and curry chicken. Find your table again, eat. Next order is your hot drink of choice (coffee or tea) grab the cheesecake and a apple cherry chocolate crepe. Enjoy your dessert. And before you leave grab a couple of cotton candy! Then leave..thats all thats worth it at this buffet. Rewind, 1. crab 2. shrimp 3. chinese food 4. tandoori chicken, curry chicken 5. cheesecake, crepe, cotton candy 6. 2 fingers up like a buffet pimp!!!

JP1dJ394x59Fle6O85daEA.text: Great Prime Rib and crab legs - everything else average.  Ask your server for hot crab legs if you want them.  She brought out a huge platter and they were piping hot! We had a Groupon for 2 dinner buffets and unlimited drinks.  I would suggest not buying the unlimited drink option separately as you probably will get too full to make it worthwhile.  Wait in line was 30 min. on a Thursday eve at 8 pm.

V5kuCIFUaQNxPZ6eoDETrA.text: I'd have to say this buffet is 2 nd to carnival world but they are both great can't go wrong breakfast is good to nice variety here .

F0tJS5UcINNh3jZ71OV_mA.text: Overall the food was decent. One thing that gives this place an extra star is their alaskan king crab legs. It was quite an unexpected find, and I was pleasantly surprised. As for the rest of the food, it's your typical buffet food, the only difference is that The Spice Market Buffet shortens separates their food by geographical location. Another plus for Spice Market is that the line is alot shorter and moves faster than most other buffets in my experience.

e3Cwm-kGhYcvmlq0Qp997A.text: This place is very good. Better than most of the rest of the buffets on the strip. the price is good about $20 a person for dinner. I am very picky. The quality of the food is on top of my list with service coming next. Both of my requirements were met to really lik ethis place. I have been to most of the buffets and this one is one of the top 3.

8AQQ_iBLNOzF_sgsYAOv4g.text: It pains me to say this...but this buffet experience (December 2011) was really NOT good.   Wait: I've been to Spice Market a half dozen times over the last decade and this meal was a far cry from the flavorful buffet I remembered from past visits. The wait was long, which I expected, but we were briskly instructed to move along in the downstairs maze by a cashier, which I found to be unnecessary (felt a little like cattle!). Once I paid for two dinner buffets ($67 for two adults...dang), we waited another 10 minutes before being directed to our table.   Service: We loaded up on our first plates...no utensils initially required since we went for Mexican fare. Good thing, since no server came by. I had to ask one of the employees directing people to their seats for our silverware. Halfway through our second plate we finally managed to wave our server down to get drinks. Which were never refilled.   Food: I used to love the Spice Market for its good quality and variety (which one should expect for the price). Mediocre at best, truly. Lots of lukewarm, borderline bland dishes. The Middle Eastern station was best, with decent dolmas and Moroccan vegetable dish. Dessert were also fine, but Italian, Seafood, and Mexican were pretty crummy. Big bummer, since I'd been awaiting a gigantic, amazing feast after a 10 day climbing trip - AND it was nearly the equivalent of my entire food purchases over the previous week of adventures.   Will DEFINITELY avoid this buffet on future trips.

8FQjdon7o0fvoUNxSLrUFQ.text: Terrible customer service. We had a prepaid groupon to eat here today, on the groupon website and in the fine print it says it is valid today but not valid on holidays. The website specifically says it's valid today the 26th. The manager wearing the name tag "Princess" said we had to pay an extra fee of $10 per person to use the groupon. We even called last week to make sure it would be valid and the restaurant staff told us it would be. We showed the manager the website but she would not budge and insisted we had to pay $10 more per person and deal with groupon to resolve the issue.  The manager told us nobody there would have told us it would be valid today, she said we were lying. The party next to us in line was also told to come back today to use their groupon and the manager Princess said they were lying as well and nobody would've told them it was valid today. I don't like being extorted and will never eat, spend money, or stay at planet Hollywood again.

q7X6t9MOSC1LLGNACH9uCQ.text: Get the brunch and get there early. The wait is ridiculous! The food is ok to very good, definitely not the best buffet in Vegas. But it's all worth it for the non-stop, free mimosas if you have a hangover that you want to drink away. I left with a full stomach and a great buzz. That's always a nice way to start your morning in Vegas.

Nry5GchLxIpys_99C_MkwQ.text: The food at this place was great  lots of different things to choose from and everything was fresh and up to par. The citrus marinated chicken was well seasoned, the black pepper peel-and eat shrimp was exquisite. But my fav and my hubby's as well was the ceviche , talk about freshness. We actually went there twice that day since we had the 24-hr pass buffet.The champagne kept on coming at brunch and of course free of charge, the waitress did not even give us time to ask her for anything she was always around. The service was impeccable. A lot of food to choose from. Can't wait to visit again.

Nn1U0-FivlBUNQ4IiiR8rg.text: Pretty good buffet. The only thing that really stood out to me was the cotton candy. I've never seen a buffet with cotton candy! How cute! Other than the cotton candy, nothing was really memorable, but I do remember leaving pretty full and satisfied. I wouldn't mind coming here again, but there are much better buffets out there.

63dFE0rK92EN1XXhnOsH3g.text: This buffet needs a make-over and the personnel needs to be more responsive to the diners. The snow crab was okay, it smelled a little fishy, but no amonia taste, and the paella was really chewy. Most upsetting was the price. I also purchased a all you drink ticket, and after the first serving of drinks the wait-staff avoided us like the plague. Fruits and desserts were very disappointing. This buffet really needs a make-over and staffed with personell who care about the diners experience. My wife Caroline and I also had dinner at Caesars Baccanal and  breakfast at Paris Le Buffet and then dinner. These two rated far above Spice Market with Caesar's Baccanal getting top honors.

XV_xIya-PK09rAMgJFgseQ.text: It was alright.  I know it's not bellagio buffet but I expected better customer service.  The food was average.  You get what you pay for.  But the service.. well.. not that great.  We had to keep hunting our waiter down to get drinks and refills.  Don't think I'll come back any time soon.

uGIMhgLoQJLyNfNvHIkh2g.text: So far I've only tried Harrah's & here & PH....spice market is gross.  Food selection is poor, and the quality is even worse.  Avoid this place!

VY1mMeIRRdzlV0laq15egg.text: Banned!  No longer will I eat at this buffet. They used to be my favorite with large alaskan king crab legs.  Now it's just a little bigger than snow crab legs.  Epic fail!  The quality and selection of food had really gone down the drain.  I've eaten here since the first year aladdin was built. Way back in early 2000.  It's a shame.  For 27.99 I could have spent a few dollars more and have gone to Wynn.  It's really generic buffet food.  It really reminds me of Rio's buffet.  Must have something to do with the harrahs taking over planet Hollywood.  Bye bye spice market.  After 10 years I feel like you have let me down.

e_nAKWEBa8V5I-Rf-Q6xNQ.text: I thought this buffet was really good. I just didn't like the LONG line to get in.

7m2ZduLsJcURqmupRQ5tkg.text: buffets are buffets .. and lines are lines ... wheeeew hooow .. this was a line.  Get in line before you think you gonna be hungry

84vGXailiSTfTs_E_OT2OQ.text: Eating at this diverse brunch buffet on Sunday around 12:30pm could not have been a better experience!  We waited in line less than 5 minutes, was immediately seated after payment was received, and a server was there to take drink orders right away.  The variety of food was excellent and they had some of the best steak cuts, pork, and lamb that I have ever had.  Not a single part of the buffet was low on any given item.  The server was very friendly and very quick to remove empty plates and refill drinks.

IWfjoccQEGFFPjlqx9loLQ.text: long wait, decent service - food is great!

vcK_N3mlQwEj6RUWc02upw.text: Buffets do not have a reputation for being the highest quality food.  It's a given.  While the buffet at Planet Hollywood has a wide variety (including a Mediterranean station) it lacks any semblance of quality and has scant offerings for vegetarians or pescetarians (people who eat fish and veggies).  So, here's why it gets one star: The sushi rice was undercooked and firm.  The sushi had a rubbery texture. The shrimp tempura was crispy, yet cold. The crab legs on the self service bar were cold and could either be blanched in hot water, or taken to eat chilled at the table.  Chilled should not mean the crab legs are frozen in the center. The Asian station had absolutely no vegetarian offerings, other than the steamed (and undercooked) rice. The soups were only mediocre. The vegetables on skewers in the Mediterranean station sit on a cutting board that is shared with meat.  And the baklava was stale.  It also lacked sweetness or filling other than the phyllo dough. The Mexican station allowed you to make your own taco.  The had rice.  Can you guess...undercooked.  Thankfully, we got this meal as a comp.  I wouldn't pay the hefty price tag for dinner.  I would rather go to a sit down restaurant and get quality over quantity for my dining bang.  Now...ask me about the Wynn buffet!

OQeKiVf-SQ-N2ljF_1cVKA.text: I was told this is one of the best buffets on the strip.  Think again.  They have a good variety of food, but very poor quaility.  I had high expectations Planet Hollywood!

kJAlx9wy3MLfBe0iOvcA-w.text: Terrible. I would not recommend at all. Food was cold, bland, over or undercooked...except the salad. Ironic, considering it's the "spice market buffet". Service was okay, pleasant.

kxf4fkvOqM09RhRRmOsJGA.text: Ok so here we have a bit of a surprise. A good and reasonably priced buffet on the strip. They have a very good selection, and the service is wonderful. The tempura shrimp were a favorite. Everything was fresh and well maintained. So stop in and get your fill. Live It Up You Are In Las Vegas For Cryin' Out Loud!

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JVTF9Fxa6vZxIHll0R3Hsg.text: The buffet quality here seems to have gone down over the years, especially when compared to some of the other buffets in town.   The selection is not as large as I hope it to be.   The server was nice and quick ay clearing out plates out.

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fGgSCCihKcmzGkRvv2QtHg.text: This was the 1st stop we made with the Caesars 24 hour buffet pass. DO NOT waste you time. The selection was unimpressive and the worse. I would complain about the service...but we received none. Not one plate cleared, not one how are you doing.  They were not busy, so that can not be used as a reason.  We choose here because the  variety of choices sounded like it would be different, with the possibility of food we had not tried before. We were sadly mistaken. Mexican...same old same old, lacklusted salad options, dried up cheeses.  Chinese,  teriyaki chicken, rice and spring rolls, some dried up pasta and fish dish. Seriously, the only thing worth looking at were a few of the dessert options. Save your time and skip this. The Paris buffet is a much better choice, and surprisingly so was the Flamingo, which had fresh delicious food options in a bright and clean dining room.

2PwdgEHX-EERbbAN6UQEWA.text: I came here because I had a good deal on it. Certainly far from the best buffet option on the strip. The environment is a little dark and closed off, and the buffet is just poorly laid out, it could force you to miss things or have to make an extra long trip back and forth to survey the entire line.   None of the food was remarkably poor or great, but certainly not anything I would pay full price for.

UhPXIFpHcq3JEtobe8nBzg.text: WELL.... i really wouldn't recommend this buffet. Mainly because i always like to get for what i pay for and for $35 it for sure wasn't worth it.   There really isn't much to choose from, just your basics and even then the basics weren't really good.  They had the Mexican spot the rice wasn't good  The sushi was bad as well  The only thing i liked was the desserts!

UBcWabeABDtP4MmdBE4QpA.text: Wow, that was bad even for a buffet.  I play poker and you get free entry if you play 3 hours of poker before 2 pm, so that's why I ate here despite the bad reviews.  Overall, here are some common themes: food wasn't warm/the right temperature, skimping on the more expensive ingredients, poor quality and labeling the dishes and sections wrong (ie the Asian food was labeled mid-eastern; the pancakes were labeled Mexican rice). Also, there isn't a big selection at all.  The tandoori chicken was undercooked and tough. The naan bread wasn't warm or doughy. The cheese quesadillas weren't warm and hardly had any cheese. The fried rice was dry and had some hard-ish grains of rice. The steak was tough and not flavorful.  The Mac n cheese was the worst Mac n cheese I've ever had. I don't know how they screwed up Mac m cheese but there were hard and dried out grated bits of cheese on top, the pasta didn't feel cooked enough, and the cheese was more like soup.  The deserts were actually all pretty good. I had a solid muffin, tasty fruit cobbler (although it's too rich and I was only able to have a few bites), and the vanilla custard was good enough that I wanted to go back and get some more.  But overall, this has to get one star. I kinda want to give them two stars, because it's only fair to lower your standards for buffet food, but this place... they went the opposite of above and beyond. It was notably bad, even for buffet food.  For what it's worth, here are some thoughts on buffet food in Vegas. I've notice that you really do get what you pay for. I've found that places $30 and above are usually pretty good, and under are usually pretty bad. If you want cheaper buffet food, head off The Strip if you can. It's usually almost half the price, and slightly better quality than the cheaper buffers on The Strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Last plate: ice cream
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fifth plate: fruit cobbler and muffin
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fourth plate: steak with bbq sauce, mac n cheese, pastey

3IkdQ9vioZ11TMeeXdrOXA.text: Sorry you USED to be my favorite spice market buffet. You always had our favorite seafood, crab legs and stuffed sole. Well you remodeled  and out went the seafood.  We walked in looked at the buffet and left. Not the quality it used to be.

pNWDdS0SkBTYG92KO831sw.text: Sad buffet in Vegas. No seafood selection, limited salad options and dry meat. The grilled zucchini was good, nice texture and seasoning.

FtPfB33-p-DkXGgt4ACJcA.text: This was our third stop with the buffet pass. The service kept going downhill after starting out at Caesars and then Paris.  Drinks were self served. Plates were only cleared a couple times. Our server was acting like a bus boy than a server. He was seen chatting with his coworkers instead of cleaning tables. We were surrounded by dirty tables as we showed up at 9pm.  The highlight here was the Mediterranean station. The lamb kebab and hummus were very good. Otherwise, the rest of the stations were underwhelming. There was very limited seafood during the weekday dinner (ie clams, mussels, cold shrimp and some fish). The dessert selection was better than Paris' selection.  I still do not know why we tipped our server when other tables did not. I would not want to pay full price for this buffet because of the lack of service for buffet quality.

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YnjrN4vnpDmpjVxMn2RCSw.text: There wasn't the greatest selection. The scrambled eggs were salty. It seemed they were switching over to lunch around 10am. What is this, McDonalds? It was fairly priced, but I hoped for much more.

Po2PSz1ICGE5EawaX0zY_g.text: A disappointing option for breakfast at the Planet Hollywood hotel, the Spice Market Buffet is situated in the lower level of the hotel, accessed through an escalator on the casino level. The name definitely sounds more appetizing than the breakfast options there! I went in there with my family as a group of 8 on a Saturday at 8am. I wasn't sure we were lucky with no wait time because from arriving early... or because the buffet just doesn't attract enough customers!  There is basically no diversity in culture or types beyond the typical American diner options: sausage, scrambled eggs, and bacon. I felt like this place was a typical buffet made with a Denny's menu. Hash brown was a bit mushy, and the benedict was quite dry. A fifth of the food options are just various forms of bread, muffins, and more carbs! Pancakes and white porridge were nothing more than the ordinary. Everything felt pre-made because of the saran wrap covering most of the buffet items, giving an atmosphere that most items were heated from the oven without a thought on freshness.  Looking at the old Hollywood movie posters that dot the wall is quite frankly more exhilarating than eating breakfast here! For similar prices for one entree, definitely walk over to Cafe Hollywood not only for better breakfast, but also for better appreciation of the Hollywood culture thru throwback pictures! Grab your winnings and dine somewhere else for breakfast to kickstart your day.  Food: 2/5 Service: 3/5 Ambiance: 3/5 Environment: 2.5/5

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage and other breakfast meat.
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside seating with old movie posters lining the wall!
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancakes and biscuits.

p1kAL05Z209PlI4dgm-SPQ.text: Over all good value to money compared to other buffets. It doesn't have seafood but that's what makes it competitive with price. Still have variety of a lot of things. I loved grabbing the mussels! The only taste of seafood and they were beautiful! Awesome price!

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jDnLQ6TwHSO6VGWy9mvZTg.text: This buffet was once much better. It seems smaller and a lot fewer selections- I feel like a section has been walled off but I'm not sure. The salad "bar" lacked toppings. I wanted to build my own salad. There was romaine lettuce and nothing to put on it. There were tomatoes but they were part of a tomato salad and it had vinegar or some other topping. The chicken fajita was very salty. No Pizza, no sushi, no hamburgers. I've seen better buffets at Golden Corral and Home Town Buffet.   I wish we would have eaten at the Hollywood Cafe or Koi like the last two nights. It was so disappointing because we said we would only have a buffet once during our 4 day trip to Vegas. To say we were disappointed on this last dinner while in Vegas is an understatement.

WPxH0ozK44RUIjWedkk86g.text: To say I was disappointed would be an understatement.  For years, this buffet was the BEST on the strip - which is why we chose it again yesterday.  My husband and I were surprising my sister who was in Las Vegas for her birthday - and we drove in from Phoenix.  We were absolutely confident that it would be a great place us to have lunch.  Under the seafood section, there was no seafood, only two different types of pizza, a pile of ice cream cones and some sprinkles.  What the what?  It didn't seem like there was much to choose from, quite frankly.   The "brunch" had eggs that were not looking very fresh.  The Asian section had little that seemed appealing, the Mexican station had unseasoned chicken for fajitas.  Chips, but no melted cheese, only shredded.   I will say that the grape leaves were pretty good in the Mediterranean section, as was the babaganoosh.    Basically, I felt like I had just visited a Vegas version of Old Country Buffet.  Step it up, PH, you're better than this.

-2EZU3_Tio_HuVGfNb9hbw.text: Food so bad, it literally made me feel ashamed to be an American.   Sounds absurd right? No. Reality. I'm a local. I've been to almost all the buffets. In the past, there was a low end (Stations city locations), mid-range (Spice Market, Rio), and high-end (Bacchanal, etc).   There is now eating out of a dumpster, and high-end. They reduced costs of operation at Spice Market so much, that there's almost no food, and what is out there has been sitting there for many, many hours.   I hadn't been to Spice Market in about 4-5 years. It's about 1/2 the size it was then. When I visited in 2013, there were probably 10-13 different sections of food with a chef/cook at each station. When I went yesterday, there were four sections of food, and for the hour we sat there, we saw ZERO food get brought out, and ZERO cooking. I saw a glimpse of someone come out and pour more sweet and sour sauce from a .99c bottle. That is it, and no I'm not exaggerating. Full hour, no new food, no stirring of the food, nada.   Everything was overcooked. The "indian" chicken was so overcooked and dry that cutting through it was like cutting through wood. The chicken crumbled like sand. You couldn't make it through a bite in 10 minutes. Imagine your most overcooked chicken meal at home, the one you more than likely threw away, make it x3 worse, and you're getting close to how awful it was.   I had one total plate of food, combining the 3-4 items that appeared remotely edible. I did not get through half a plate. I could not physically chew it, it was literally disgusting. Fried rice? They can't fail here, I thought. Even if it's been sitting for hours, it's gotta be fine sitting in all that grease right? Nope. The FRIED RICE was hard as a rock and room temperature. Chunks of it were like biting through plastic.   Ribs? Who can mess up ribs. Even if they look like they've been sitting for six hours. Nope, I couldn't even chew through the meat of RIBS it was so dry. I didn't even think that was possible. I've put ribs in the oven for hours before and they've been passable. How long must you cook ribs, and how long must you let them sit, for them to be that dry? Drenched in thick, thick dried BBQ sauce, cutting and chewing it felt like cutting through a very well done sirloin steak. If you've ever been to **** buffets, you know that ribs are one of the things that are nearly impossible for them to screw up. Even the worst Stations buffets, which come in at something like $10 a head, can't manage to mess them up (although they try).   The pizza I didn't even try, as it looked like a Digiorno would look like after 3 days left out on the counter.   I only came here because I got a free voucher, and that's exactly what you should pay at this place. As a local, I can tell you that the PH employee dining room is ***significantly*** better food. That's where they bulk-feed their employees every day. Hell, eating out of a dumpster would be preferable in certain situations.   It appears that all of the locals and most American tourists have savvied up to this though, as there were about a dozen people in the whole place, all of which were international. I saw person after person's look of disgust and disbelief as they walked up and down the small area of food looking for something to consume. Most failed.   A table of Chinese were there and quite literally only ate cantaloupe and other fruits, and then left. Of their party of six, none found a single dish they'd even try. I don't blame them. I wanted to assure them that Americans don't eat this sewer food either.   Caesars Entertainment needs to shut down this place immediately. Not to mention, my buddy (the only one bold enough to try the 1" spring rolls) ended up on the toilet the rest of the night.   We each ate about a quarter of what was on our first plate and then left, hungry.   Embarrassing to Vegas. Embarrassing to Caesars. Embarrassing for the Strip. New name suggestion: The Sewer.   If you end up with a voucher to eat here for free, save yourself the time. Toss it. Stay the hell away. Kindly.

RU9npfJUk8KXggQKNdDPsA.text: Great Brunch eggs and omelets made to order. I was also happy with the Mimosa included per per son.

M7NF4u-EzhL-776yGaTNrw.text: Do not waste your time and money, food is horrible.  We came in for Mother's Day dinner and for the $32 and change is not worth it. The food looked like it was the left overs from the night before. The prime rib was over cooked, could not even eat it. No pizza, no spaghetti, Sea food nothing exciting, no crab legs, Mexican food, chicken fajitas were old and not freshly cooked. Very disappointed, place could do better if they invested a little more in preparing more desirable and quality food.

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green tea, not quality, cheap

p6KOeYH6poOrYA1w5NqQMQ.text: Our server was very sweet and our service was great up until a middle aged/elder black employee with short red hair approached me and my husband randomly asking to see our receipt. She seemed to be rushing us and reminded us of the 2 hour time limit when we were already heading out. Not once did she smile or greet us. She was very rude and seemed to be angry at the fact that she was bussing tables. Sorry that this is your job and your life is miserable, but don't take it out on the customers!   Other than that, my husband and I definitely got our money's worth. There is definitely better buffets out there than this one but this one was still pretty good and I walked out full and satisfied. I really enjoyed their mimosas and their variety of desserts as well as their Mexican food selection! They just need to work on their service, or maybe just get rid of that one employee with a terrible attitude.

G61qM6HYkVDChXNHug8GUw.text: They have a pretty decent selection but seems to be middle of the road. I would have liked to see some things that were on the edge of the menu. Taco bar that had the same toppings as the salad bar... really?   The prime rib was super tasty. Enough I went back for more.  I liked that I could get my own drinks.  Service was a bit slow and seating was challenging for a large party.

OSgKqbEGfbA1B74vP5crlQ.text: We liked the variety of food here. Food was delicious. Staff was friendly. We will definitely come back!

24MdUyyYI9xkeB_pzPI4EA.text: Wow this used to be one of the best buffets on the strip now it's bad enough to be a Boyd Buffet! The casino is half the size that it used to be and there's not even enough food to actually make a proper meal.  The food quality has gone so downhill the place is filthy and disgusting I would never go back there you're better off going across the street to the Mirage! The sad part is Caesar's doesn't care and they will do nothing about it avoid avoid avoid shame on them for ripping people off $25 this thing shouldn't even be 10 dollars!

6hTpm-oZ7jvuM5gwJO1wpQ.text: We went to the spice Market Buffet at Planet Hollywood and it was great! They were transitioning to brunch when we arrived and all the food was fresh and hot. My only complaint is that the servers do not get your drinks or refills. Everything is self serve, the dining area was a little small but the food was good.

jN-YhvYj1kMW77KPHZoTTA.text: The food wasn't the greatest, some even seemed dry from sitting out. They also didn't do a great job at refilling, several times I got up and they still were out of some of the food I wanted to try. Definitely not going back.

7HTeKoaZHZp_jOo-QOh0_g.text: EXECELLENT SERVICE!!!  My visit to this buffet was just wonderful. I cannot put it in words of how great our service was. For just two people, we chose to purchase the all-you-can-drink special for 12.99. Our server, Elizabeth, as she wore her proud name tag with the "employee of the month", she totally lived up to that label. Her service was impeccable. She made sure our drinks were filled. Even to the point where our drinks were still half down, she came over and checked on us. So when you do go to the Spice Market Buffet, ask for Elizabeth!!

bdb0wUYA6Q24xd_FVYen_A.text: I have been to this buffet several times in the passed, and remembered it one of the better ones. The food was terrible, maybe because it's it was a weekday. Service suck too, they only come by to pick up your plate. Last time, I come here.

LRZtiY6x3W2b_QMnK5Rj8w.text: Aman was an outstanding waiter. He treated us professionally and gave us drinks right when we needed. I spilled my water and he immediately cleaned it up! Fantastic!!

6_r7MxX759wR_UuFzDyvrQ.text: Came here twice and both times the quality of food was just edible.  The steaks and meats were dry. The salad bar was only 2 items, theres not much to compliment here except the wait staff was friendly.  Not really worth the cost. Probably wouldn't eat there again.

TfG09yCDq0jEGJe0rDvuDw.text: I wanted to enjoy this buffet but it was just so-so. I travel to Vegas for work a lot and really just was looking for a quick meal with some options. Sadly I quickly regretted my decision.  The salad bar was significantly lacking in terms of toppings and did not look completely fresh.  The rice in both the Mexican and Mediterranean locations were either over cooked or left under the heat so long it was hard.   The good: Chicken Curry BBQ Ribs Prime Rib Quesadillas Crab Meat/Cheese   The not-so-good: Pasta dishes Rice dishes Kabobs  - overcooked meat Salad bar Soups - flavor not all there Pizza - dried out and tasted like frozen kind you get at store Shrimp - not De-vained   For over $30 a person at dinner time I don't feel it was worth it. After paying we waited to be seated for over 20 minutes which was unfortunate. Staff was attentive but don't think I would come back here. Best to spend money elsewhere.

9UC-iCjl0ZOhDa0USZqYfQ.text: This is a very straight forward and hassle free buffet, perfect when on a time crunch.  The wait time is relatively short for a Las Vegas strip buffet.  Even though this buffet may not have the most unique or jaw dropping beautiful decor and ambiance it does the basics well.  The food is well rounded and diverse with good taste.  I especially love the dessert sections due to their simplicity and not too overly sweet desserts.  Another bonus is the self serve drink bar that gives countless options.  You gotta check out this buffet for a simplistic yet enjoyable dinning experience.

vQ16a1kfEIHR3zxVv3t4Xw.text: Spice Market used to be one of my favorite buffets on the strip. However, with the down sizing of the buffet, it is less than stellar. I understand the issues they had made them lose some area of the buffet. However, they have totaled reduced what they have on the buffet. In a town full of buffets there are so many more options. As a diamond total rewards member, I have to say I'm totally disappointed. My wife and I went and the food was lackluster and lacked variety. They also cut out some of the best things such as crab legs and prime rib. I often stay at Planet Hollywood, but I won't be back to eat at Spice Market.

K-VQESzYPaaqUzegH4x-Cg.text: We went here for lunch Buffett and it sure was not worth the $52 we paid for both of us. The seafood is missing the main ingredient like Fish. What kind of a seafood do they advertise? The Mexican food didn't even have tacos and their mid-eastern food quality was very low.   Overall even two star was in their favor.

0x8uZhKjEeh_nRv1dis45A.text: I used to love this buffet.It was one of my favorites every time I come to vegas. I brought family yesterday on the 4th of July. I also brought a couple of friends with high expectations. It was a big disappointment. They downgraded and removed a large section of it that included at least 4 main areas like the Asian food,Italian food, the fruit bar and the large Seafood section. Even the Crepes are only skinny chocolate ones with no more fruits. They basically removed the best part of it. Unfortunately I will no longer come to this place.

IobpRFOxn0AoYp68sZQVUg.text: Came here with a travelzoo deal. The lady at the cashier was very rude, but our server was great.  The food selection was great but average quality. My favorite thing about the buffet was the incredible dessert selection from cookies to cobblers to crepes to tarts to frozen custard.  Shrimp cocktail: shelled which was super annoying Crab legs: small but good. If you're a seven stars, diamond, or platinum member, they'll heat up the crab legs for you if you ask Sushi: not super fresh  Lamb kabob: tender and flavorful Chicken curry: good and tasty Prime rib: very tender and flavorful BBQ ribs: really chewy and tough Tomato bisque soup: tasty Dessert highlight: flan, creme brulee, cookies, frozen custard were very good!  Good value with the travel zoo deal but I don't think I'd come back without a deal.

AVcXh77_mvUur7atKJI5Mw.text: Horrible service...after you pay they make you wait along time without letting you know what the wait time is...also while your waiting they will let others that are considered V.I.P go before you..again nobody took the time to let us know how long the wait would be or how to upgrade to v.i.p. status...

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The food is bland and cold.

Jj6DCkhqpcBgPiLjI85klA.text: This used to be our favorite buffet but unfortunately it is no longer what it used to be. It is way smaller, as they blocked off a huge portion. The food was good but nothing like I remember it from last year. Our server was super friendly. The meat slicer was not friendly. The cannoli cupcakes were delicious!!!  The wristband for the 24hr pass was put on way too tight on my daughter's wrist so we returned shortly after and the manager was nice and said to cut it off and staple it to our receipt and that should work. If it doesn't, I'll come back on here and update my post.

9_lA5hl2mPYgrvs732tiiA.text: Don't even know where to begin... the food doesn't even taste good. Seemed like the food was old and bland. Only reason we came here was because we stayed at Planet Hollywood and we figured we'd give this buffet a try since it was right there. They didn't have much options, but at least they had fruit and salad. That's probably the only decent thing in there to eat, can't go wrong with fruit and salad right? Anywho, at least the employees were really nice and made sure to check on us for refills and taking our finished plates. But don't come here if you expect good food.

ec2UCJU0ga-FHNY69WmmbA.text: Went there out first night in Vegas and it was meh. Everything average. The only thing I really enjoyed was their tri tip and a fried rice they had in the Mediterranean section. The cedar salad had old brown lettuce in it but the cocktail shrimp was fresh. Dont expect anything fancy. Just good enough to pass. I dont think it was worth the price but then again everything in the hotels is overpriced. I  will say though that the service was great. Our server was on top of everything.

7dNx8dP051XGIB4NDRtqww.text: What a waste of money and time.  Charged extra because it was a holiday weekend, but there was nothing extra or great at all.  Food selection was terrible.  Food tasted horrible.  Cashiers up front were not the friendliest, and the service was not good.  Definitely will NOT be coming back to this buffet ever again.  There are a ton of better options out there for buffets.
