The OJ is not the bomb there, neither is the coffee. Food is fine, dessert is amazing! They have a cotton candy machine! it was unique and new to my buffet dining experience. I appreciated the addition.

5bctjVkWIVZAS03Jtsp-Fg.text: Really wanted to like this buffet but it was "just OK" nothing special. Usual crappy buffet staples. A few standouts, I mean VERY few: tempura shrimp, bao buns & baklava were pretty good, these were the reason for 1 star, pretty pathetic! Especially since we paid $35 a person on a saturday night, wait time wasnt too bad.

MJtNjDvvTeeRsiNx2cm5Pg.text: Great place, great food. The Champagne & wines just kept coming out. Service was excellent. The lady serving us was wonderful & kept on asking us if everything was ok. Love this place & will visit again soon. The Travelzoo.com Discount did help. Thank You.

yAjQOtIbW_rJypZ-BTd69A.text: Hot crab legs 5 stars Prime rib 4 stars - they'll throw on grill upon request  if too bloody Strawberry shortcake cupcake 5 stars Nice variety of foods, could have more premium meats and seafood but still good enough to get beyond full.

N25lW0x6vNamsAsINZK4lA.text: Line is very long, but is it worth it? No, because it took away an hour of my time waiting in line, and the return value was nothing because the food was meh.  In my humble opinion, this place is only popular because of the hotel and not for the food.  To reiterate, the food was either bland or salty. Thankfully, we had the Buffet of Buffets deal for $45.99 (after the $5 discount for being a total rewards member) and we got to eat at 6 different buffets within 24 hours. So for the price of it being Buffet of Buffets, it was only okay. If I had to pay for the original dinner price, I would be quite upset right now. Do not pay full price would be my best advice. It simply isn't worth the price!  About the food, only 3 things really made my trip a little better: -the fruits (lame right?) -the middle eastern food section as many have mentioned was good -the cotton candy (wow! this was the only buffet I know that offered cotton candy!)  Other than that, nothing else stood out. You're better off saving your money and spending a little more on more noteworthy buffets---like the Wynn and/or Belagio.

H3sLCfZ0RbHBNo4eZRBoSw.text: Probably one of the only other buffets in Vegas I'm willing to eat at, other than Wynn's. Don't be fooled by my 4-star rating; the food isn't amazing -- but it gets the job done without breaking the bank. I've been here twice for breakfast and lunch, and everything tasted decently yummy.  My favorites from here are probably the French toast with real strawberries and syrup, most of the chicken dishes, and the soft serve ice cream (one of the best soft serves I've ever had). They also have a great dessert selection, including deliciously soft and chewy cookies and cotton candy. Yes, you read right, COTTON CANDY. I forget why but for some reason our buffet came with champagne and we discovered that putting cotton candy in champagne makes a fine (and sweeter) tasting bubbly.  No complaints from me!

9JfynmDrObGdEhEYa7Icfg.text: Nice variety of food from many regions around the world. Server Tadesse was very friendly and attentive and really increased the quality of our dining experience. Will be back next time I am in the area.

xWrNEvARBinkvRsLPZjN0w.text: The buffet was not bad, but nothing really spectacular. I like how all the sections are labeled in large letters "seafood", "dessert", "italian", etc. I love sweets so I tend to put a lot of weight on their quality of desserts. Here, it was a hit or miss with the items. Their ice cream custard was good, esp with chantilly cream, which was excellent quality. They make cotton candy, which was something new so that was pretty cool too. Their fruit tarts were excellent. However, their flan was too stiff on the outside and was more like jello, as was their banana cream pie. The cream was like a stiff block of jello that had been sitting outside for a few hours and allowed to dry....also, their crepes were too thick for my liking. It seemed more like a pancake.   Now their Mediterranean section was delicious, and their salad bar delicious as well. Their asian section was ok, some of it was good and some was just bland. Their pasta was excellent as well.  Seafood wise, the selection seemed ok.  I would come here again if someone suggests it, but my first choice would still be Wynn.

eLkletTTx17L7NkwftU1cw.text: No snow crab in lunch, everything is bad. No worth for the holiday price $30+ per person.

qwk0nJ0Znzjvt9Y34ibHmg.text: Went to dinner here before show. Great food with fares from middle eastern , Italian, Mexican, seafood and American. A little pricy but very nice. Good was excellent.

OrSk0XdCc88NNuOLeDdNbQ.text: The best Buffet in Las Vegas. Varieties include American, Indian, Asian,Mexican, Italian, Sea Food and a lot of dessert varieties. make sure to go there with empty stomach:) Loved it. Cost varies from $21-$31 depending on the time. Highly recommended.

ReX1jkFu904jXzh8_Qiwcg.text: It wasnt terrible. We definitely ate way too much though as would happen when eating at a buffet. The best part for me was the tandoori chicken and the pizza. The mac n cheese was bland and old tasting. The lasagna was ok. The baked potato was awful and I feel like a lot of food is wasted here. A lot of food.....  I guess I would eat a buffet again, but not this one. It was kinda pricey but they do have a 24 buffet pass available. I believe it was $50 or something....maybe more. The line was a bit annoying because if you have a party larger than 4, it takes awhile to be seated.....and people behind you with parties of 2-4 continually get seated before you, which is really lame.

04CsCdgQsbt51rnbo983fA.text: Dingier than last time I was there 5 years ago (it is in a basement after all). Wynn beats the pants off it.   The options here are plentiful, but the drink service was super slow and we were seated in an area and they were cleaning around us during our meal with a janitor cart. It kind of spoiled the mood. They had sports on TV, which as an Olympic fan, I enjoyed.  Some of the strengths here are the middle eastern booth, the desserts, and the italian booth. There was an interesting lamb stuffed tomato that I loved.   Some of the misses are the Asian buffet (looked like it had been out there all day), the seafood line (put the busiest thing in the corner where the most people jam in?) and the quality of the mexican ingredients.   Good if you get the 24 hour pass and need a place to eat all day. Otherwise, take the cab up to the Wynn or cross to Bellagio. I think you'll enjoy spending your 30-40 there more.

OMKObY-E368PU_nwpxRPYQ.text: This was the worst buffet I have had in many years, the amount of money you pay was outrageous for what they had. It was worth about  $12 not $35. Don't waste your time.

1GlRw9kSnvbxr3tnJZHDnQ.text: Sunday Dinner review:  3.5 stars, but I'll give it 4 for the heck of it. I didn't expect a whole lot from the buffet at Planet Hollywood, but maybe that is why I was pleasantly surprised. After going to the Bellagio and finding a "holiday menu" at the buffet with subsequent elevated prices for the weekend, my buddy and I decided to head across to PH and give that one a try.   The buffet itself can be a little tricky to find depending on what door you come in. It's set in the basement and seems almost forgotten about. Compared to the fancier casino floor above it, the buffet seems dark and dingy. However, it's really not that bad once you get settled in.  Prices aren't cheap, but are decent for what you get. There are plenty of little sections with different types of food, including an interested Middle Eastern section which...well, half of it seemed Greek. Maybe they think Greece is in the Middle East? Meh...  They even have hot AND cold snow crab legs, which were fairly decent (though the hot ones were a bit dry). I found them better and easier to eat than at the Paris buffet a couple days prior.   Dessert was really boring. It's basically just a big section of cupcakes. People love cupcakes, I know, but come on...can you serve anything other than cupcakes? Sure, there are a few other things hidden in the shadows, but not really. I tried two, and one was very good...but the other wasn't.   Service was good but not great. She got us our refills and cleared our plates, but didn't smile throughout the process. Oh well, I'm getting used to that at buffets in Vegas.   I'm giving it 4 stars (again, rounded up from 3.5) because it was better than expected. If I had gone in with the foolish mindset of getting something as good or similar to Wynn of Bellagio, I would give it 2 stars...but I would hit myself for being that stupid too. For what it is, this is a fine buffet.

5hjfRjf0W2B-euQE9EJWJg.text: Came here for the lunch meal of my Buffet of Buffets day.  Kind of tricky to find as you have to go downstairs from the casino to get to the buffet.    They had tons of stations organized by regions of the world: Middle Eastern, American, Italian, Mexican, Seafood and Salad.  I tried the shrimp cocktail, shrimp tempura, pesto pasta, mashed potatoes, sweet potatoes and designed my own taco.  Nothing was particularly good except the shrimp tempura and sweet potatoes.    This was the buffet with the most esthetically pleasing desserts.  They all looked amazing, so I grabbed a chocolate cream pie, creme brulee, eclair and fruit tart.  Nothing tasted good.  I then decided to get myself some chocolate custard to satisfy my sweet craving.  It was completely liquid and melted.  Disappointing since I'm big on desserts.    May be worth stopping by if the meal is comped or you're a Planet Hollywood guest that is too lazy to go anywhere else.  I wouldn't pay to go back.

8GsKzLExsaqay4qzCcmYGQ.text: It certainly wasnt bad, I normally like the world buffet at the rio, but we decided to try this.  About the same price and what I feel like was a slightly better selection.  Lots and lots of options including a seafood station even at lunch.  Everything I tried was pretty awesome.  I had one complaint that the wait atafg was very slow with refilling our drinks and clearing plates but they all were very pleasant.  The same cannot be said for the people who you pay and ring you up and our hostess almost seemed bothered that she had to seat us.  They (much like every other buffet here) put the worlds most unpleasant people there.

dMd-FR_vlJOLsTOCP8JYEQ.text: We have been going to the Rio buffet ever since the open however over the years it's quality of food and in service it's been going down hill every time we go to their buffets , we went this past weekend and bought the 24 hour pass our first disappointment was at the Rio to start the prices are 75 dollars per person but it does not include any waiter to serve your drinks it does not offer the stir fry which in my mind was probably one of their best item of food , most of the food was room temperature, the next day we went to Planet Hollywood to eat brunch to see the same disappointments to start they no longer have an omelette station no more bottomless mimosas and the same quality of food , we called the manager to our table to place our disappointment and concerns,  to one more of our disappointments she had no answer no phone number to complain to the highest personnel regarding our concerns, since we had the 24 hour we took the last dinner at the Planet Hollywood the only eat the same exact food that they served at brunch that morning the only difference is that they had only change the meat from ham to beef . Don't waste your money here it's not worth it anymore.

bg6tb1VcphFc7E8J8tovLw.text: My family came here for dinner one night because we had some comps. Usually it takes a special like this to get us into a buffet now a days. None of us can eat that much anymore. Yet, at this point, a buffet is a buffet is a buffet if it is not one of the two high end places in town. There are some items that made up the low, mid, and high points to our meal.   Low- Chinese/Asian- The variety is non-existent. Nothing noteworthy. The crepes are premade and placed back into a frying pan with butter to warm up.   Mid- Crab legs were anorexic, but at least they were split for easy access. The shrimp were pretty standard as well. Desserts are all standard.   High- The left half of the Middle East section. Dolmas, Marinaded Feta, Baba Ganoush, and the beef. The meat was seasoned well and very tender.   At one time they were voted Best Buffet by the Review Journal. Part of me scoffs, because it is the Review Journal, and a part of me agreed with them back then. When it first opened, the Middle East station was amazing and innovative. It is still a stand out option, but that is because everything else went downhill.   The line is long, but the employees work quickly to get the guest in. The price is steep at $31 for okay food.

3QCjqywVk2yAepustQ6wSw.text: What huge disappointment thankfully we used a groupon and only paid half. Everything overcooked Best part was the all u can drink. I'd say full love no thank u. Hell half isn't even worth it. If u ask me go somewhere else def not worth the wait. Plus staff horrible some old guy fell and no staff member seemed even concerned

E42UI2R-e50NTan4JwZxmA.text: Well so disappointed this use to be our favorite. But our last to visits where just so so at best the food was just poor quality. The seafood was just disappointing the fish flavorless they couldn't the crab legs up the shrimp is peel and eat now. Every thing else below average Will not spend another dollar here again

AJWcIQWb-sNNsFDmLPP6eQ.text: We ate here last June because we had 4:00pm show reservations for the Popovich Comedy Pet Theater at the V Theater (If you like animals and circus acts without the cracking of the whip, then go! But that's another review for another time). We decided to show up early (12:30) to pick up the VIP tickets and take a walk around the Miracle Mile Shops. All of a sudden, our 9 year old daughter says that she is hungry and I opted to get the family a nice treat. Besides, I had not eaten here since it was the Aladdin. As we approached the buffet, we were pleasantly surprised to find that the line for lunch was fairly reasonable for midday weekday lunch.  Much to my surprise, nothing had changed about this place except for some cosmetic touches to the dining area. The salad section had fresh bamboo shoots and whole peeled beets (score!). There were so many sections to choose from that I did not want overdo it on one section.  The seafood section was pretty good. The sushi looked OK but it s buffet sushi.  The highlight of the station is the crab meat stuffed sole and paella. Delicious and well seasoned.  The Middle Eastern section was to die for with flavorful hummus, naan bread, tandoori chicken and chicken curry. The tabouleh salad and the curry sauce were good as well. The only meh part of the meal was the shrimp Pad Thai. Since I am 1/2 Thai, I did not expect a Vegas buffet to perfect Thai cooking like they do here in the LA area where I live. Could have used a little more tamarind, but I like my Pad Thai a little tangy than most. I'll give the cooks an A for effort since they used the right type of rice noodle (Sen Lek).  If I wanted Thai food, I'd go to a Thai restaurant.   There were many places to hit but the stomach only has so much room.  Unless I wanted to relive the scene from Monty Python's movie "The Meaning of Life."  (I'll refrain from spoiling the scene)  Our 9 year old loved the dessert buffet. The fresh spun cotton candy was the highlight for her. I took a bite and it was pretty good. The flan was delicious and the cannolis were pretty good as well. I like the Orleans' cannolis better at the French Market Buffet but the Spice Market's were not bad. No pecan pie that I could see but that's not a deal breaker. My wife had the bread pudding and said it was OK.  Will definitely come back and eat another meal at this buffet. Next time we'll try to see if we can get in at the tail end of lunch so we can try some of the dinner items when they change from lunch to dinner.  If you do a Google seach,  you can find $5.00 off coupons for this place which they will take.  Now I need to find the 25% coupons that I have heard a lot about.

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I almost didn&#39;t want to eat the carrots.  They looked so good.
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The real good Middle Eastern station.  A must eat!
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cotton candy as seen in Katy Perry&#39;s &#34;California Gurls&#34; video.  Well....not really.  It is served everyday here.

NiEt8PwRLWXCLhP5Xw7nPg.text: Don't eat here for $27.99!  Food had been laying there for awhile and was totally dried out. Even the desserts were dry. Not a great variety either like other Vegas buffets.

Pt53Srpc4P07m09xpMSNqg.text: The selection wasn't very broad, and it is certainly excellent quality of food. The pastas were absolutely delicious and one of the cupcake desserts had a cannoli in the center--YUM!! It was nice for how small it is.

61V0wVUO8CDGzjqrQXa6Xg.text: Had high expectations for this buffet. Was disappointed. Food was either overcooked or undercooked as well as dried out. The dessert bar was okay though.

B3HsgJrhMvW4weoSWM1yaA.text: For a Las Vegas buffet, it's on par. I was here for the brunch, that comes with champagne. I drank much champagne and ate my weight in food. They have many different varieties of cuisines.

n6rYIQovmzhpI5oogvarHw.text: I don't know where to start.  I am not pleased with the Spice Market.  If you want better food go to the Mess Deck on the USS Kearsarge LHD-3.  It felt like the food was prepared off-site in a factory and just warmed at the eatery.  I was expecting tasty South West Asian food, but instead it was canned Dolma, Hummus that tasted like diarrhea, and Chicken Kebab meat that tasted like super dry chicken breasts.  The deserts, they looked industrially manufactured off-site.  The coffee tasted worse than Mess Deck or Chow Hall coffee.    I wonder with plenty of 5 star reviews, I wondered if those customers were more drunk and intoxicated than an Infantry Marine or Deck Department Sailor suffering from ETOH poisoning.    The price wasn't even worth the crappy food, for better food, go to the Area 52 Chow Hall.

B1fKhUMhmLIMPZJvyD6bOw.text: Food was delicious! Amazing staff and incredible desserts! It is on the pricey side, but it is Vegas, so I can't complain much.

hG-MrF785MaGQoVRVaU8nA.text: Most items were room temp or cooler.  Left hungry and we are not big eaters. Desserts were good.

Ae6yQTtoJg34cKhuId3czw.text: We came here around lunch time with Buffet of Buffets (BoB) pass and we decided to come to see how bad it was. Seriously we didn't come with much expectation, we just wanted to see how bad it was after reading so many reviews. And we can't agree more, this buffet is really bad. They do have food but none of them look appealing even when you are hungry. The dessert station was full of cupcakes which I don't eat even on a regular day. I know you are gonna laugh when I am about to tell you that their steamed jasmine rice is the best they had there. Yes, I mean it.  We are so glad we went there with BoB, we only sat there for one hour. What an interesting ride. I don't know who would want to pay full price to get in this buffet.

J61BUS35E9IgNiVssR5qew.text: The Spice Market buffet was really disappointing.  The shrimp, wild mushroom stew, strawberry cream cake and bread pudding were the only redeeming dishes.  The crab legs had the frozen seawater taste (at least they were pre cut) and most of the fish in the seafood section were dried out, frozen fish.  The grape rolls in the Middle Eastern wasn't even edible.    The deserts were marginally better.  It was definitely a cop out to have so many cupcakes instead of real deserts.  Glad I got a groupon and didn't pay full price for it.

YjfrAZeDVar7RGJxx5hV9w.text: By far one of my favorite buffets in Vegas because it's a bit more low key and always delicious (I've been here 3 times total). There's a large variety of different cuisines which is always convenient when you're in a large group with different tastes. I highly recommend the brunch version too so that there's the added choice of breakfast food and endless mimosas are best at midday.

tuwMnw-VQTQb_nvkKJ_XYQ.text: The Spice Market Haiku  Champagne brunch is fun. Taste foods from around the world. All my meat is dry.  The end.

b-YAuT4uiIMirxdiyPMACg.text: This place was OK, they definitely have a good assortment of food.  During a trip to Las Vegas last year in Nov. we did the buffet of buffets and we tried this place out. It was good. The thing I liked the most was their cupcakes, I was amazed at how many different kinds they had.

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some of the food selections
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. so many choices
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So many cupcakes

9IhjIP9Ar3eXeMAgw361xw.text: There was a time when buffets in Las Vegas were good.  I recently visited Las Vegas, first time in about 10 years, and found the quality of food had taken a nosedive.  We were told this place was the best buffet in Vegas.  WRONG!  Not by a long shot.  The food was subpar at best.  WE stood and waited an eternity to be seated.  Finally, some aged barmaid who was clearly drunk came over to seat us.  Our waitress was horribly rude and sarcastic.    However, the buffet at the Bellagio is far superior to this.

KlOaTbxX-VI30RpdmOR0aQ.text: This one is our fav of the buffet of buffets. It's got a lot of food and easy to reach especially when we stay at Planet Hollywood too. The servers are fast and nice.

ZLZibxoK6AwtmXAbrmeDnw.text: Wide section of different foods that should please everyone.  As with perhaps all buffets, somethings were better than others with nothing bad, but not outstanding either.

uLDariq6JHckd7Y2ETN02w.text: I don't know what happened- this used to be a pretty good buffet, but this time around it was obvious that it was lacking in quality. Mediocre choices and food. 3 stars because with the groupon it was still a good deal and still got really full, but unfortunately I'll probably be skipping this one from now on.

Yxp-EONz76y00fLE3bAR0A.text: This was once one of our favorite buffets, partly because they had a really good coupon in the Las Vegas Advisor book. We really enjoyed the variety, but we have come to find out that the variety has decreased a lot and the size is half of what it once was (they called it a "change of concept" when I emailed them-- yeah, right!). They are also not honoring the coupon in the 2017 Las Vegas Advisor coupon book, which seems really lousy to me. I know they lowered the price, but that was undoubtedly because they lowered the size of the buffet. If they would have changed their policy in 2018, that would have been fine-- but the Spice Market Buffet was part of why I bought two Advisor books this year. I am thoroughly disgusted. They've lost some customers in us. There are too many places to go around town to have to deal with the Strip and that mile-long walk from the parking garage to the buffet. What is wrong with the Strip? They're making it less and less desirable as time goes on.

iDiEM_7mGbhPei-iCmjmzA.text: This is a really good buffet.  We stopped here when we were in Planet Hollywood as they gave us a discount voucher.  They have all the standard fare you would expect.  Once thing I noticed was that the quality seemed to be better than the other buffets, including Rio's World buffet.    Service was also good, as the server came around often to take care of our drinks.  Make sure to get the discount coupons that they pass out, or for getting their new player card.  It's a good deal.  We were here for lunch, so I there wasn't a huge variety of exotic foods as I have read in other reviews.  I will be coming back in a few months and I'll be staying at Planet Hollywood, so I'll come back for round two.

QHy21WjFp8X79gm-C4Q6cg.text: We came here after many recommendation.  They do have a lot of choices, but most are lukewarm and for this, I stayed away from the seafood.  As a Mexican food lover, I went straight for that area. It made me sad looking at it. It looked like it had been sitting out for a long time.  Most of the food was mediocre at best. If you drink a lot of alcohol, I could see this being passable. So drink up! Drinks were refilled quickly and the server checked up on us a good amount which is why this is two stars.  If you can afford it, the Paris buffet will be one of the only ones I trust at this point.

hpuXEB9GLVhZgca_5Ix8Pg.text: First of all, I would like to say thank you to Nikki, the cashier supervisor on May 18, 2015. She was very professional and respectful during our first encounter. She knows the True meaning of customer service. Thank you very much for resolving the issue we had during our visit at Spice Market. However, I am giving this restaurant 1 star less because of the issue below:  I would like to state that i really do not appreciate a waitress who treats me like crap. It was my first time buying the 24-hour buffet pass. At the registration booth, i was informed that i could purchase this at the spice market buffet. Since we were hungry, we went to this buffet for dinner. The cashier did not tell us that there were two options--pay the one time buffet pass OR pay the 24-hr pass. Since it was our first time, i thought she charged me the 24-hour pass (in my mind at the time, this was the only option). I was very hungry so i signed my receipt without looking at the total Amount charhed, went straight to the buffet, and ate my heart out. Then later, when my mom asked if i have kept the receipt (so we could show the receipt the next day), i realized that they had charged me less than what i expected to pay. I went to the cashier that charged my card and asked her to that i originally wanted the 24-hour pass and the total Amount charged was incorrect. She blatanly told me that since 15 mins already passed, she is unable to upgrade the ticket. I told her that i wished that she had asked before charging my card that there were 2 options available for purchase. Also, this is not an upgrade or a refund. I simply would like to be charged for the 24hour pass that i originally wanted. She immediately defended herself stating, "i always ask everyone which option they'd like to buy". She obviously did not in my case. She sounded like she is not blaming anyone but the customer. Even though i asked nicely if she could reconsider, she did not at least make me feel valued as a customer, who is willing to pay for what was wanted. She did not even offer to consult with her manager, which was the better way to resolve the situation rather than leaving the customer upset and unsatisfied. Anyway, i don't want to mention her name. But please, if you are reading this, make sure you are REALLY asking each and every customer whether they would like to purchase the one time pass or 24-hour pass. Also make sure that since you are working for a customer-driven business, you are making sure that you are making your customers feel respected, valued, and happy.

Rtxm7S26OfxBtx8ylQ4_eQ.text: Worst buffet I've ever been to. Couldn't even eat, nibbled on a few things and left. Went and got something else to eat. I wouldn't waste your money unless you're hung over or desperate.

_8AbGmKUj8j253CCCHymLQ.text: We frequent Las Vegas and almost always buy the 24 hour buffet. Unfortunately, Spice Market has changed so much. They have closed a significant amount of space and, in the process, trimmed down the buffet selections. Most food are dry and bland; I don't remember this place being this disappointing. Unfortunately, this place is on longer one of my go to places.

Cb0bsWEHCchMbaN1tflN0g.text: Came here around New Years, it was probably one of the worst customer service experiences I've had. I had come with a friend of mine and her younger cousin, when we went up to the counter the woman who was handling our transaction told me it would be $80 for the three of us, I handed her my card and she gave me the receipt to sign. But upon looking at the receipt I saw that I was charged nearly $40 more than what she had originally told me. When I asked her why this was, she said "oh I forgot it was holiday pricing I clicked the wrong button that's why I told you the other price." And she did not seem apologetic at all and wasn't even trying to be nice to us, she made it seem like she just wanted us out of there so she wouldn't have to deal with us anymore. We would have been fine paying the holiday pricing, the thing that really aggravates me is she neglected to inform me that she had changed the price and was not going to be charging me the amount she had told me. We were confused with what was going on and she dismissed us and started to help the next customers and we stood off to the side. We decided to talk to one of the other employees and I very politely explained the situation to her, harboring no negativity towards her because I understood it wasn't her mistake and there's no reason to be rude to her. But once again, we were met with attitude and a strong sense of disdain towards helping us. When I explained that the first employee didn't tell us she had charged us the holiday pricing instead, this second employee said "okay but it IS holiday pricing so she's not wrong" and I explained that I understood that, but I wasn't informed of it and the attitude I was receiving combined with this mix up was making me want a refund instead of dining here. She delayed in giving us the refund, she clearly didn't want to, and ended up calling their manager down ten minutes later because she was the only one allowed to give refunds. When the manager came she was actually really nice and gave us our refund with no hesitation and apologized, but these employees were terrible and completely ruined the experience.

PuNm9prihJ1URS7Jk465eA.text: This buffet is okay. The selection is large and impressive but I thought the food was just middle of the road food.  Their Asian selection was well very Americanized. Think Kung Pao chicken etc. They did have drunken noodles but it was a bit dried out.  Their soups were kind of bland, including the chicken noodle soup. I did fill up on salad but you don't go to buffets for salad.  They had a lot of desserts. I ate a fruit tart and some cake.  Their drink selection is pretty good.

QEDOg9gxgxY59uQO9cmw0A.text: Came here for breakfast using our buffet of buffets 24 hour pass. First, the buffet is completely split into two sides. Why they didn't put all the breakfast items in the middle section instead of having customers walk on two opposite sides of the large dining room is beyond me.  The waiters do not give you your beverages timely and seem like they are short staffed.  Eating here for breakfast is ok. Not the best but at least it is somewhat decent.

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y1EWOcyOYPWnHISaQl7WoA.text: Came here around 5:30 for their dinner buffet on a Sunday. We purchased a buffet of buffet pass at the counter, and there was only a 5 minute wait time. The buffet selections are pretty standard, but I would not recommend this buffet to anyone who doesn't eat spicy food. The vast majority of their food is spicy, and their entire Asian food section is spicy. Our server was very slow and never checked on us to see how we were doing. We had trouble flagging her down to get drink refills and such throughout the dinner. They have stuffed sole, grilled zucchini, broccoli, crab legs that are split open already (fairly standard at buffets on the Strip) and small assortment of mediocre desserts.  Maybe we came too early for their dinner rush, but the food wasn't refilled that quickly and some of their food wasn't actually that warm. The environment itself is very dim and the AC wasn't that strong. The small saving grace is their cotton candy station, which I have yet to see at any other buffet on the Strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jq4KxCyCJtPBondCn3AdPg.text: Average buffet, average food, average-ness all around. Came here for dinner and had (you guessed it) an average time. I had a Groupon, don't come here unless you have a coupon - there should always be some sort of coupon somewhere, and only paid tax on the meal. The buffet has food from all over the world: Mexican, Middle Eastern, American, etc. Nothing overly impressed me, but it wasn't bad. This place is just another run in the mill buffet you'll eat at to occupy your time. Keep your expectations in check.

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert section at the buffet!

enDoN8QIKtLV01uv1vNp_g.text: The only reason why we came here were for the crab legs, and now they got rid of it along with their seafood section. It was instant regret buying the buffet-of-buffet pass when we saw the crab legs were gone. Disappointed.

tAjBt_N537bicBp87QsffA.text: Came back after a 5 year break.  This time breakfast.  It was bad.  I couldn't get eggs made to order- only a giant tin of scrambled eggs (looked free hotel breakfast food, ie: Best Western), or premade goopy eggs benedict.   The other food stations had few options even though the granola/fruit/yogurt... station was excellent.  We were sooooo disappointed and I guess the last to know because the place was empty.  I've never seen a Vegas hotel's buffet so empty.  I surely would not return.

16fR46w2H_VzuTIsT9QFug.text: I've actually been to this buffet twice now. Decently priced at $27.99 per person. Option to add unlimited alcohol (beer and wine) for $12.99. Beer selection looked pretty lame though. Mostly domestic. Offers an array of dishes from around the world - Mexican, Middle Eastern, Asian, and American to name a few. They also have a Salads and Seafood section. Crab legs galore, mussels and shrimp were fantastic to feast on. Not a fan of their 'slow-roasted' Prime Rib as this was rather salty. Most food items were pretty salty in fact. LOVED the dessert section. The Creme Brulee was DIVINE! Lots to choose from and they even make fresh crepes in front of you although you have to queue up for one of course. OK buffet choice which isn't as busy as most, but you can definitely get better elsewhere.

ikTe1ZYmeFHfOLsQOeDFmw.text: I hated this place overly pricey and disgusting. The Cups was also dirty! I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND TO ANYONE OR EVER GO BACK

jY2fNo-u5YitBpYOXAcKVw.text: It's okay.  For the price, if you're hungry during lunch hours, I'd definitely swing by and fill up on food...but that's about it.  The food isn't bad...maybe the the same as your local Chinese/seafood buffet.  Not impressive, not bad, pretty good if you're really hungry.  Maybe I'll check it out for dinner on my next Vegas trip.....maybe not.  When I'm starving during lunch,, and only want to spend $20 for lots of decent food, I'll definitely be back.

Z1X_zTS29bgJchMEb4hamw.text: My husband and I took advantage of the Travelzoo deal ($39 for 2... normally it is $29.99 per person for dinner if you are a total rewards member... free membership... or $30.99 for non total rewards members) and decided to eat dinner at this buffet this past Thursday. We arrived around 5:45 pm for an early dinner (we had a really early lunch and so we were hungry) and did not have wait in line. But as time passed, the line started to get pretty long (so come early if you don't want to wait... no one wants to be around a hangry person).   Anyways, when I saw the overall rating for this place on yelp (3 stars at the time of this review), I wasn't expecting much but decided to purchase the Travelzoo deal anyway to save some money while on our weekend getaway. Well to my surprise, the food was actually pretty good (4 stars worthy for this review).   Just like most of the other buffets in Las Vegas, there are different stations to choose from (Seafood, Soup, Salad, Mexican, Dessert, Chinese, Mediterranean, American). In the seafood section, you will find shrimp, snow crab legs and muscles. Unfortunately on the opposite side of the seafood section of the buffet is nearly empty (Mediterranean, 2nd soup station, 2nd salad station & Mexican stations are located on this side). But it is nice that there is less of a line on this side of the buffet and I really enjoyed the food items from both the Mediterranean and Mexican station. Also there was more selection to choose from in the salad station on this side (but of course I know most people are not thinking healthy greens and vegetables when at a buffet, especially one in Vega$).   I least liked some of the offering at the American station. Here you will find a carving station (where I got lamb, but wasn't too happy with a big thing of fat... most of my meat was just fat... gross!), sliders (chicken and beef) and so forth. The chicken slider was not quite flavorful at all. The bun was really hard and the chicken was one of those mini breaded buffalo chicken patties (tasted like something that was frozen and reheated). The beef slider wasn't good either.   I loved the dessert station (right in the middle of the the buffet). They actually have blue cotton candy that you can have, which was quite fun and light to eat (also makes great for photos). There are so many sweet choices of desserts, unlike other buffets I have been to along the strip that didn't have as many great choices. You can get cupcakes, flan, cake slices, tarts, crepes made to order, etc (there was also one macaron cookie available) and make your own ice cream sundae area as well.   Although the food offered here isn't the best on the strip, it is still pretty good (especially at the price for what we paid.. by the way, after the voucher, we still had to paid an additional $3.16 for the tax) and wouldn't mind coming here again in the distant future (it's Vegas, I know I will be back soon).

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special Travelzoo deal, 2 people for $39 (prior to tax... just pay additional $3.16 for the tax at the register)
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Slider (dry and not flavorful)

4r0uAiQ15R8abuC3HAXMCA.text: So upset with the staff and management. I had purchased a groupon to this buffet for my bfs birthday and we went down there ready to eat and the cashier redeemed the Groupon then charged my card the tax then asked to see in ID after redeeming the Groupon my ID must have fallen out of my wallet somewhere because I did not have it then she told me that she could not Process the transaction even though she had already scanned the Groupon and swiped my card she offered a refund but told me I had to take it up with Groupon to receive my refund from them because they did not deal with the group on there I called the managers and never received a callback very upset with how this is handled

I_ZrGKz3lBWvLZq3ejsTIw.text: first time to eat at planet hollywood's spice market buffet.we ate here as part of the buffet of buffets package. i must say i was positively surprised. they have the various stations to choose from and delish dishes. their salad bar has more variety. i like their asian station as they serve a very tasty pad thai.   thumbs up for this buffet

DcUsqyReT_FJAgy8FatpUQ.text: What has happened to all these Vegas buffet, they use to be so good. I go to Vegas all the time but I had stop going to some of the buffets I was only going to Cesar's and Studio B.I decided to visit others on this trip I had all my family with me. The worst choice I made the buffet is smaller they didn't even have a pizza what buffet doesn't have pizza for the kids. Very mediocre desserts were terrible and some tasted like mouthwash. I would only pay like $16 for this buffet not worth the price.I would stay away

WFRkQNUHyf0CJPkyqTOadw.text: Delish, got a Groupon prices were good for the strip. Excellent Middle Eastern, lamb, & veggie kabobs, stuffed grape leaves. Tri tip beef, ribsat American station, grilled veggies, desserts to die for frozen custard.

iC3R9MAdKfOiFdgnC933bA.text: Food was okay. Many selections but more on the lines of international buffet. Very clean and staff friendly. Host was accommodating when I had no WiFi and gave Ph WiFi info.  No crab legs on the Thursday I went

GDKvyv5wVYLsgoDiUMPqLg.text: Regular buffet price is $25pp, but they raised it to $30pp for Fourth of July.  When asked if they added specialty item, they noted yes and that there are several chef specialties.  What a disappointment... Not only do I feel ripped off, the quality of food and options have gone way down since I was here 2 years ago.  The decor, food options & everything seems off.  Unless you're getting the buffet for free here, go somewhere else. It's just not that good & worth the money.

LojsM-U2Iga7zLuY3dpmFA.text: Even with the Groupon, this place is hopeless. Half heartedly made cafeteria food. Extremely non accommodating for vegetarians. Bland and flavorless middle eastern food. Only saving grace is dessert. No pizza/pasta in the Italian section, seriously? And the worst part is nobody cares or they don't read their own business reviews!

kjZb8I3dfpNn0LNaL1m8KA.text: This was my favorite in town during my visit to las Vegas. Armed with a travelzoo voucher, we headed to champagne brunch without any particular expectations. First of all, Maritza ( or possibly Maricella) was our server, and the best server we had in buffet setting during our visit to Vegas. Our glasses never went empty. We worked our way in a clockwise fashion. stuffed sole and peel and eat shrimp were the highlight of the otherwise uninteresting seafood section. Onto a yummy looking italian section where i sampled meatballs that would make my Nonna hang up her apron. a huge breakfasty section was mostly avoided- except for some eggs benedict , egg itself was a bit firm for my taste, and partner had a lovely supercheesy beef slider. My favorite part of the buffet was strangely the tabouli. It was the best tabouli i had ever had in my life... fresh and light and perfectly lemony. hummus was good, dolmas good. Why on earth would you put pita in a basket labeled Naan? shaking my head here. Tandoori style chicken while good, lacked traditional flavor. High quality olives were available near the imported meats and cheeses, I missed this station initially starting from the other side. Don't miss this station, everything besides the mortadella was primo. I would also like to give the pastry chef a big ole hug. Most of the other buffets we went to had the same exact stuff; i'm guessing that the MGM properties make all of their desserts in the same place and have them delivered so Spice Market was a real treat. Was particularly smitten with the angel food cupcake with a mini canoli popping out of the top, i can still taste it- simply amazing. I had a few other bite size treats but wow, that cupcake was the star... I hope to go back in the future, even sans discount!

WT7Mkqv3l5tgA2tJvW9a8A.text: For the price, it's kind of hard to beat Spice market buffet. I've stayed at Planet Hollywood my last two vegas trips and I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the Spice market. Without breaking the bank at buffets like Belagio, spice market is a bang-for-the-buck buffet. My top pics at this buffet:  Crab legs, Mediterranean kabobs, pork loin, and definitely the french silk pie!

DWbTc_SZdZZF_5IGkFu81A.text: Very much disappointed for a five star hotel to serve such a crappy food and for the price they charge.  Nothing special woth regards to the quality of the food and the variety of the food.  Will never  recommend this place and will never go back.  The only plus side is our waiter was a totally nice guy and the dessert is also fine.

XkBabFq1vdDs3yA48JNJIw.text: Definitely one of the better buffets I visited when I was in Vegas. Located downstairs at Planet Hollywood, this place is a must visit if you're staying at the hotel.  The food here is totally amazing. The seafood was actually really good and fresh, which is always nice for a buffet to have. But the thing you're definitely looking for is desserts. Raspberry cheesecake and carrot cake? YUUUUM.  BTW when I was there I bought this buffet deal thing that was apparently working for all Harrah's casino buffets. Basically it was like a 24 hour pass, and within those 24 hours you can go to any buffet as many times as you want. Definitely a deal, so take advantage of it if it's still available. It only cost $34.99 I believe =]

azGMnTSJnFGtmXc93Ry-BA.text: we bought the BUFFET OF BUFFETS 24 HOUR PASS - which included the PH the spice market buffet ... the majority of the food was very salty ...

s3QXXc_tb75JUfeaTCPg6g.text: Its saving grace is the lamb. This buffet sucks. The service.. Oh wait.. Service doesn't exist it this buffet. Way over priced crap!

0QL4T6Yz2_uaq8nH23BPxA.text: Diverse selection of food, similar to Rio ( though not quite as vast as Rio), but more conveniently located on The Strip.  The crab legs are nice here because they are pre-split so you don't have to crack them open yourself, saving you valuable minutes of gluttony time.  The food here is separated by regions, such as Italian, Mexican, Middle Eastern, etc.  Being at least a platinum Total Rewards member really helps here because the line for the more plebeian customer gets very long in a short amount of time.  In general, the quality is decent; they are going for more variety while sacrificing some quality vs. a small amount of foods that taste absolutely spectacular (as is the case with most buffets).

ew19cpa3Yy_7MYZUU9XrlA.text: Buffet of Buffets: Stop #1: Brunch  Why is it still called the Spice Market Buffet? How about Avenue of the Stars Buffet or something? Anyway, the food here is just average. I can't think of one thing that really stood out to me. Well.. the pineapple and watermelon were really fresh. Hmm......with so many different types of food....not a good sign. Our server was super nice and friendly though. On a side note, after waiting at the escalator entrance for awhile, we went down and it's a whole other line to wait in. I feel cheated!

8SvqYppZoZM2aX6Pm-XPWQ.text: We went to Spice Market Buffet around 10:45 am to eat lunch and paid breakfast price. There's also $5 coupon out there if you google it, so we saved $20 for group of four, which is pretty sweet deal especially in Vegas.   For food, it was very good for its price. Although it's little bit below Bellagio Buffet quality, it gets the job done without a doubt. Selection was plentiful, I couldn't try all of it even I stayed around there another 45 minutes or so LOL. You gotta try cakes, those were fantastic in my opinion.   One bad thing about the buffet? Well.. I got on the escalator to the casino floor and saw Pai Gow Poker Table. You know the story.. lost $250 in one hour and left bad taste in my mouth afterward LOL : P

NOuRnUAJnkSZ0zDN7XqxXg.text: I went with my family for brunch a bit past noon last Sunday.  The line was long but moved pretty quickly and we soon excitedly entered the buffet, with its "fare from around the world."  While they did appear to have many stations from Middle-Eastern to Mexican, upon approaching the stations, we found that they had very few choices at each of those stations.  My mom was particularly dismayed at the seafood station, with its sorry selection of a few kinds of shrimp, a couple kinds of salmon, one more old looking fish and no crab or sushi in sight.    I went for the Middle-Eastern food; the pita bread was on the harder side and the hummus watery.  Not good, not bad.  The pasta was possibly the worst I've had (made me think of cafeteria food) and there wasn't much I could eat from the Asian station, since I don't eat meat, other than seafood.  My dad and sister seemed to enjoy the few cuts of the meat they had at the American station.  After I tried the seafood, I walked around to look at all the food and see what I wanted.  I went to the salad bar, to make my favorite spinach salad but walked away when I saw a BUG about a half inch long in the spinach.  I thought to myself at first, oh my... well - I guess it is hard to wash every single bug out of the many pounds of spinach they must put out daily.  But it's a restaurant; shouldn't they be responsible for cleaning the vegetables enough to at least get out a large bug like that?  My sister was indifferent about all of the food, except for the bread and the tempura shrimp, which she liked.  Their garlic bread was my favorite thing there, other than a couple of the desserts, but I didn't pay $25 to eat bread.  The fruit was good, as was the dessert (I liked the cannoli), except for the crepe.  The best part was getting cotton candy from the dessert bar!    All in all, the bland and poor quality of the majority of the food (and the bug), as well as the sad selection, outweighed the fun desserts and good bread.  I guess our expectations were too high for the buffet.  If you go with no/low expectations on a weekday for lunch at a lower price, maybe you'd find it worthwhile, but I would have much rather had one dish that was really tasty.  How could this have been the #1 buffet in Vegas?

kJPC4BCkYfmk9aZxIXFE-Q.text: This buffet is very overpriced especially considering the quality of the food.  Most of the food is average and the rest is below average.  For the price it is more worth it to spend a few extra bucks and go to Bacchanal Buffet at Caesars Place or The Wicked Spoon at the Cosmopolitan.  5/10 for food, 2/10 for price, 7/10 for staff (some were friendly while others were kinda rude).  Overall, this buffet is not worth going to and there are far better buffets walking distance away that you can go to.

J4Z7CFz7nlM3X9tRz2EVHA.text: Nice dessert, love the ham, seafood area is disappointing, about 15 mins to start your food including line up to pay, get to seat, not bad for Tuesday lunch.

vmDwFXB30G_OUmriJvH9Qg.text: What can I really say about Vegas buffets?   Okay the food was decent, but let me say there was a moment where my friend had to excuse herself to spit out one of the dumplings she ate. We got our all-day buffett pass here ($50!!!) and really this place just served as a place to get energized and feed for the day or even recovering. I must say though their service was pretty decent with constant visits from our server.

3QubqNbEnx1bZJZL3p5W9A.text: I went here for dinner and it was a huge disappointment. It was mostly fried food and not too much to rave about. The middle eastern section did have a good lamb dish but honestly, I would not go again. They had snow crab legs but nothing except the middle east section was memorable. The whole place had mostly fried food. The desserts were also very mediocre. I should have done a lap around beforehand. You are also in the basement of the hotel, not casino level or up a flight.

1_sppQRZrrivKPUEGWVQWg.text: My friends and I decided to come here the day after going to a pool party because we didn't want to be sporting our food babies in public. :) We arrived around 3:30 and there was a small line, so we got seated pretty quickly. They were still serving breakfast in the late afternoon, which was totally a plus for me.. and everyone else in Vegas who struggles to wake up any time before 12:00 haha. Most of the food was pretty average-- nothing out of the ordinary. I'd have to say my favorite part was the "Mid-Eastern" section in the middle of the buffet.   Since we came in so late, they were actually switching out the breakfast/lunch food with the dinner selections. This was pretty awesome because we paid the lunch price and actually got to eat some crab legs too! If you're trying to save time by only eating one meal in Vegas, I'd suggest hitting up the buffet in the late afternoon. :)

IQkcVpu5dMlwPJSTQHuy6g.text: Good selection but not worth $30 dollar for lunch buffet.  The quality of many items were not that good.  Two things stood out though that were excellent : Seafood Payea and Crepes

clI3Mbk_SDYBt3qYVQrL3Q.text: Here on a Sunday bunch! Not only are the food choices fantastic, but the service is as well! Yelena, our server, was beyond accommodating and awesome! As as frequent Vegas attendee, I would highly recommend this place! :) Two thumbs up!

6uSGssHLD2VdV25mDsDU6Q.text: Don't waste your time. My husband & I actually caught this on a groupon so we gave it a try. We were not impressed with their Sat. Night buffet. Literally everything was bad, the service was aweful (& we left a tip of $10 at register but they automatically give it to server so when the see a good tip before you even sit down they don't have to work for one) the endless drinks are nasty & beer was expired. I am never a negative Nancy so here is your only up side, the cheesecake was delightful. The endless split crab legs have grits of shell on meat & it is served on the bar frozen (supposed to be cold as the server clarified for us) we literally tried every item besides the eastern area & some things even made me do the immediate eject from mouth trick. My husband & I are your normal people so don't think this review is just because we have high standards. So if you have any standards at all make sure you avoid this place.

ucTk-2f9aSw0cipf-MG-hg.text: For someone who wants good quality and freshly made dishes,  avoid this place!   It was a waste of money and I had to nit-pick my food because all the items looked like they were sitting there food the past 6-10+ hours.     I had taken my family there for dinner and I cannot find food that's fresh to eat - I literally had to force myself to eat something.  The fruit selection of honeydew, cantaloupes,  and pineapples were the best part.    Their sushi rolls (only 3 kinds) looked like it belongs in the trash.   The Mexican dishes with the Pico de gallo looked so old!   Barf!  Asian food included bbq wings.     Save money and go somewhere else.

-p0eNgcLcNztMugfOQ8I2A.text: I've been to the Spice Market buffet approximately 6-8x now and I will never return again.  Checked in Saturday @ 830 PM (After waiting in line for 45 minutes)...Walked immediately to the Seafood Line (assuming there were Alaskan Crab Legs)...The label on the sneeze glass read (ACL), but there weren't any there. I don't even think it was Snow Crab! I have no idea what they were serving. The size (width) of the crab legs were equivalent to my pinky or smaller!!! The legs weren't even red and they were an ugly red/brown color. I'm actually hoping it taste better than it looks after it was steamed, it was salty and the butter couldn't even save it. Absolutely horrible.  While I was waiting in line I noticed someone with a full plate of ACL. I asked the employee where did he get it. He said he got it from the back and it was for a "Diamond" member. Before bumping into this guy, the man behind the glass said they ran out of ACL. BS! How can you run out, you're telling me there won't be any for the next day? I can't believe it. I'm never spending my money here ever again.

ugG7qcdcgli6-G23pgme3Q.text: I really enjoyed this buffet at the planet Hollywood casino. The way they have each little section set up with different styles of food, such as Asian, Middle Eastern, American, Mexican, etc. is phenomenal! I ended up trying a little bit off of each section and thoroughly enjoyed my meal. The pricing for it's not that bad either, so I highly recommend

GaEon4kL82EIqVpIBWUvhQ.text: Not to many options to choose from. The quality is below average . Normally when I get so hungry, eveything tastes good, except for this time, i cant even make up my mind what to eat and dont even have the appetite to eat here. So disappointed

RsaZlzJVV6hyLLJpQ29hDQ.text: POGIBALLS RATINGS Spice Market Buffet (Planet Hollywood), Las vegas #pogiballseats #spicemarketbuffet #pogiballsratings  Overall rating 3 Stars Light snack before lunch "BBQ Ribs / Prime Rib/ Steak / Lamb cabob / Baked Beans / Deserts" Food 3 Stars Service 3 1/2 Stars Restaurant Cleanliness 3 1/2 Stars Restroom 4 Stars Price $$$$*  For starters I had the meats. BBQ Ribs, Prime Rib, Steak and Lamb cabob.  They were all cooked well and was worth the wait in line.  Although overall the Pime rib outshined them all.  The baked beans were also good, they have little slivers of steak cooked in with them.  The deserts were ok and I had plenty to choose from.  My only argument is the price.  In Vegas you can definitely find a lot cheaper buffets that have the same or even better choices of food that taste great.    At least I can say I tried out the buffet in  Planet Hollywood. I would dine here again it but would not be my first pick.

Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

w-lm0J5uYTr5ZcrWVhjAMg.text: Honestly was excited for dinner and was kind of disappointed. A waitress was nice enough to talk with us but other than that the other workers don't really want to be bothered. And they don't even serve drinks anymore, it's get your own food and drinks. The food quality has gone way down and the options are limited. There are only like a few dishes for each variety and they aren't very appealing. Wish I scanned the buffet before eating here because it's truly not worth it.

XBhGZI4zpJR76duWTdyDzA.text: Update to my previous review.  Visited Vegas for Labor Day weekend and headed to Planet Hollywood for the buffet.  The girlfriend and I were treating my sister and nephew to the Spice Market experience as we raved the whole way about how great the food was.  Boy, did we look like fools once seated.  The size of the buffet was cut in half, the workers said it was due to flooding and that most likely repairs would not be made to return the buffet to what it once was, a delight.  Sadly the food was no where close to the options they once had as they've crammed everything into fewer food stations.  The worst part is that the price remains the same, even though the quality and quantity is severely lacking.  So disappointed!

szMY7J2UKcJ7U2VbErcbAQ.text: Came to this buffet during a recent trip to Las Vegas. I honestly think that this buffet is not bad by any means and a value at a little over $30 a person but the food was very average. Nothing blew me away food wise except maybe one or two things in the desert bar. My advice is that if you're in Planet Hollywood and want to go try this out by all means go but I would say to look at other places first.

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OZ-8q_3EwfOJ3z_vZXeXNA.text: I recently came back here and noticed this buffet got a lot smaller from what I remembered! I used to really like this buffet because they had so many different foods and lots of different varieties/choices to choose from. There's barely any seafood now and the food options are very limited. Their Groupon deal used to be so worth it since it also had all you can drink which came with unlimited wine, beer or champagne. The food is still alright, I just wish they had more seafood and more food options to choose from. I remember they had so much more to offer when I came here a couple years back. A little disappointed this visit!

Ntfy6yJ2ovgj1knmMP6cTw.text: First - you will not have cell service or the ability to check in when you get into line because the buffet is located underground.  What used to be a great buffet has succumbed to the average.  No longer do they have crab legs of any kind.  Their desert area now has items you can't see, but can still ask for.  They still have cotton candy and cream Brulee (both you had to ask for but didn't have a display for).  The place is clean, the service is good.  They do have a Pepsi fountain machine - so you can choose lots of different flavors of soda (yes, including Mt. Dew!).  I used to recommend this buffet to friends visiting, but will think twice now that they changed some things.  The nice thing is, it is cheaper than it used to be.  The visit tonight was dinner on a Saturday night at 6pm and there was NO line.

rolkE2xIUiQUJ_T0PIn10A.text: Spice Market Buffet, how you've aged terribly over the years. You were once one of the best buffets for the price on the strip.  How far you've fallen from those glory days.  I read a lot of reviews before I posted mine, people who gave you over 3 stars are straight TRIPPING.  You need to re-evaluate how you eat in life.  As a Vegas veteran of over 15 years, you were always a staple during my visits.  Tonight we arrived (5PM on Friday) only to learn that you no longer do the 24-hr dining pass on holidays.   29.99 for dinner, okay no problem.    Upon exploring the buffet area, we noticed that 1/3 of the seating area and food selection on the left side were missing.  Under the "seafood" sign, you had no seafood.  Pork sliders I'm certain do not come from the ocean.   The ONLY seafood you had were baby shrimps at the other end of the buffet, next to stale caesar salad.  No crab,  no more sushi, nothing.    Under the Italian section,  you had ONE penne pasta AND no pizza!  Under the Asian food section, 4 items consisting of fried rice, bao, egg rolls, and one other item that we didn't touch.  Alas, straw that broke the camel's back for me was your "Chefs Special," CHILI DOGS.  Who the hell is your chef?!  Chef Mike, Mike Rowave?      Again, dont fall for all these other amazing reviews, you've been warned.    Deuces Spice Market, you're dead to me.

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The &#34;CHEF SPECIAL.&#34;  You should be ashamed of yourselves!

slACX7sTLszB-BfJVR9mfQ.text: This is a horrible and I mean absolute LOW END BUFFET. And our wife and I visiting for our first time in Vegas...and this offers nothing but overpriced can selected food.

x2GapQYZ-Og_MOMHpSGqfQ.text: I guess the food was edible. The entry way to this buffet is gorgeous. Then you go down stairs to the actually buffet area and it's VERY OUT DATED!!!   We walked up to the host stand to get seated and the cashier and two host were all standing their talking to each other and just ignored us until they finished their conversation. Mind you the to host were facing us. So they clearly saw us standing there.   After being seated we were greeted by our server who was very nice and had a wonderful smile. Thank you to him.   The food on the bars were dried out and had no flavor. I kind of expected a lot more because 5yrs ago I came here and enjoyed it. So I brought my Husband here, after raving about it for weeks. Lol   The cooks came around to the other side of the bars to fix foods and straighten up but never fixed the labels on the food. Some foods had no labels, wrong labels or just completely in the wrong spot all together.   The freshly brewed Tea was the best part of our buffet experience. Also a delicious strawberry cupcake on the dessert bar.   We also ordered two glasses of wine but they tasted like the bottles might have been opened a year ago. After traveling down the the Mexican food bar you can see inside a room where dish tubs and 10bottles of wine just sit in a corner. Filthy mess. We just left after that.  Thanks to our friendly server, cupcake and the fresh brewed tea.   People don't waste your money here. Go to McDonalds for better food and customer service. Lol seriously

KNYA4v2Kxj067SlC0LpOOw.text: Terrible!!!!  I had to ask for my money back. Nothing was worth eating. I wouldn't recommend anyone to this place. I should have figured when they had no line and an empty dining room. The staff was rude. Especially the cashier, and don't dare ask a chefs a question. They snap at you.

yqniItLxjFURXwo7V7cNMg.text: BAD. It is definitely a waste of time. I came here maybe 6-7 years ago and it was definitely completely different. There is hardly any good selection of food and what they do have hardly has any taste. DO NOT waste your money or your time.

HsDZa-0Fo9MgHP0XO4Nzng.text: I really enjoyed this buffet , It does not have the largest selection of everything but it does have a very detailed selection of high-quality items such as the chow mein delicious tandoori chicken and there's only one other place of I know on the strip that serves tandoori chicken the special selection of cheeses and all of the meets I had today at spice market were good, No one thing in particular jumps out as my favorite item however I am very grateful for the amazing customer service how fast they were to keep getting me water I must've drank like a gallon and they didn't care they kept coming and I also have to say whoever it was came by the table to make sure that everything was OK the manager possibly that was awesome I really appreciate it when they take the time to come and do that, I really want to stay at this hotel so I can come back to the buffet and try it again I'm not going to be completely harsh because it was empty and they were just switching from lunch to dinner so I'm gonna write this as yes it was good but yes I need to come back and do a whole lot more of an investigation wonderful for big groups lots of seating

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KkIjDm0BB9cxNaTyUV12Uw.text: It was good.  Had all the varieties of food you can imagine.  Is it the best buffet ?  No but it's well priced and fun.

qhn0PmYXhDbMVg_EgWD8Yw.text: Thankfully I was able to eat at this buffet with a large group!  This buffet is fairly small and intimate. I wouldn't consider this buffet "high-end" but it's better than decent, in my opinion.   I didn't have any problem with my food choices! I really enjoyed the Rosemary Chicken. It reminded me of a dish I made at home and it went perfectly well with their fried rice. I enjoy the different types of food to choose from. Varying from Mexican, Asian, Salads, and so forth.  I thought that the staff were very accommodating with their service. They kept up with finished plates and made sure that we were enjoying our stay at the buffet.   This is a great place to eat a lot for a certain amount, especially on the strip!

1pXRzsvQQDG-6Yb7rgpZ1g.text: I feel like many of these reviews are a tad picky. Planet Hollywood buffet is a great option. Only $25.99 for dinner on a weeknight. I LOVE their mid-eastern section... The hummus, naan, feta, and baklava yum!

9osAzNYnsfL3z0nyEByInw.text: This used to be a great buffet. If you have not been here in a while, it's about 1/3 of its size. I'd also say the quality of this buffet is less then Sizzler.   Stay away if you want a good meal.

uxkqGAMMuaN550yR8x54ZQ.text: This place I went there 4 years ago &!it was awesome  Last month I went it was not good, the place was cut to half size of the area, the buffet was not as it used to be

8JwARckVH5pRbRBKG0f91g.text: I did this as part of the buffet of buffets and this was easily the most disappointing of the bunch. There wasn't a long line which was a positive, but the majority of the food was underwhelming. The available meats were not very good and the selection was so-so, including the desserts. They got our drink order wrong and I almost felt like the server was giving us attitude about it. We were Diamond so we got seated in a special section but it's not like it's anything that special. At Harrah's you get a whole separate plate of special crab legs, but here you just get a special area? I'd rather take the Harrah's buffet. My husband thought they had the best zucchini and squash, so if you're a fan of that maybe you'll enjoy it.   I feel like with so many other great buffets in Vegas, why waste your time on this one that is just medicore?

PWYuqMiFFOvrG0MIz9edew.text: The spice market buffet is not the best. I'm not sure how they are #1 as they claim.   It is average at best. Food is okay.  I was only there for lunch. So lunch sucks.  Maybe dinner is better.

ZAg79jbIocJYJpFzYQTFjQ.text: The buffet is barely OK. Nice decor and space. Different stations but the only thing I really liked was the teriyaki chicken. Everything else was mediocre. Crab legs, watery; meats, flavorless, and Mexican, horrendous. Service was decent.  The damn thing is we had coupons and it was still pricey for a buffet. If you can, I try somewhere else.

exOPxGRKxOjHGOj6DJbFnQ.text: We went to this buffet on our first night in Davis and it was pretty good, in fact, we came away impressed. But once we had eaten at the Bellagio Buffet, Le Village Buffet and Carnival Buffet, this one rates lowest on the chain.  We were lucky enough to have a $5 off/person coupon which saved a bit as it was a little pricey for dinner.  They do have foods from all over the world, which was nice. Their Asian foods were decent and my husband liked the crab legs. The guy on the table next to us got up a total of 7 times to refill his plate of crab legs, and that was just while we were sitting there! We arrived after him and left before him!  The highlight for my husband was the cotton candy!

lpmnPF7xny2EMjx4iSuaCw.text: Been here twice and the food is just alright. The only thing I really like is the flan which is one of the better ones I've tasted. Another thing I really liked is it was really clean, and people didn't pick at the foods all crazy like some of the other buffets.   I will probably visit here again during our next trip in Oct. since we will be staying at planet hollywood hotels.  I also want some more of the flan!

r5yLGjlnwGiifPKfi182FA.text: This buffet holds it's own against some of the more legendary buffets on the strip. Everything is fresh and tastes great. It offers any style of food you may want and it's all presented well and the selection is excellent. The desserts were varied and all great, especially the chocolate cream pie which was the best I've ever had at a buffet. Definitely worth checking out.

bq4ZxZc1xq5oDHZi0y6isw.text: We went there last night hoping to get a great experience well that wasn't the case. We went at 9 pm and the food looked old, most of everything looked like it's being sitting there for a while. I was exited that they had Mediterranean food, the skewers (only two pieces of chicken) were hard and the zucchini very mooshy. Alcohol wise the champagne was ok, wine selection horrible, my husband like the selection of beers. We also took a 4 year old that we had to pay $23 dollars for him in which I think it's insane!!!!!  How much can a 4 year old eat??? We weren't happy at all. Not worth your money

TySVMwz_WSbDgcBVQUlbGQ.text: I can't believe how awful this buffet was. You'd think that since you have to wait 40 minutes to be seated that it would be incredible. We had a party of over 8 so with gratuity added we each paid $42. The service was good but the food was horrible. Most of the food didn't have flavor, and what had flavor was just bad. The things they didn't cook were good; shrimp cocktail, sushi (little variety), cantaloupe, water, cotton candy.   Do not waste your money here. The $8.99 prime rib dinner at the Main Street Station downtown was twenty times better.

_O4965cbkxTdZSobOSLgNA.text: Skip this buffet if you're in Las Vegas. It's not bad for regular standard -- slightly better than hometown or golden coral. But for the strip, it's pretty unimpressive. There is a lot of food but they dont look that fresh. The prime rib was pretty good because it's freshly made but the other stuff was unimpressive. Rather than doing a poor job on making food from every continent, they should focus on 1 or 2 and be good at it.

VaKPgSElWzQm9Eis44aiCg.text: Good Prime Rib and Champagne, okay food for the price I guess.  The wait staff is very nice!

dw5TanMJzQ8qTzJZDV29JA.text: The Food here is not any better than the other Buffets in Vegas. But they run a ridiculous system here. They close down the buffet between meals.   On the day of my visit, We where outside lining up to get in. I saw no signs that they close between meals. No staff to attend to customers. Only an enclosure placed in front of the escalator.  We where the first few people in front of the line for we arrived 9 45 am. By 10:30 a cashier came up taking customers. So we paid for the meal hoping we going to have lunch soon.  To my surprice another line was being formed downstairs. No one was seating the customers. So we had to wait another 30 min to get to our tables.   This is truly stupid coz lunch is more expensive than breakfast. There is no point of making people wait if they have paid for lunch during breakfast hour.  I asked the server why such a system. She told me that employees takes there break during these times. In other words, the buffet is understaff.  I tell you the food is no better than any great Vegas buffet. Go somewhere else. Its not worth the wait.

403vT3qkCxtzxfiXhAon8A.text: This is pretty good buffet and doesn't get the recognition it deserves. They advertise that they were voted the #1 buffet in Vegas a few years back but most of my friends never think about going to Planet Hollywood to eat the buffet. They have fairly decent selection and the quality is higher than Rio's but a notch below Bellagio or Wynn.  Nice Middle Eastern selection, frozen custard, and king crab legs for dinner!

xQn9dREufo8TiJWuXnzixQ.text: Why 5 stars for this buffet???  1. the price is good for a strip casino lunch is about $22, dinner $26  2. very good selection  3. service is good  4. there is a restroom in the buffet area unlike most buffet, you have to go to the casino.  5. they will warm the crab legs for you if you ask and is cut in half so you dont have to do any work except eat it.  there is a American station, seafood station, Asian station, Mexican station, middle eastern station, Italian station, desert station.  The deserts here are also awesome creme brulee yum. for kids they even have cotton candy.  I believe this is one of the better buffets in vegas, Belagio is good but pricey

8ppz2x2twfszZbYnWQAZVA.text: This was definitely the best buffet we went to in Vegas.  The meal was comped, but we'd return and be glad to pay for it.  The Middle Eastern section was delightful; every offering I tried was delicious and the chefs seemed very pleased that I liked.  The Chinese food was not as fresh and seemed dried out.  I tried the almond-crusted seabass from the American section, but it was very salty and tough.  The ltalian wasn't appeal, and the seafood, while tasty, seemed a bit oversalted.  My husband enjoyed his food from the American section, though, and everyone else I saw eating seafood clearly liked it.  My favorite part of the meal was when our server informed  us of the best nightclub in town and told us that she liked going there because "the African-Americans had rhythm and liked to shake the booty."  (Direct quote.)

9pkcj5Lo9laX-bGdiASriA.text: Gotta go to a buffet when you're in Vegas!   I think it's funny that Planet Hollywood calls this place the Spice Market . . . they should have changed it to the Farmer's Market or something, but whatev.   Not the best buffet in Vegas, but I had my fill on my heart's content breakfast. Everything tastes good after a night out.   xxx C

nNezuydv4Qm3ySUtPIsWPw.text: They had a bit of everything and I really liked it despite certain reviews. We purchase the $36- 24 hour all you can eat buffet pass to 7 buffets (which can be purchased at the gold rewards desk at any participating hotels) so we decided to try it. I ate so much and there dessert was off the hook! And since we often stay at PH, it's super convenient. We will surely make our way back here.

h2TuJvMsK3Gu1n1D4N4mjg.text: The best buffet on the strip, hands down. It's $22-ish for lunch but worth every penny. I'm not sure if they do it all the time, but they offered us an unlimited booze for $12 deal on top of lunch (beer, white wine, champagne and bloody marys included only). Probably the best booze deal on the strip if you stay there for a few hours like we did! Most of the food is delicious. Nobody leaves hungry. Arrive minutes before 11am to pay breakfast price but eat lunch!

zMcG7nubEXsBaJHuJZzpaw.text: Food was delicious and I love their desserts. I would recommend this buffet to anyone.  Love the fact that I can walk out of here with an ice cream cone with vanilla and chocolate swirl in one hand and strawberry cotton candy in the other!! Plus I got a coupon for 2 for 1 so it was only 20 bucks...

UvzdxJymJ_XorVi_HHYWtQ.text: I have experience much better service in a restroom. So upset with how we were treated and for no reason, we only wanted to sit and get something to drink. But that was even too difficult I guess. We had the 24 hour buffet pass, so we went to this one. Paid. Waited to get seated. Waited some more. Waited some more. I would say it was 15 minutes to wait to be seated, there was nobody seating people. Finally taken to a spot. We sat. We waited to get a drink. We waited some more. I told my friend to go get her food, I would wait and order the drinks. Waited some more. I had to flag someone down, then two servers argued about our table number and whose table it was. (Yes, ladies, everyone in the area heard you argue). Finally our server came, annoyed, and took our drink order. When she returned it was incorrect. *sigh* Reorder and wait. After that it I saw nobody interested to find out how we were doing, if we needed anything, or if we were alive. I do believe when the server arrived to clear the last of the plates I got a pleasant surprise of her rolling her eyes back when I spoke. Gosh, such love.  What was even more wonderful about surviving the cold looks from the staff was watching them ooze and gush over the older couple sitting ONE table away. They got red carpet treatment while we died of thirst. Not one server deserved a tip in that place for the service that they failed to give.  Food was decent. Nice selection for the price. No soup bowls for soup at either station. Boooooo. So if you eat soup on a plate or with your hands, your in business. Cupcakes looked great. They didn't taste great though. Just ok.

kzPPGszC63vJmGZFfDIufQ.text: We stood in line almost an hour to pay and be seated - not because there was a super-long line, but because these people don't give a tiny rat's butt about their potential customers.  During this hour, we dealt with a pissy, inconsiderate cashier with one of the most terrible attitudes I've ever encountered (Veronica, honey - you SUCK at customer service).  She stalled people, saying she couldn't check them out, then would send them to another register, only for folks to be turned away & come back.  Upon the hungry masses descending on her again, Veronica suddenly had to count change in her register.  When another lady showed at the next register and desperately starving people crowded around her, she loudly announced, "I'm NOT a cashier."  The service here is simply abhorrent prior to the meal.  Even the seating hostess we had the pleasure (displeasure??) of encountering couldn't deign to mumble a greeting. The actual food was alright.
