p2scQX2Pdb_ZEwMyQuadwQ.text: Okay people key word here "BUFFET" so can't go expecting to have 5 star service but if you want a bite to eat and you are in the mood for different things this was okay for me. It was not like the Rio but I was not trying to pay $50.00 bucks and stand in line for a couple of hours. It was Veterans day so I got a little lucky and was in about 30 minutes   I was tired and starving, so the food was good to me. I had my waffles and bacon and grits and a few other items and I was on my way. I will have to try them again at lunch or dinner so the review will not be a little biased. I say this because I had a major hangover:)

n5OP59QJvYdaraM6mT-TVQ.text: I went here during a busy holiday weekend, and the buffet was PACKED. There were two options to get into the buffet: wait in line and pay the normal price (which I did and ended up waiting for nearly an hour), or pay the express line price. Those who paid the express line price got to zip through the line, but they got the same food for a lot more money. I didn't think it was worth it.   The food itself was good, and this buffet had lots of options. However, the service was abysmal. You have to write your drink order on a card instead of telling the waitress. We didn't know that, and we waited a while for the waitress to arrive. Once she did, we didn't have our card ready so she just left. I ended up not getting my drink until I had finished my first plate. That sucked. Plus, we never got refills. This place was definitely NOT worth the cost.

6tnrzAaItstXxC3PAH7urw.text: honestly, this is an amazing buffet. you can get pretty much anything you want here and the food is amazingly delicious. Why could i not rate it at least 4 stars? At the start of my meal, there was a broken piece of glass in my food, which I didn't realize until it was in my mouth and I was about to swallow it. I kindly pointed it out to the service staff - who were very gracious in accommodating me and apologized. After realizing the glass was there, I just lost my appetite for the rest of the meal.  I don't demand free stuff much or am one of those people that cause a scene to get a free meal, but I did hope that the broken glass in my food (and in my mouth) would get me a refund on my meal. Unfortunately that was not offered. :-P Because of that incident I don't think I can bring myself to go back there again.

Bg2N4Rocv7uEiS7GkHollg.text: I would definitely check this off the list and not go back. Food was not enjoyable. There were 7 of us and it was our last stop from our 24 hour Vegas buffet pass. None of us finished our food and hardly went back for seconds.

7-1bRXYLhVPD-MPYrhuC6Q.text: Some friends of ours were eating lunch here that we hadn't seen in years.  We just wanted to come in to see them and maybe order a drink seeing as how we had already eaten, but they made us pay $74 for 2 people just to come in.  Like, literally harassed us for standing in their entry and said we had to pay to be there.  We tried to eat a little something since we had paid so much to be there, but everything was flavorless and not worth the effort.  The waitress also harassed the group every time someone ordered a drinks demanding to see our receipts.  Get a grip, you're an overpriced, mediocre at best buffet and we were all more than paid for.  Run!

G5JQJm2E9dlzt52Jc1nYRg.text: Still my favorite buffet in Vegas. I love the layout... easy to navigate and maneuver through. Great selection of seafood and cuisines. Prim Rib is always top when I've eaten here. They have an option of steamed or cold crab legs... I prefer cold. Desserts are a heavenly toothache. Recommendation: Buy the Buffet of Buffets all day pass and graze on buffets throughout the day sans stuffing your face. caesars.com/buffets/faq....

8T7wrqzAexCM2bzCnaF3Ww.text: First thing you notice when you get there, the line is super long during lunch/dinner time! And for good reason!  Because its the friggin best buffet in Vegas!  Awesome selection of different type of food from around the world. The quality of the food was top notch.  The food looked delicious. Everything I put in my mouth was YUMMY.   I dont really have a big stomach these days, but coming here, I really wish that I did! I want to EAT EVERYTHING HERE!  Bonus: Get the rewards card and buy your 24 hour buffet pass for about $43 something including tax! You can go to this buffet as well as other ones around the area like the World buffet at Rio(but why would you go anywhere else, I just said this place was the best).

Wv7_gSldsyyxaiAqVBfEZA.text: Came to the Spice Market Buffet for dinner using our buffet of buffets pass. Sadly it was not very good. There is a large variety of food types, but unfortunately most aren't worth trying. The Mexican station was the best, but even that wasn't great it was just far better than everything else!   On a positive note the line moved very fast and we waited for less than 10 minutes.  If you have the buffet of buffet pass save yourself the stomach space and go to the Paris buffet instead.

OeD9Y79gj8eurMPDVYEqkg.text: The lines here are quite deceiving for a first timer. Once you walk up and see a small line upstairs before the escalators, you'd think to yourself, "hell yeah! Short line means we can eat quicker!" think not.  As the line moved within 15 minutes upstairs, you get invited downstairs then we see the other giant line that we were not prepared for. So it was our fault for seeing the mirage upstairs. The new one was about 35 minutes until we were seated.  Food choices were pretty good and plentiful. Since I have only been to less than a handful of buffets in Vegas, I really did like the different sections from around the world. My favorite was the Mid-East section with all the juicy meat selections. The meat both lamb and beef were juicy but a tad rough on some pieces.   I'm down to come back here next time.

oRHy4H1cU0jMpjWyzmY8Xw.text: I went to enjoy the buffet voted best in Las Vegas! I was disappointed in the customer service. From the start the cashier lady was telling me I had to pay tax I asked why she said that she could show me and attempted to grab something from the trash can. I was very angry with that! The food was decent but not fresh. The best was the salmon and bow tie noodles. I did enjoy dessert the crepe chef was polite friendly and was honestly the only part I enjoyed of the establishment. We had all you can drink wine our server came back with two full glasses of watered down white wine. I can say I been but never again!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A bit of everything they had!! Salmon bow tie noodles, Mediterranean kebab lamb chicken and beef and some more I can&#39;t remember!
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My banana strawberry crepe!!

yrVGSO02Q0rb04EvOjfDeg.text: Excellent food! It was very loud, and service was mediocre. The prime rib was absolutely delicious!

U_C-MMTFIvDRD7xKuvQjDQ.text: Didn't find this buffet to be very good. The food was very bland, had no flavor to it at all (even though it was saucy). The service was crap. The wait was long. The seafood station was good- but that's it.  I really wouldn't recommend coming here - there are better buffets on the strip if that's what you're looking for.

O_SKNELVAVPH4AKKAZ4JXA.text: tip: only good thing going for them is cotton candy  not very refined.  use existing items and try to make a new dish is not really creative.  poor fruit selections, no cheesecake.  the stations were rehashed on both ends which is a big let down.   lamb kebobs look very tasty but was actually very tough.

wwEetJdWA-cSvVNt8C0qFQ.text: Very awesome buffet! At breakfast they mostly have eggs and muffins, but at lunch is when the good stuff arrives. They have a large variety of everything! Just dive in and see what you get yourself into. Best Buffet in Las Vegas for a very reasonable price!

mBiLjGmYkDjOQ1kAYoMbpw.text: Half the food on the buffet wasn't even good looking enough to pick up. What I did try to eat was bland. I would highly recommend trying other buffets, especially because the set up to get in where you pay in the middle of the line takes forever.

ro4AEs2QMTMSMrPJdYP-2Q.text: Do not! Do notttt.. Go in to this poorly structured and  blant Buffet.. Food is tasteless and blant, no good selection, full of carbs, bad quality food and really bad service!  I'll honestly advice to close or encourage to try harder!

IxS3tSJgKWDOJoWLnGSKEQ.text: The Good:  Great service Wonderful desserts Clean  The Bad:  Everything Else

Zd82XnA4XBh1kqaqeGPLtw.text: Food is ok, cannot really say it's all that great. You needed to try every dish that would be compatible with your taste buds so don't get too much food! You needed to bring your appetite and choose the right dishes for you to enjoy. Other than that, too pricey for a regular buffet.

bGgXFS8yFWDQ_irjfHc2hw.text: Of all the six buffets included in the Buffet of Buffets... the crab legs are the best at Spice Market Buffet. They're the biggest and easiest to eat. I love how they were cut in half so you don't have to waste time trying to open them yourself. The steamed crab legs were dry, but the cold ones were juicy and sweet. I also liked the shrimp & cocktail sauce and beef kebabs. I can't say much else about their food since I gorged myself on crabs and dessert.   I came here at 6:30 on a Wednesday, but the line wasn't too long.

zkjSpY5uCjm5v_J9Haiwsg.text: Almost as good as Google's free food with more options, way better than Old Country Buffet (actually, Old Country is not even in the same league), and way better than the buffets at the Hilton. Def worth it.  1. Good price. $18 for all you can eat. Plus if you stay at the resort, they give you a $5 off coupon (per room, good for four people).   2. So many options! Mediterranean bar. Mexican grill. Asian grill. Salad Bar. Italian bar. Dessert bar (so many cakes, breads, pastries, petit fours, tarts, pies, ice cream, etc). Omelet bar. Etc.  3. Great food and drink. The coffee was fantastic (this coming from a coffee drinking Seattleite). Rich. Full flavored. Strong. The oatmeal was sweet and creamy.  The eggs benedict was great. Fresh fruit. Loved it.

8K4C9OifthO1xs_Nonbqig.text: This so-called buffet is located downstairs in the Planet Hollywood Resort & Casino.  There was a long line, but the wait was only about 10-12 minutes. Ended up paying $27.99 since I had my player's card, but my friend ended up paying $30.00 since she didn't bring hers.  Anyway, I had a little bit of each cuisine, except the Mexican, since I accidentally spilled water all over it. Unfortunately, it would take me forever to nit-pick what was wrong with each dish, so I'm just going to be listing what I didn't like about each one here:  American:  Rag-out: mushrooms tasted like they were uncooked, sauce was flavorless Macaroni & cheese: it didn't taste like cheese, or pasta; plus the cheese was sort of clear(eww!)  Mediterraenean:  Naan with mango chutney: Okay. The mango was a little too sweet for my liking, but it wasn't terrible.  Seafood: king crab legs: these were going fast; not sure why though. They could have at least provided some melted butter so it wouldn't be so bland clams: tasted like mussels; though that's not necessarily a bad thing  Italian:  3 cheese lasagna: similar to the type of lasagna you'd get at Sbarro. A-ok.  I didn't have any of the salads, but my friends said they were good.   And now, for the desserts, which was the worst part of the meal:  Seafood: king crab legs: these were going fast;  clams: tasted like mussels; though that's not necessarily a bad thing  carrot cake: basically, they baked carrots into rye bread. flan: weird, because the sauce was good, but flan itself was like flavorless jello.  strawberry cheesecake: okay, so they decided not put any sugar in it. Oh, and they substituted some crumbly feta cheese for the cream cheese. Awful, just awful. creme brulee: the top wasn't even glazed over and crunchy; you're supposed to crack the top of a creme brulee to eat it. The inside tasted very eggy, and the texture was just like pudding. lemon meringue tart: Guess they decided to save money and just use the same filling for the creme brulee and the lemon meringues.   Hands down the worst dining experience I have ever had in my life. Though I didn't try much of the Mediterranean cuisine, my friends said that and the salads were the only tasty parts of their meal. The only thing I liked about eating here was that they had cotton candy.

CDA--OMWtjOOlT7XMw4hbw.text: This buffet is ok! I went for the steak and mashed potato. They were pretty good. And then you have 2 options for the crab legs: hot or cold. Awesome! I am somewhat disappointed with the desert because there is not that much variety. They have a lot of cupcakes. I think a child will find that exciting. If it was as good as a Sprinkles cupcake, then great! Cupcake all you can it is! But it isn't. =( I gave it a four star because they serve steamed crab legs which not all buffet in Vegas do anymore.

iyacEipsJGVsB_VxDpM5RA.text: Pretty disappointed. Although this place brought back found memories of my elementary school cafeteria... It was a far cry from the expectation set by Bellagio and Ceasars.  Save yourself the cash and play it on black. This place had great service, with cold, mediocre food at best.

JFnV0aROsGbuqCSj_YAgjw.text: Ehhhh I'd go somewhere else. Food was not good. Choices were not a lot. Line was short, but its a weekday so I'm not sure I can even count that. They have 2 soup choices and both were bland. There were like 2 or 3 different sushi choices. Food presentation was awful. So disappointed. Went with 2 friends who have been here before and said it use to be a lot better. Not worth the money. Rio buffet is way better for the same $. But if you really want a great Vegas buffet... Try bacchanal at Caesars.

f92K_f4F6vB-aqIJx36YRQ.text: I've been living on Vegas for ten years now and have been to most buffets so far. This one was a bug let down. Most of the food was very dry and the selections wasn't as great as you would expect after waiting and hour and a half in line because of some kind of special.   The service was very slow, I really had to flag someone down just to get my drink refilled. The desert selection wasn't great as well and the banana foster was made very poorly. However the one redeeming feature they did have was that they can custom make crepes with a wide veriety of toppings.   Overall I wouldn't go here when there are so many better places to eat in Vegas and better buffets.

VTmZ6X57Gft7-0dBu-LkPw.text: Touted as the best buffet in Las Vegas.   It is far, far from that!  The cashier could not have been any ruder or nasty.  She barked where we had to stand after paying for the buffet to be seated.  The food we mediocre at best.  The array of food was intriguing but the majority of the stations felt as if the food was there for a long time.  The fried rice and sliders had no taste.  Service was slow and agonizing while we waited to be served our drinks.  It felt to us as if the wait staff was severely understaffed.  There are much better buffet in Las Vegas and I highly recommend that you skip this one .  The Buffet at Ceasar's is outstanding .

UbAMxK4Wifb4AofWAUBY0A.text: Expensive and not very good! We were on the brink between brunch and dinner. Food was cold and had kind of gone dead. Seasonings were out of control. I got sick post and probably ate about 4$ worth of the 60$ we paid. They EMT's were carrying a guy out on a stretcher as we arrived! Should have smelled what the Rock was cooking right then! Oh well, Panda Express would have been a better choice!

w1nnqYiFSwGJvokLm_nLdw.text: The food looks good but it's pretty gross. In some cases it's flat out disgusting, in others it lacked seasoning.

gAlcO0ankz5eMVQpkm5Mvg.text: Avoid this place!!!! We got the 24 hour 5 buffet deal, this was the last buffet we hit and was a complete let down, it stinks,all the food was overcooked  and unappetizing, the bathrooms were unkept, my whole family felt sick the rest of the evening, never going here again!!! I have 3 boys and the can eat!!! but they weren't fans either

uexeY1KAhYVX72do_u5c3Q.text: Selection wasn't that great and the space did not seem to be very clean. Found out that there was an opportunity for a 24 hour buffet pass at multiple locations and so we were able to purchase that however The other locations were not convenient and they weren't open during the times that we needed (Flamingo only open for dinner on Friday and Saturday). Stick with the buffet at Aria if you have to eat a buffet.

bCwg4OTp2O0mTolkku2HPQ.text: A nice variety of foods that are categorized by cuisine. However, I only found the shrimp and rack of lamb to be appetizing and tasty.   Other notable items they have:  Crab legs - already split in half for you and you can eat your money's worth here if you're a big crab person.   Prime rib - somewhat on the dry side   Wide selection of cupcakes - a person with a sweet tooth would love their selection of desserts  Kabobs - they have several and I tried the lamb kabob. Unfortunately, that was also dry.   As I'm not in Vegas all that often, I'll probably try another buffet next time.

xC42U3vxjw6jDF8yokG50g.text: Yum, Yum, Yum!  My boyfriend and I went here during our Summer Vacation and purchased the 24 hour buffet pass. We went here and then to the Paris buffet for breakfast.  The pro's: - food from every ethnicity - crab leg's pre-cracked - makes eating tons of them easy! - all food is delicious - attentive staff  The con's: - can have a long line - expensive if you haven't purchased the 24-hour pass - easy to over eat.... IF you consider that a con. =P  Will definitely make this a Vegas tradition.

eC1FW1R-NhZvndlvyFXXog.text: The only thing I like about this place is that they split the crab legs in half for you already so all you have to do is eat it. I get buffet of buffet passes ($50) just to eat unlimited crab and this saves so much time on not having to crack them open.  They have different stations for different foods like Mediterranean, Italian, Mexican, Salad bar and stuff, but a lot of things I tried were pretty bland or dry. Service is not that great here...slow...but you kind of expect that at a buffet anyways. They have a good dessert layout though, and cotton candy! Boyfriend and I took 7 large cotton candies on the way up to the casino :]

ISc0A6uQhYfxkgAPH4StAA.text: After reading other reviews I as wary of this buffet.  I headed straight to Mediterranean and enjoyed flavorful chicken curry; dolmas and tabouli. Next up seafood for a light seafood salad, peel n eat shrimp, & chilled snow crab. The tomato basil soup gets good marks. I was surprised to see heart of palms and marinated artichoke salad. The Italian sausage was tasty. I had just enough room for my yummy bread pudding.

-83ys0S-Eo_yubtmMsyDnQ.text: Not the best buffet in Vegas but its cheap and it good. They are open late so that is a plus.

1Oa1gvXxC4rQ2uYFNAQMVA.text: There is something for everyone here.  The selection is enormous and mesmerizing.  There's so much food that it actually takes a while to walk from one end to the other.  Be sure to look for all the food stalls because you might miss it if you don't keep walking.  If you're a fan of king crab legs, this place is great because they cut the legs in half making it much easier to eat.  The shrimp tempura, one of my favorites, is perfectly crunchy, and if you like sushi, there's a good selection of rolls that aren't overstuffed with rice.  The fresh shrimp was a good size and perfect for dipping into cocktail sauce.  Like most buffets, there's the usual Mexican, Japanese, Italian, and Chinese areas, but also a Middle Eastern section.  Mmm.  Plenty of meat here if you like kabob, lamb and hummus.  The carving station also serves prime rib, turkey, and a bunch of other seasoned meats.  There's plenty of seafood like salmon and white fish, but there's also a wide variety of vegetables for the non-carnivorous.  There's also dedicated section for salad and another one for fruit.  There's a huge selection of desserts and they make crepes to order!  Kids will love the cotton candy maker.   All the food is clean, fresh, perfectly labeled and nicely segmented.  This place will have all the food you'd expect to find at a buffet and so much more that it truly raises the bar.  If you're a VIP, even better. You'll get to skip the wait to get a table and be seated in a private section that is even closer to all the good stuff.    Definitely one of the best buffets in Vegas!

-pgHoXlXvVS98myyzLD29A.text: I'm not really a buffet person, so just let me preface my review with that.  I didn't really find much here I liked. The seafood seemed to be pretty popular but I'm not a seafood person. The mexican section was pretty sparse when I went up there but when my wife went she seemed to find more than i did. Just my luck :)  I think I ate a few slices of microwave pizza and some breadsticks. The mashed potatos were pretty runny but they tasted all right.   Ambience-wise, the place was pretty loud and filled with drunk people. Dinner was pretty pricey at $30/person

NFy-zHxHqHKDB3afYI_KVA.text: We went here for breakfast one morning, having heard great reviews from friends.  There were various stations representing different cuisines (Italian, Asian, etc).  We both found a number of items we liked, piling our plates full.  I think there was almost too much to choose from, wish my stomach was bigger, haha!  They cleaned our plates from our table and filled up our coffee promptly.  Service was good.   I'd go back here again, was a decent price and had lots of variety.

Cf7EgflcQvhQD3E7y39ZvQ.text: The buffet is just ok. I may not go during my next visit, but don't regret going either.

0r26bP5Rfhj4T1h2odo-5g.text: G_R_O_S_S Yes, there was a big selection. Yes, it was international. Yes, you could pig out as much as you wanted. No. it really isn't cheap. I was hungover after a big night out on the town and needed good food.  This place didn't fit the bill.  AT ALL.  Best Buffet in town is the claim.  Don't buy it!

zJe-wM3noRpZruBTrhB1hg.text: We were originally supposed to eat at the buffet at bellagio but when we found out it was gonna be $45, we headed here instead.. I was totally BUFFADED after eating here. If you walk around in front of planet hollywood or across the street you'll probably find guys standing around handing out 10% off coupons for spice market. We were planning to eat here anyway and we just happened to pass by the guy on our way there so we swooped on some coupons to get our 10% off! I think we paid about $35 for the dinner.. thats including automatic gratuity because i was with a group of 10.  They have all sorts of stations of food, most of which was pretty good. The dessert station is pretty awesome. They have cotton candy and they make dessert crepes. Yummm!!! Even though I went into food coma after, I enjoyed it here =)

ihWmNnY13EWRStU_QCI0SA.text: Carnival Buffet at Rio got three stars from me, this one is receiving 2 stars.  the set up of the buffet, downstairs with a max cap of 1200 is awesome but the food was not that great.  $20ppl (that's with a 10% coupon) too was a little steep.  there is not a big selection of food.  and this is from comparing it to the Rio's buffet. it seems like they consolidated their buffet as the right end of it had nothing there on a saturday afternoon. it was OK but i rather pay for additional cab fare to go to the Bellagio or Rio for their buffet.

SgwjrnTGTn2txHFpz6YH1Q.text: In comparison to the other Las Vegas Strip buffets this one rates the lowest from my previous experience. While we were seated right away, and the service was good the food was not. There was a variety of options but the food itself was sub par. The prime rib slices were small, crepes premade, pizza tasted like cardboard and seafood did not have a huge variety. Additionally we went for Easter where they had colored hard boiled eggs near all the food pastry items, however the manager later came by to say they were only for display, but we had already eaten them. My suggestion would have been 1. Move the eggs to the back counter so they are a colorful decoration display 2. Place a sign "not for consumption" 3. Take them off the counters completely. We spent the rest of the meal worried the eggs we had just eaten were going to make us sick which was not worth the experience. Will not be visiting this buffet again

O1QcovF2sCTKqIW6EWCfFw.text: Not a bad buffet in Vegas for the price.  Wait can be kind of long. If you have a party of 8 or more, there is also an 18% service charge. Also, if you have a big group and do not want to pay the charge, and split up the payment receipt, you will probably not get to sit together.  Our group tried and failed.   Experience here has been good every time. Food is fresh and there are a lot of options: carving station, American food, Italian, Mexican, Middle Easter, Chinese, and even Seafood.    They have lamb sometimes for dinner. Dinner food is usually a little better, especially with the king crab legs. The Sunday champagne brunch is awesome. You get unlimited mimosa and bloody Mary's with the brunch.  The servers are very good with filling your cup. I even got mine topped off as I was leaving. Awesome!   Overall, food is good and fresh. Definitely a good go to buffet in Vegas.

9p6A4Fltrcu0AtGJfBE68g.text: The variety of food is prety good. I think their theme was any country in which spice played a prominent role. So you had Chinese, Indian, Middle Eastern, Japanese and Mexican. But then again I could be talking out of my ear. It is definitely one of the bigger buffet places in Vegas. I arrived for Lunch on a Tuesday in November 2011. The line did not take too long, since there was plenty of seating. It is priced at the standard Harrah's properties rate. 18.98 plus tax. The one thing I liked was the Noodle bar. You can pick and choose anything from fishballs, to shrimp, to fish cake for your noodles

QihC_UB3j-ib3w-eUreP1g.text: What happened =*( ?  My family and I used to LOVE coming to this buffet!  I recently took my brother and his family to this place, and the food was just alright....ugh.  So upsetting.  I was quite embarrassed.  Hubby and I bragged and bragged about the food here.  I guess I can say though, that I would return.  I think maybe we just caught them on an off day.  I don't know.  Maybe we just hyped it up so much that it messed up our experience.    Although I didn't enjoy the food this time around, the desserts were as great as I remembered them.   I don't think your sweet tooth will be sorry.  If you haven't already tried them out, I think it's worth a try.  Like I said, I'd still eat at this buffet.

CVLBQzJpWzMTvcqbB62fQg.text: I've eaten at this buffet when it was still the Aladdin and I remember it was awesome back then.  When it changed to Planet Hollywood, I ate here for a family reunion dinner and it was decent, it was better back then.  So, we tried it out once more during our most recent adventure to Vegas.  First off, $27.99 per adult for dinner, on a Monday?  That's Redonkulous with a capital "R."  Thankfully, I'm not complaining much because I got a BOGO coupon so technically, for the s/o and I, it was only $14 each.  The buffet offerings were just okay.  Sure, they had crab salad and shrimp cocktail served in martini glasses but don't be fooled by it, it's not better quality, it's called perception.  They also had the usual Asian, Italian, American, Mediterranean and Seafood fare.  BTW, is it just me or do my fellow Asians act like savages when it comes to Crab Legs?  It's not like it's going to run out people, there's more where it came from, geez!  The salad bar, which was separated in opposite ends of the buffet had to be the sorriest salad bar I've ever experienced, even my hometown pizza parlor offers more salad toppings than this buffet!  But in the end, how can you be mad when they serve up fresh Cotton Candy?  Thankfully they put it high enough so the kiddies don't snatch it all up or get their cooties all over them. :)  Overall, if I had paid full price, The Spice Market Buffet would've gotten 2-stars, no doubt.  But since I didn't, in my opinion, it was worth 3-stars.  PS - Want a BOGO coupon too?  Just check in to Planet Hollywood on FourSquare, show your phone to the Rewards desk located near the bar and they'll give you your coupon.  Not sure how long this promo will last though.

MzDt_eCYAROpzUyxDxdJpw.text: I recently went to this buffet and enjoyed the food, however waiting in line to get this food was long. They had only one person at the front counter. Myself along with the rest of the customers couldn't believe we waited over 25 min in line. This wasn't even a busy part of the day. It was after 5 pm before a show we had to be at by 7pm. I couldn't even enjoy all the food because I had to rush and leave to get to my show in time. Would I recommend this buffet for future visits, sure just make sure you're not in a hurry, because most of your experience about the place will be standing in line .

z5RD5Nl-8FM9v9sWC2uSZg.text: Food: Okay. Definitely didn't seem like the best buffet in Vegas! They had a nice selection of food though(Asian, Italian, Mediterranean, Salads,etc) but there wasn't much taste to the food. I did enjoy the nice selection of desserts but I didn't care too much for the variety of items I had on my plate (Italian Meatballs, Beef enchiladas, pizza...) The Kung pao chicken, lettuce cups, and fried chicken were not bad.  Price: I found a coupon in a Vegas mag for a 2 for 1 lunch so we ended up paying around $17 for 2 people. I wouldn't want to pay more than that to eat here.  Location: Located in Planet Hollywood downstairs (you take an escalator down to the buffet).  Service: Staff was friendly here.

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert platter:Chocolate mousse cake, Rasberry mousse, cookie
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Platter 2: Beef enchilada, meatball, beans and rice
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Platter 1: Chicken Corn soup, fried chicken, kung pao chicken, lettuce cup, fried rice

4igc4vbfaXeFmrXt-ADtag.text: Great buffet, I went in for lunch. Wasn't busy around 11am. They had seafood, Asian, American, mediterean, salad bar etc....my favorite was the American, with Ham, Roast Beef, and Turkey. The dessert is fabulous. Also had great service. Would love to go back.

BXbVUms8NQn2r5nRruFq2A.text: Aladdin has been converted to planet hollywood (ph) and the whole place is all hip and trendy now.  Way cool.  Noted the banner proclaiming that their buffet was voted as the number 1 buffet in Vegas in 2007.  Well, I can't say if it's the best since I haven't tried them all, but I actually did like this better than the Bellagio Buffet (which I just had the night before).    Weekday adult buffet price is very reasonable at $16.99.  Many different types of cuisines can be sampled here, including seafood, Asian, American, Italian, Middle Eastern, and Mexican.  My favorites were the tri-tip, BBQ ribs, smoked salmon, and apple pie.    Bottom line:  You gotta try this place.  One bonus...it's cheaper than the buffets at Wynn and Bellagio.

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

R5ecPVIeRXz4u74H8nDo8Q.text: We ate here the other night on free passes given to us for the last time we ate here and it was horrible. Food was poor quality and our server never stopped by after bringing us our beverages. With all the buffet options in Vegas this one should be off your list. Honestly had we paid this time I would've requested a refund.

AXreeKm52IUmI6bDcOQ8dg.text: felt like eating in the refugee camp. $35 for the low end food is not worthy. They asked for extra $20/ea for express line which actually slows down the regular line. Do want to give yourself a break before you step in. Aria has much better buffet than this one.  I give 1 star because there's no zero star is available.

Hu9QYVTSHyPYV2MOE3VCgA.text: Not a single server great us! I have to get up and ask the hostess for our drinks! Until the end no server come by!oh! Yes don't go here!!

jVbKXghPIudb32Adt-30iw.text: This one star is for our server she was so nice and took really good care of us.  This place was not worth the money. You can find much more reasonable buffets with better food. Food was cold appeared to have been sitting out for a while because some of it was dried out.  We even asked to speak to the manager to voice out concerns. He was pleasant but absolutely useless. He never checked the food on the buffet and never did anything about our concerns. I had been there a few years ago and it was much better. My advice to anyone reading this is too go someplace else.  Not worth the price at all.  Vegas has too many other options so don't waste you time or money at this place.

1C4kQNfXSAUFiiVTEqiUwA.text: I loved this place. We came across this place while walking the strip. A promoter gave us a wrist band to the club but we ended up going to the buffet instead. The food was amazing. The crab legs were to die for. Our servers were top notch & were constantly visiting our group making sure we had refills & more crab legs. The dessert was soooo good. They have everything you can imagine. I will be back!

_DK8maNibjmqHrRxIEVy8A.text: Stood in line for about an hour after a long nights drive and morning on the strip, I was STARVING! We waited upstairs and were let onto the escalator where I thought we were to be seated, but NOPE! There was about another two hour long waiting line downstairs! I immediately left very hungry and pissed off and could tell the others in line were just as mad as I was. P.S. the service is lousy. The guy letting people downstairs was a jerkoff. Went to CaboWabo instead.

w6-WCiMjSTfvxNLSn2_Irw.text: Basic.   Ate dinner here because we got buy one, get one free vouchers from a friend so we took advantage. We definitely wouldn't pay full price [$40 per person...add $12 for alcoholic beverages] for this buffet.   Nothing really made me say "oh wow!". I did like that they had a Mediterranean section because i looooove hummus, curry chicken, and other foods of the Mediterranean persuasion. I spent much of my time in that portion of the buffet trying out whatever they had. Not bad. Another plus was that the Mexican section had the bomb ass Mexican corn. Tore that up.  The dessert section was a major disappointment. Where's the cookies?! I love cupcakes & was super excited to see the variety, but they all tasted the same even though they were supposedly all these different fancy flavors. Boo. Ice cream machine kept breaking down so I couldn't get my kiddos the ice cream I kept promising them if they ate the food.   Decent food, decent service, nice restaurant...loved the different movies posters hanging throughout the place. I'll come back if I get that voucher again...

I4SHU7u46Myy-AVTqLxGnw.text: There's a really nice selection and everything is categorized by dish.  We used a 2-for-1 that we won at our hotel which brought our bill to about $30 which was nice for a buffet. The waitress bringing us our drinks was very attentive and ensured out table was cleared of plates when we'd get up for more.  Overall good food.  Good atmosphere Friendly staff

nlacTQ09IfJyelzeLC4PLQ.text: This is not the buffet to choose when you are in Vegas.  This place is too expensive and the quality of food is not on the same level as most major casino buffets.  The only thing that was decent about the buffet was the desserts, especially their cupcakes.  The only reason we went here is they had two-for-one Groupon deals and they gave us unlimited alcoholic drinks.    We were surprised that if you go with a group of eight or more you have to pay an 18% gratuity fee.  I wouldn't be surprised if this was a sit down restaurant, but a buffet, that is crap.  The service was surprisingly very good (it better be for 18% gratuity) and our waitress was very nice.  They kept our mimosas filled and full beers on the table.  The food here was not the best, but not the worst.  I tried just about everything there but could find anything I really enjoyed.  They had  all sorts of different ethnic stations with a good variety of food, but none of it stood out as being delicious.  Just one step up from cafeteria food. I was told the mac n cheese was very good and so was the prime rib. They finally brought the crab legs out around 3 pm, but were still mostly frozen and they didn't have anyone to warm them up so you had to eat them cold.    If you are trying to save some money and find the Groupon deal then this is a great place, other than that don't waste your money on this buffet.  There is a lot better and cheaper ones around.

LYbC2i2dcwKAp4XzuLxNiw.text: Mediocre. Everything was bland, nothing seemed very fresh. The prime rib was pretty darn good, but everything else was extremely sub par. We decided to give it a try despite some of the bad reviews, and unfortunately.... In our case the reviews were right. Our server remy was awesome though. She always made sure our mimosas were full and our water as well and she was extremely friendly and courteous.

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2deMcVGYqFdZ4xeR-CCoYA.text: A group of 6 of us came here for the buffet of buffets over the thanksgiving holiday. The lady cashier was extremely rude. She demanded things from me, never said please with any of her requests, and when I paid her $500, she didn't even bother to thank us. I thanked her 6-8 times over the course of our transaction and she never said "you're welcome". One of the most ridiculous customer service experiences I've ever had!

HA8cGCv6Hslg2MtnAOwW2Q.text: One of our favorite buffet spots! Everyone in our party was satisfied with the food and that's the case every time. Lots of variety and there wasn't anything we thought was unacceptable. I see many negative reviews, but I can't say I agree. I mean, if you compare it to the bigger, badder, newer buffets then yes, it seems this buffet is lacking a little in quantity, but I'm not comparing. I go for quality and freshness of food.   They have food from around the world... Seafood, Italian, Asian, Mid-Eastern, All-American, Mexican, and a dessert station with made-to-order crepes. Some main attractions for us were the fresh crab legs, cocktail shrimp, lamb kebabs, tandoori chicken, and some strawberry blueberry cream yogurt fruit salad thing (the name has obviously slipped my mind at the moment). This buffet is also part of the 24-hour buffet deal which we did last time. We didn't do it this time because our whole schedule was centered around eating and it was a bit stressful. So this time we just ate here and it was worth it!

P-T9nwQNy-1xxb9_8t1zpQ.text: Really bad food, got the buffet of buffet which was great, didn't pay full price here, but for anyone wondering if they should I would have to recommend you do not, most people say tasteless, I can taste the cardboard in the baklava, the hummus is like a paste with no taste, the coffee is a dark water, the desserts were bland and the underground spot for the restaurants helps keep the stink in. I am from LA and Hollywood food is nothing like that!

6VXbV90evYeNb4pshUYM-A.text: I hate to be that girl, but it never hurts to check Groupon/Livingsocial before you go anywhere because it is possible that you will find a deal! We ended up paying about $23 a person before tax to eat here and that is with "unlimited drinks" included. I put that in quotes because let's be real, how do you unlimited drinks when there's unlimited food--it just won't all fit.  Things to eat - Mediterranean station (I actually liked everything I ate here! Esp the lamb and grilled zucchini!!), thai eggplant at the Asian station, Buffalo popcorn shrimp at the seafood station, mac&cheese and the roasted chicken at the American station.  Things not to eat - sushi (this freaked me out bc there were like 3 types tossed in a bin together...), most of the pastas (blah taste, not worth the carbs), anything at the asian station (ie the calamari), or ANY OF THE WINES. I'm pretty sure the all you can drink wine was franzia or something similar, and you will feel a hangover coming on as you drink it.   Our waitress was a bit slow and didn't understand what "the latter" meant, but other than that was super lovely. Points to her for pouring all of our drinks into large water glasses instead of dainty wine glasses because she wanted to provide us more drinks faster. Also for giving up on the one alcoholic drink per person at a time rule.

jVSkKNI8akU4jcYjw0xmZg.text: Don't eat here. Not that much selection, the food was not good, and we both felt weird after eating our meal. Don't recommend this buffet, there are much better ones on the strip.

RrBQ74LS_s1xDXZhaqQXIQ.text: WORST EXPERIENCE. DONT GO HERE. Terrible service. Food lousy and cold. Bad selection. Empty food bins. Over priced. Got better meal in circus circus cafe for a fraction of the price.

XtTls_7AJ6slIHa98djUwg.text: There was no line but it took us super long to be seated &/or greeted. There was not a single food item that amazed my taste buds but the food was edible and decent. I enjoy Las Vegas buffet for their deserts, mostly creme brulee. I would return for the creme brulee

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desert for days

v8ROIai5diXmeMNNSJGGUQ.text: One of my favorite buffets in Vegas. The Buffett is divided up by cuisine. A lot of variety and good choice selection. Great dessert bar. Well worth the trip over to Planet Hollywood.

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All sorts of desserts!

w6RhLktHOcJhE4Ze0IO-IQ.text: We were in vegas for a friend's dirty 30.  We all hit this up for a quick meal and we had the all you can eat/drink Groupon.  Overall service was great our server kept the beer coming, he was refilling the wine for the ladies and decided to leave the rest of the bottle for us, which was great. No to go cups but you were more than welcome to take the bottle and glasses with you.  On the food side, most items were barely warm.  Crab legs are sliced down the center which is amazing but served chilled, they will only steam them for VIP members of the hotel, really this takes 60 sec? Plus I would tip the server more.  Sushi is sketchy, mid eastern food was good, Mexican was lacking, American was basically potatoes, Italian was edible.

ApDUaSi9hlaqrXWd2FmYtQ.text: An average buffet that has something for everyone.  Decor is just normal, nothing special but the food varieties are what sold us.  We also had a Travelzoo coupon for got 2 buffets for $49.00 CDN which was a great bargain.  They have Italian, Asian, American, salads, all the usual buffet fare.  The desserts are a little above average for a buffet and we enjoyed that.  They do have an unlimited bar and beverage deal which we declined but they had ample choices of non-alcoholic drinks included.  We were happy to find that they had skim milk which is a rarity at a buffet.  This is a good choice if you are attending a concert at Planet Hollywood.  The seating was fast and we were in and out in plenty of time to catch the Lionel Ritchie concert at 8 p.m.

gBTg668DZUkmfEtahwu1Cg.text: My girlfriends and I came here for the Buffet of Buffet and was excited to see the sign saying "voted for the best buffet in Vegas".    This place has only two good things: Crab legs and desserts.  Unfortunately crab legs were cold...I like them somewhat warm you know.  However they tasted fresh and I liked how they cut the legs in half so that it would be easier to eat.  The desserts were good, though a lot of them were the same stuff that we saw at Le Village at the Paris.    The Asian sections was absolutely horrifying.  Everything was disgusting.  Our waitress was very nice and attentive.  Overall it was just an okay buffet.  I kept eating just crab legs to get my money worth.  This place certainly does not deserve the best buffet in Vegas award.

K0IiEg6VazfdtpSYNyDdog.text: I may have given another star had it not been for the place being so crammed together. I think they could use to lose a few tables and open up the dining area, also PLEASE pull your tables away from the area where people are walking to get to the buffet. I've never been seated so closely to the actual food. My table was basically IN the dessert section.  As for the food - there's a lot of selection and numerous "stations" with different ethnic foods to choose from.  I sampled mainly from the seafood; got crab legs, peel n eat shrimp, some buffalo popcorn shrimp (yum!), some sushi (dry, yuck). Tried some food from the Mediterranean section. Hummus, dates, lamb, naan bread, olives, etc. Okay, but not great, I've had better Greek food elsewhere.  Mexican, American, and meat carving areas did not interest me, although my Father-In-Law got a nice looking piece of prime rib. My husband also got some fried chicken that he said was quite tasty.  Desserts - Mainly their dessert section is cupcakes, although I did manage to find some pretty decent cannolis. The cupcake I had was OK, but kind of dry. I honestly don't even remember which kind it was now, but if you have a thing for cupcakes you will love this place.  Overall - not bad. Of course, my Father-In-Law paid the bill so I can't complain. But would I throw down money here myself? Probably not. I'd go to another buffet around town.  .

igsWOagjUiHWal5I1-6wag.text: First and last time here. We walk up to a cashier that looks like she doesn't want to be there.  She ask if we been here before we said no it's our first time. She took our money gave our receipt and help the next person.  We found a table big enough for our party of 5. A waiter approaches our table and really rude yell at me about setting ourselves.  I was so confused. He told me that we had to see the hostess. We told him the only person that was up front is the cashier and she didn't say anything about a hostess. I walk up found the hostess. I explain to her what just happen.  She was the nicest one there.  To sum it up. Bad services! Food wasn't worth the money.  The only thing that was decent was the prime roast. Not even the dessert bar was worth it. Beyond disappointed.  My family and I felt like it was a waste of money.

Acz03DBR-y4nIJwu3PLolQ.text: Pretty good buffet. Mashed potatoes were real and not watery. Prime rib was tasty. Lots of dessert options as well.   I also tried their breakfast buffet and no complaints.

yw2kaD4HpJwxu0dWPEuqzg.text: This has to be the worst food! If you're not on vip your crab legs will only be cold. How rude to not allow all customers to steam their crab legs

XRw6W4hUdeRItwc2z7YTuA.text: Most of the food is ok. The cooking staff are unprofessional. Watched chef use tongs to pick up garbage from floor than put it in his gloved hand and use that same hand with garbage to re stack plates. Found a finger nail in oatmeal, but manager said oh he doesn't think someone would be cutting their nails over the oatmeal. Really that's your answer! Cafe is closed for remodel but I would pass on this buffet.

Zox1yPzlF815wsLErnhpdA.text: The absolute best of Buffets I've seen. Got a great deal thru Travelzoo. Check all Las Vegas restaurant coupons. But food was OUTSTANDING. Staff was nice n friendly. All good stations were kept up full w food n CLEAN.  Thank you.  #honeymoonstatus

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House salad.
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yo boys plate. Perfection.
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A hodgepodge of salad fare.

KfxaiaXQr0RJ8U_83pJQBA.text: The Spice Market Buffet has really went down as far as cleanliness and quality of food. Food is not rotated and is sitting for long period of time. The taste of the food is no longer up to the reputation this buffet is known for.  We were sitting close to the Asian food area and noticed the server tending to this station was not rotating the food and simply dumping the new food into the old food containers.   We also noticed the cleanliness in the area was terrible. We observed the person attending this Asian food are using deterrent rags to wipe down the areas and using the same rags to wipe down the spoons that were used to serve the food. We noticed this after we already ate something from this station and hoped we did not get sick from the food. We also noticed the person used something paper like sprayed with oil and held it up to the warming light of the food to create a flame in which he used to light the grill behind him. This was dangerous and absurd!   We took a survey from PH and mentioned our concerns and requested to be contacted and never heard back from them. This goes to show you they truly don't care about this buffet anymore.   The quality of the food served hear for a weekend brunch time period was terrible. The Spice Market Buffet used to be our favorite buffet in Vegas, but we will never come back. Stay far away!

1R7ENChOAKl8fyw7VccgLA.text: Spice Market was way more solid than I expected it to be. Even though I had a good referral from a trusted friend, the scene when I escalated downstairs looked pretty ho-hum, with standard large Strip buffet offerings. Any buffet can get you pregnant, but after a one-hour wait, I demanded that Spice Market pay for my food child's upbringing as well.   I immediately attacked the crab legs, great start, not quite as good as Wynn. Next the prime rib, best buffet prime rib I've had, period. The Middle Eastern section was terrible - tasteless hummus and dry kabobs. Honey hot wings were nicely crunchy, Italian homemade meatballs good, then back for more crab legs. Salad/fruit/cheese offerings for palate cleanse, all fresh. Creme brulee delectable, bread pudding less so.   Our waiter took awhile to get to us initially, but he was very attentive, which was great since we had unlimited booze on our $25/pp Travelzoo deal. If we didn't have to wait an hour, which I know isn't unusual for good buffets, I'd have left happier, but if you want to buffet, don't mind the wait, and you get a deal, it really is solid. The only thing better about my favorite, Wynn, is the environment, but is that worth $20 more?

X_a7hxchBEt6fWHg4GyXJg.text: Customer Service:  My husband and I have been waiting to be seated for the last fifteen minutes. While it has come to my attention that VIP guests get seated first -- even if they are standing behind you in line -- there is no explanation of this offered. You are simply standing in line...waiting...while random patrons are told to bypass you and provided with a table. This is while several employees stand milling around, trying to accommodate priority guests.  Food:  This buffet boasts a modest selection of food choices for lunch:  Salad, Mexican, Soup, Middle Eastern and Desserts. I tried a kale salad, which was a mix of greens, olives, tomatoes, red onions and feta cheese. Not bad at all. From the "Mexican" selection, I chose a cheese quesadilla, which I figured would be relatively safe; wrong. The cheese inside was charred and made it difficult to cut with a knife and fork. From the "Middle Eastern" selection, I chose the rice pilaf and roast turkey. Sidenote: there was a father in line ahead of me with his young daughter. She decided she did not like the cut of turkey that have been provided to her and so her dad requested another slice. The chef then took the slice that was originally provided to her OFF OF HER PLATE and put it back on the carving board. He attempted to provide it to me, and I promptly refused it. I am not a Health Inspector, but once something is put on someone's plate, it shouldn't be taken back, no? Turkey was moist and flavorful, though.

XyskWKZUMHzOj2lyO0Klcg.text: I guess my biggest mistake was buying the Buffet of Buffets pass. Stayed at the Planet Hollywood for the first time so that I can walk around the strip instead of taking my car to everywhere I go. I guess it was really convenientonly because of where this hotel was situated. Rooms were pretty crappy too and so was the buffet.  Spice market buffet? Please stay away. I dont know exactly how much they charge for dinner but probably around less or more than $30 for sure. So not worth your money. All the selections they had out was just so horrible. This is probably worst buffet I have ever been to including the local buffets in town, for instance, Chinese buffets.  Crab legs they had, had no flavor whatsoever. It was hard to eat as well. Most of the food selections were all americanized or just american food even though it says it is Italian and Asian. Why do they even need to have different sections because its unnecessary.  Prime rib was dry and stiff as ever. The mussels and clams I had was so dry that it was so chewy I couldnt even eat them. Not to mention, the lady server was pretty rude as well. I asked for extra silverware and she just gave me this nonchalant look and walked away without saying anything and came back when? like 1000000 minutes later. I did not want to leave tips at all. Only thing that was good here was my iced tea. That's it. No kidding.  Anyway, to make things short, you wont get your money's worth here at all. Please stay away. Just dont even bother to buy the Buffet of Buffets pass. Just pay one time fee to the Bacchanal buffet. They are probably the best buffet in the vegas and you wont be  sorry.

5Z2NnbplYDjOupHv5ZNWNQ.text: I'm at the buffet right now. The service is really slow and the food isn't good at all. The food doesn't look good nor taste good. The only thing was kinda satisfying was the desserts. The food has permanently scarred my taste buds. Every time I went to go get food I questioned if the food would be good or not. If u think about coming here, DONT DO IT!!! It's a trap! Most of the food was dry and if it wasn't dry it was too runny. All the meats were dry. And the noodles were runny so you couldn't put it on your plate with anything else. But if you like sodas you're in luck because the sodas are decent enough to drink. American food- bad. Italian- bad. Mexican food- bad. Asian food- bad. Salad bar-bad. Desserts- so-so. Sodas- decent. Soups- bad. Service-bad. If you think of coming here go anywhere else and I promise a better result.

w_LtL0Q0vNNfHJoBcE8DuA.text: Paid $30.99/person for buffet and unlimited soft drinks. The food quality was better than expected from some of the Yelp reviews. There were certainly things I got that l didn't like, but there were many, many things that looked good that I just didn't have room for.   The crab legs were pre-cracked so it was crazy easy to get out a ton of fresh crab meat. I wish I'd loaded up on more of these my first time around, as the secret had gotten out and increased the line size quite a bit after that.  Aside from that, my favorites were the crab salad (tasted like real crab again), the veggie spring rolls, spicy tuna and california sushi rolls, and cajun crawfish pasta. The poor Mexican station is to the far right and got next to no traffic, which was apparent not only from afar but from up close seeing how the food looked like it had been sitting there a while. I took a chance on the veggie tamales, though, and they did not disappoint.  Tons of dessert options, mostly in the small tart/cupcake variety. Cotton candy was gross. Red velvet cupcake was on point. They would make you a crepe with blueberries/strawberries/bananas and a chocolate sauce. They were small and really runny-- made in a skillet pre-made and not very well done.  Honestly, the only reason I don't give it that fifth star is two things: lack of higher quality meat/sushi that was listed, making it worth $31 each (I saw no steaks at all, just lamb at the Mediterranean station, and only 2 basic sushi roll options) and the wait/line process. Waited for at a minimum 25 minutes (and we were only about the 15th party in line) to pay up front for the buffet, then another 15 minimum for a secondary line to hand a greeter our receipt and have her show us a table. No reason both of these lines couldn't move more quickly. Plenty of space in the restaurant and unnecessary bottlenecking.

NZDB_p1qdYRTHsq7FB0Oxg.text: You know what drives me crazy about buffets?  Those friggin' people who load their WHOLE table with peel and eat shrimp and crab legs - AND DON'T EAT THEM!  Jeebus.  I bought a coupon on Travelzoo and upgraded to All You Can Drink for an extra ten bucks.  At that or price it was worth it.  Most of the Mexican station food had been dried out by the heating lamps.  At the seafood and Eastern station they continued to cook fresh food throughout the evening and strangely  enough, the Chinese food station had better lamb than the Middle Eastern station.  Our service person was lovely and kept us well lubricated with the AYCD wine, even while bussing plates of uneaten shrimp off tables. We gave her a $20 which I thought was reasonable for all the work she did and she was incredibly thankful.   Bottom line - find a Groupon or Travelzoo deal and give it a shot!  Then you can say you've been to a Vegas buffet!

_86XlBqIeiZSQeiKLL4nHw.text: If you crave stale cafeteria food for $35 per person, come here.  It's where food goes to die. I skipped the seafood station altogether - food poisoning waiting to happen and stuck with the salsa bar.  All in all, I really want my money back and am craving Panda Express. Do yourself a favor and go elsewhere.

eWaP7aUb-QQlLK9ZVlNH6Q.text: Came here for their dinner buffet.  If you want to skip the lineup, go for dinner before 1730.  Our wait was less than 10 minutes.  As we sat in, the waiting area magically filled up completely.  The decor and ambience are decent, but it looks like any other mid-end restaurant down there, right down to the TVs placed at strategic spots showing sports.  Hey, if you can't draw customers in for the breathtaking atmosphere.. can't really blame them though, as this venue is actually in the basement of the building.  Yes, the variety in terms of ethnicities is probably among the better buffets in the Harrah's chain, but the food here is mediocre to be honest.  Maybe I was just spoiled as I had hit the Bacchanal (Caesar's) first, followed by Le Village (Paris) before this, but I felt the food was honestly nothing special, especially compared to food back home (Vancouver).  Yes you can get Mexican or Asian here, but overall I found the quality lacking.  The meats were often dry, and several of the dishes were quite bland.  Food is food, but if you are crunched for time, I would recommend going elsewhere for a buffet.

photos.caption: Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert bar~
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Various buffet bits~
Photo of Spice Market Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pineapples~

lyF3fdFESRAP9wh_CRssww.text: It's ok.  There aren't really a lot of choices but it's good.  I think that the price is fair for Las Vegas buffets.  The hostess wouldn't let us sit in a booth which was annoying.   Yes, there were plenty of booths available.  I didn't press it, whatever I'll sit where you want but I won't be back.  It's just "eh".

uIcQ3SmzN3igzUu7Sm6smg.text: Been coming here for 10+ years...This place has become a complete disappointment. Total Rewards chain of Buffets has completely downgraded their quality of food and service. Bought our 24hr buffet as usual, 1st surprise was at Carnival World Buffet at The RIO, they no longer have a stir fry station, the quality of food is a total downgrade, stations are reduced and food really sucks! Next day we headed out to Spice Market Buffet at Planet Hollywood... Surprise again! No omelette station!!! REALLY???? That's the bare minimum standard for a brunch place!!! Mimosas are 1 per person! Oh boy, would have been nice if they told me this before I paid $75!!! YOU GUYS SHOULD BE ASHAMED OF YOURSELVES !!! Stop trying to make an extra buck on your clients and at least be honest and upfront about your less than acceptable service.  I for sure will NEVER COME BACK! People, please don't waste your money here.

tQ6Xv_KQdM697q1MLn8-tQ.text: Came here to eat lunch and purchase an all you can drink... it really takes 15 minutes plus to get your alcoholic drink (regular drinks are self serve ) so it's really not worth it to get the unlimited drinks.  I finally figured out why service was so slow. It was because your server is also the one cleaning up the table...   It seem like the whole restaurant is under staffed.. the waiter is really nice and tries his best but it seem like it's only him covering the whole floor.  Management : please have more worked on the floor !   Would have given this one star but our waiter is nice so +2 star  Food was okay like all buffet

dvj8ivNtsvVD3XQ-__qK1Q.text: All things considered, selection, quality, price and location. This is a very dissatisfying Vegas Buffet experience. Let's start with $28.13 price value for a Tuesday dinner. I promise you'll be much better served at the local Country Corral. Bigger selection too. I tried most items. Not a single hot dish was even warm. Very bland or downright bad tasting. Ambience is nice. No service whatsoever even drink refills are up to you. There's sections, Seafood,Asian, Italian, Mexican and American. Sounds promising until you see Italian is nothing but sausage and peppers, Mexican had chicken fajita with no seasoning and a condiment bar. Seafood had tilapia or mussels. Asian had chicken wings. I've honestly been less disappointed at the Circus Circus Buffet which has been notoriously ripped by reviewers at half the price.

LsGG4stF09zIjpKe0NpDOQ.text: This buffet was one of the best ones back in the day. Like by FAR the best one. Trouble is nothing has been updated since then. The decor looks very old, the food tastes bland and it just feels very very average. They obviously cut back on the budget since it opened and this really shows. There are much better buffets you can visit in vegas, for pretty much the same amount of money (or maybe just a little more)

fjiMcjcugqvMW0zpXNmkBA.text: They have a seafood section with absolutely no plates just one pan of rice and veggies by the way so fun...big expensive.

pEgHqTBPdLWYG3M2mErZeA.text: This was once good, I really enjoyed it when I was last here in 2011. However this time, just wasn't great. Maybe it was the time that I turned up - about 2pm, but the food really just wasn't that good.   The place was quiet and there weren't too many diners. Tables were uncleared and at one point the lady who was taking me to my table asked herself whether there was anybody working the station at all.  The soft drinks were delivered and topped up frequently which was good, but the food - just not that good. The Mediterranean station has grilled lamb that was overdone and chewy, prime rib was similarly overcooked and not worth the time. Surprisingly the mushroom pasta was nice, but I really did wander the entire area not impressed with any of the food. Thankfully I was on a buffet pass and could head elsewhere without having to pay extra.  Spice Market - I won't be coming back.

VncGcTuaSfeskJjxDeTXWQ.text: This place was super good, I went since I was saying in Planet Hollywood my last Vegas trip. There was a lot of variety for a great price too!! A highlight was the prime rib - so good!!

UgVwXvztH-rmpKy15L4Y1Q.text: We ate breakfast here one morning. Overall, for the price it wasn't bad. Nothing to write home about but we got our money's worth compared to eating breakfast at most other restaurants. All the basics, made to order omelette station and a few extras like smoked salmon and cheese blintzes. It's not a very large buffet with tons of choices. If you're not expecting over the top extravagance you'll be fine.

niJp5yGE-XWHkmVYTDjlLA.text: The food quality overall is decent given the price point, but the one star is for the incompetence of the staff. We were there around 5-6:30pm tonight (Wednesday). Our 4 year old daughter is allergic to pistachios, peanuts, and cashews so when eating out we always check if the foods we're ordering for her have any of those ingredients. With buffets, we usually check with the staff that are plating the foods (common sense would be that they would know what goes into the food). There was a lemon macaroon which we specifically asked the staff that was behind the dessert station if it had any peanuts, cashews or pistachios. They told us that it only had almonds and a lemon filling. About 20 minutes later our daughter's eyes were swollen and she broke out in hives. We called Planet Hollywood once we got back to the hotel to talk to the chef to double check the ingredients so we could know of this was a new allergy or not, and come to find out the macaroons did contain pistachios. The chef was surprised that the staff didn't mention it.  Needless to say, we gave her Benadryl, called our on call nurse and are currently monitoring her for any serious signs of a severe allergic reaction. Bottom line, DON'T TRUST THE STAFF TO KNOW WHAT IS IN THE FOODS.  Edit: Just to round out this review, the food was a lot better than the previous time we had tried this buffet. I'm not sure if its because they were busier last night than when we had went before. We got the unlimited drinks option as well, which made the whole experience better. Pretty much stuck to the mimosas as their beer selection is fairly basic. Our friends we went with really like the lamb kabobs served in the Mediterranean section, and I'd have to agree that they were pretty tasty and lean.

dshOiBCsCbUK3nxXjjjqSA.text: SBC VEGAS SERIES: 6 of many reviews Where to eat where to eat? I remember back in the day that this used to be reputedly the best buffet in Vegas.... hmmmmmm  People wake me up to head downstairs for some grub... a lil too much grub. I finally realized why I gave up buffets in the first place.. i can't stop knowing that there's more and more for the taking. Grant it there is a lot of food... enough food for days of binging. They got asian, mexican, italian, and then some. Looks like one of the the boats off of Dangerous Catch off loaded here.   But honestly, i wasn't that excited by it all. Nothing really grabbed me by the taste buds and kicked me in the face. I am much more about quality than quantity... most of the time that is. The most appetizing item in the whole place walked out as i walked in wearing next to nothing in 2 inch stilletos.  *sigh of resignation o_0

NczR5VSfHVYGyDg0ZCIS5A.text: The price of this buffet is a lot more appealing than some of the other buffets, but while you leave somewhat satisfied... the food doesn't knock off your socks.  I came here for brunch and was looking forward to the variety. Sadly, the food had me wondering what the hype was all about, and it's kind of a shame because I like what PH has done with the rest of the place...  The labels were pretty useful, I'll give them that. Everything was just really so-so, and even fun things like seafood were disappointing. The better section was probably the Mexican food. They have all the staples, but just fall really on the mediocre side in terms of quality.  The cotton candy is a lot of fun, so are the different desserts, but I wouldn't run back here for that.  Since going to Vegas is usually a vacation of some sort, I always figure I might as well budget a buffet like Rio or Paris. To eat here again, I'd need it paid for or super discounted.   Bottomline: Move along... nothing much to see here.

4JheHSdVbu2VfxxXlgG7oQ.text: If you participated in the buffet of buffets promotion then the PH buffet, this buffet, is definitely the best one out of the available buffets to choose from. The quality of the food is what sets this place apart from the chain. The room to eat is obvious and that is what makes the lines move faster so you can get yourself up in the game quicker!  No section stands out in particular and I would just recommend trying it all. whatever meets your taste!

fIMY3HE5D3MrdNI-hy_Srg.text: Generally I am not a buffet person. I don't eat a lot and feel that can always get a decent meal at a regular sit down restaurant for what I would pay for a buffet. However on occasion I do enjoy buffets because it gives me a chance to sample a variety of things. This is especially True in good LV buffets because the variety is pretty good.  I can't remember being really disappointed by anything in this buffet except that I always end up here when I don't have a big appetite.

GsrmiqHfmW-H7wTrckuHaA.text: Came here for the breakfast buffet around 9:30 on a Friday morning.  BUSY BUSY.  Quite a long line, but apparently that's standard.  The food was quite good here, nothing really to complain about.  They had little smoothies, which I thought was a fun idea.   The server was excellent, also.  The Corned Beef Hash was excellent and so were the little fried potatoes.  The Eggs Benedict were a bit overcooked, but everything else was great.

r2HX0xwQy2Pnf_pLUZ7RZw.text: Considering we came in 40 minutes before closing time, the food was pretty good. I can say this after going to the all the buffet available at Harrah's buffet special, this one and the Rio are the top buffets in that particular chain.  This one had great service, we were never rushed even as they were starting to clean up. The buffet food was your standard affair: prime rib, asian food, crab legs, etc. Nothing really stood out but at least the prime rib wasn't dry (kind of moist, a little salty). Completely edible.   The only thing I didn't like here was the BBQ pork bun. How can the skin by crispy instead of the soft white fluffy dough?!?

ut0pWc3AeSzmHWwndr4ffA.text: I've eaten here a few times, including my first visit to Vegas 5 years ago, and I think it's gone downhill a bit (maybe since Sheraton took over?).  Because I was staying in Planet Hollywood, and I'm lazy, I ate here for dinner and then again for breakfast.  At dinner, some of the food was pretty good, like the tandoori chicken, seafood enchiladas, and the barbecue ribs, but most of it was just ok.  The service was decent, but that changed the next day.  At breakfast, food again was mixed quality.  The tri-tip steak was delicious, potatoes were good, fruit was decent, most the other stuff (eggs, pastries etc.) was ok.  But the service was fucking awful; we waited about 10 minutes before our server took our order, and when I needed a refill it took a good 15 minutes before our server came by.  And when my friend asked him to replace her OJ because it was super watery, he gave us attitude and told us there was fresh-squeezed OJ at the buffet (which was not True).  He was a dick, and for maybe the first time ever i didn't leave a tip at all.  Spice Market used to regularly top the list of Vegas buffets, but either it's gone downhill or my expectations were too high.  It's still decent but I won't be back for awhile.

s2q4gGa0iPlhGempuUbjXg.text: We've eaten here before for Breakfast and had a great time, so I was expecting more of the same for Dinner.  Unfortunately, they didn't deliver.  It's not that the food was bad, it's just that it didn't stand out.  The Mexican food was ok, the Pizza......meh, the Prime Rib was tasty though and pretty tender.  My biggest disappointment was the crab though.  I was happy to see that they offered steamed snow crab, but upon closer inspection, it was pretty dry.  It's not like we showed up at 9:45pm either.  I usually fill up on crab alone, but I barely grabbed like 6 legs.  Kinda sad.  The dessert station was pretty nice though and the cobbler was actually pretty good with a nice crunchy crust.  Maybe next  time we'll just stick to the breakfast buffet.

yiPiPjDgcSfqI0cqDtOBsA.text: Planet Hollywood guests get $5 dollar off coupons to the Spice Market buffet, so how could we resist!! We went during brunch time and our meal came out to less than 20 bucks! Pretty cheap compared to other buffets on the strip. Although the price didnt come with bottomless mimosas.   What I like best about the Spice Market is the Middle Eastern section! The chicken tandor, naan, hummus, etc was great! The chicken wasnt even dry. During brunch they also had made to order omelet's! So delish and you can get whatever you want on them. Down the way they have the normal buffet food, rib eye, mexican, italian, chinese, nothing that stood out.   I was disappointed when I didnt see crab legs!! I crave for crab legs in any buffet! The seafood section wasnt to grand. Although they have serve tempura shrimp steaming hot out of the fryer. The cocktail shrimp was good and they come already peeled and.  The DESSERT! They had everything from soft served ice cream, cotton candy, flan, bread pudding, red velvet cake, carrot cake, chocolate cake, tarts etc!! They have made to order crepes ( but the crepes are pre made and not freshly cooked!!)  The wait is not the long compared to other buffets food is good and the waiters are so friendly! Highly recommend to try the middle eastern food and dessert section!

h4iO8A4l7UsVT1mFDsbnAg.text: I came here for an early dinner and there was no line, which was nice.  However, I got the feeling that I was eating the leftover food from the lunch rush.  Most of the breads and rice dishes were dried out and the seafood was, well, very fishy.  I would avoid the raw oysters.  However, some of the food was good.  The tomato basil soup was great and the falafel and hummus made me very happy.  The sushi was also surprisingly good.  My b/f was pleasantly surprised by the meat and ate platefuls of lamb, ribs, and other animals.  The veggies were just ok, but the desserts were great.  The atmosphere is very hip and trendy and they gave us a booth, which was nice.    For $25, in Vegas, if you are looking to fill up on all you can eat, it is not bad.

39YwsJh3zAKao3wzivSHtA.text: I just went to this buffet this past weekend and it turned out to be one SWEET suprise. :)  For the price of only $25, there was a HUGE selection of food. My favorite foods of the buffet includes huge Alaskan Crab Legs and fresh shrimp cocktails (yum!) They have beautifully decorated desserts that all look sooo good, but my stomach had room for only 2. I had the creme brulee and the tiramisu, and they were absolutely delicious.  From the Middle Eastern food section, I tried the basmati rice, which was really good, grinded lamb stuffed in tomatoes, pita + hummus and kabobs. From the Italian section, I tried some white sauce pasta, pizza loaded with tons of ham, and some other stuff that apparently didn't leave a lasting impression. They also had an Asian and Mexican food section, which were also pretty good.  Save room for dessert, because I was just in awe of all the variety of pretty-colored desserts that they had. If I could, I would have tried every single dessert - but that wouldn't be too good for my body, now would it? :)  If you don't want to pay $40 for a more expensive buffet, definitely go with this one. For almost half the price, you get a really good selection, and you will definitely leave happy.

EYY1bCBfMi9raGO5H-hTLQ.text: TIP - sign up for their players card and you will get a coupon book with $5 the buffet and other deals.  You can also find them handing out 10% coupons outside their hotel.  Overall, I thought the food was pretty good.  It is nicely laid out into sections via cuisine - Italian, Asian, Mexican, etc.  I thought their seafood section was a little lacking, but they had a great stuffed sole and some large mussels.  Their kabobs are very tasty and they have a good selection of pizza and pastas in their Italian section.  For those that go to the buffet but hate buffet food (weird, I know), there is a made-to-order grill station where you can customize your own hamburger.  Oh and don't forget to eat their COTTON CANDY!  Talk about sugar high...

WGoidRIhbrHm2KvzNutvDw.text: Went here for the lunch buffet/early dinner last week and overall I was disappointed right from the get go. First of all I waited in line for what seemed forever because the hostess was to busy talking to a co-worker and was actually eating something. Once I got past that I went to the table where it took a good 10 to 15 min for them to bring out a iced tea. As far as the food that I had the crab legs where decent there just wasn't a lot of meat but I expected that for a lunch buffet. However I had to really look around to find anything else that was edible and really didn't have any success. The seafood other than the crab legs and shrimp looked bad. The Italian food looked like it had been sitting all day. The American station wasn't appealing at all. They did have flank steak on the craving station but I didn't try that because I had some kind of other beef from the middle Eastern station and it was really tough. The desserts where awful took a couple and just took a bite and threw them away. Also the whole time I was there nobody came to pick up plates and the whole section I was in was the same way. I think there are better options than eating here and I probably wouldn't go back.

pbkp6R6NZAiXzBkty4Ww6Q.text: This review is strickly for the Breakfast Buffet.   Wow! this place is not good at all. Although there was a generous amount of food to choose from, my GF and i did not find anything worth mentioning about. From the runny eggs, to old crunch rice, to soggy bacon, omelette station that only had 4 ingredients, to stale pastries, and warm smoothies, i was better off going to Bill's and getting the $4.95 ribeye and eggs breakfast (which is not saying alot). we were very disappoint with this place. i'm glad that we only paid $10.99 each because of a coupon, but still think we overpaid!

runa-t2deOovklpeKloh0g.text: The Spice Market Buffet gets 4 stars for being the best-bang-for-ya-buck amongst all the numerous buffets in Las Vegas.  It really is quite a deal, considering the variety and quality of the food you get.  We got our buffets for only $ 13-14/person, and that was the lunch buffet!  That's a steal, considering the Wynn buffet is like $25, and the selection of hot food is not nearly as good as at the Spice Market.    Spice Market consistently wins the "best buffet" in Vegas mainly for it's affordability and top-notch quality.  It won in 2006 and again in 2007, and I'm sure it will be up again for 2008.  Granted, when you come to Spice Market, you don't really expect food like at the Bellagio buffet. But honestly in a blind-folded test, I think I would like the Spice Market buffet more than the Bellagio buffet.     The atmosphere is casual/modern, and there are nice green booths as well as open tables.  The colors range from khakis, to greens, to yellows, all in all to make a pleasant eating experience.  On the walls are several flat screen TVs showing the Food Network, so you can think about delicious dishes even more, and let your food digest while you look at someone else's fabulous finds on TV!  Spice Market has awesome pork ribs.  These ribs are flavorful and juicy, and practically melt off the bone.  They're exceptionally good, and I'm not really a rib person, but I kept going back for more of these!!  They also have awesome skewered roasted veggies at the Indian food station.
